1.content:
To start the story, you'll need to choose which character's viewpoint you'd like to write the adventure from:

You can choose to be Summer Salt, precocious, problem-solving young 11-year-old with a head for mysteries and feet that are off-the-scales ticklish.

Or, be Summer's little sister Mouse, who always follows her big sister around, usually leading them both into one humiliating predicament after another.

Or, you can choose to be one of Summer's clue-sleuthing friends, Jamie or Chris, who may be either boy or girl, but are both even more ticklish than Summer, if that's even possible!

Alternately, you can write the interactive from the viewpoint of one of Summer's adversaries, either the Clown Prince, a maniacal criminal mastermind in a tuxedo and clownface, who delights in trapping and humiliating children with tickling torments; or Pao-Ting, the young genius exchange-student who always tries to thwart Summer and the gang.

11.content:
“Gosh, we sure were lucky to run into that kindly old-timer back there at the junkyard who told us about this shortcut onto the Featherton property, huh gang?”, queried Summer Salt, girl detective, as she and her friends carefully made their way down the overgrown path through the fog-covered cemetery.

“Did it strike you as odd that he was wearing a tuxedo, not unlike notorious meanie The Crown Prince, who’s rumored to be in the area, and quite possibly at the bottom of these recent disappearances, Summer?”, shot back her friend, junior-sleuther Jamie.

“Sheer coincidence, I’d wager. He’s likely just trying to go upscale with his junkyard to attract a higher clientele. Remember Jamie: as a junior-sleuther, it’s important not to jump to every wild conclusion that comes to mind. Now, somewhere up ahead we should be able to spot that sign leading into the Secret Entrance that the old man mentioned…”.

Suddenly, from out of the mist behind the kids, a scream, “EEEEEK!”.

“That sounded like Mouse!”, said Summer, “How many times must I tell her to stay home when we go out junior-sleuthing! You two go on ahead while I backtrack and find my little brat of a sister.”

Summer opened the door and the gang stepped in before clearly being able to see the content of the room.

Clown Girls.

The clown girls, clearly, were not expecting visitors. They were merely chatting casually, some of them lacking their make up, or some of them lacking some of their characteristics clothes articles. The quiet buzz of their friendly chatter stopped dead on its tracks when the group of four girls entered the room.

All of the clown girls turned at once to look at them. Some of them had their mouths open agape, finding hard to believe that such an opportunity could present itself like this. Some other had less trouble believing it, and began to smile with glee.
Some of them stood up, facing the teen detective and her friends.

She was wearing a sleeveless white shirt with many drawings of silhouettes of cartoonish feet, in different sizes and colors, as well as a rainbow-striped skirt that reached the middle of her thighs.
She wasn’t wearing any shoes. Her pretty and dainty feet were adorned with one different color for each toenail.

All of the clown girls stood up and began to walk towards the girls.

1111211221221121122213122.content:
“Not a chance. Girls--!” Before Summer could finish her phrase, Footsie emptied the content of her spray can on the four girls. It was a thick pink cloud that engulfed them completely. The girls began to cough, swatting their arms around in a useless attempt at clearing the air around them. Still, Footsie’s attack had been so quick that it took them off guard, and none of them was able to prevent themselves from breathing in some of the pink mist.
The first thing they realized was that it smelled strangely sweet. Like cotton candy and lollipops.
The second thing they realized is that, being completely engufled in the pink gas, they didn’t have a choice but to breath it, a bit more with each breath they gave.
The third they realized is how badly they began to feel the need to laugh so suddenly. It was… a really strange feeling. It began as a bubbling, trembling sensation inside their bellies, slightly euphoric at first. In a matter of a few seconds, everything around them began to seem absolutely hilarious, ridiculous, hysterical even! Being trapped in a evil mansion, full of clown girls? People from the town captured to be tickled on the soles of their feet? A tickling ghost that haunted the mansion? Every single thing seemed funnier than the one before.

That’s why they began to laugh. All four of them. It started as a few restrained chuckles, but very soon all of them felt how a powerful urge to laugh louder each time slowly took over them. The chuckled turned into giggles, the giggles turned into laughter, the laughter turned into cackles, the cackles turned into deep belly guffaws and howls of completely hysterical laughter.
In a matter of seconds and with no effort, Footsie had reduced the gang of four smart and spunky girls to laughing fools that guffawed like if there was no tomorrow.

“Hmmmm perhaps the hard way isn’t so hard after all, huh? I mean, look at you, having the time of your life, cutie pie!” Footsie said in front of Summer’s face. The girl detective could only let out her hysterical howls of laughter and merely point with her finger at the clown girl in front of her, slapping her own forehead.
“HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!” was all the sound that came out of her, or out of any of the girls, for that matter. Summer knees quickly failed her, and she collapsed onto them.
Next to her, Mouse simply landed flat on her back, her arms and legs sprawled around her, while she laughed as hard as she never laughed before. She couldn’t comprehend why everything was so funny to her now, but she wasn’t going to put any resistance against it. She merely let herself being carried away by waves and waves of loud, neverending hysterics.
A few feet behind her, Chris lied on the floor, curled up into a ball. The possibility of she and her friends being captured by the clown girls and subjected to some extremely effective foot tickling seemed hysterical, exhilarating even! Warm tears of laughter ran down her cheeks while she mused that scenario.
Still standing on her long and slender legs was Jamie, the biggest of the four friends. Everyone, clown girls included, were surprised to see that the highest and most ridiculous laughter, came from the girl with the most “adult” voice, body, and attitude. She was also facepalming herself, taken over by laughter as she pointed to Footsie like if the clown girl was the funniest thing she was ever going to see in her life.

“Oh, you’re still on your feet, I see. Do you think we can change that?” Footsie teased the girl, who continued to howl with silly deep belly laughs.
“WOOHOOHOOHOOHOOHOHOHOAHAHAHAHAHAHA!”
Footsie simply shoved her gently on her shoulders, making the poor teen girl land right on her rear end, unable to get up again.
“Man, I love laughing gas. It makes everything so easy.” Footsie said. Her fellow clown girls shared a giggle with her. It was almost inaudible, though. The sound of four sets of hysterical laughter filled the whole room completely.
“Anywho, I think we should show these audacious little girls what happens to those we trap. Specially when they are audacious little girls.”

Her fellow clown girls helped Footsie to prepare the girls for what was to come. They began to pick up the girls as the helplessly laughing heaps they had turned into under the effects of the pink gas, and putting them inside something that very much resembled a sleeping bag.

It wasn’t any sleeping bag, though.

It was a cushioned cocoon of sorts, with enough room to encase the girls up to their necks. With only their heads sticking out, the four girls ended up snuggled and unable to move in any fashion from the neck down.
It wasn’t of any concern to them, though. Still under the effects of the gas, the girls continued to find everything about them from funny to absolutely hysterical, during several more minutes.
Still, the gas had effects that lingered for a little bit more. And despite their dire situation, they couldn’t shake off a giddy sense of sillines inherent to the whole situation. They weren’t cracking up, but still sputtered a few girlish giggles and chuckles here and there.

“Well, I told you it was the hard way!” Footsie said jokingly. All four girls laughed at the joke, like if they weren’t completely restrained and in the hands of mischievous clown girls at that moment. Said clown girls found that adorable.

“And all of it because you tried to run away when I merely offered you to entertain you! Kids these days…” Another silly joke from Footsie. Another good-natured laugh from the girls.

“And *teeheeheeheehee* how were you going to do that?” Mouse asked, her usual naivete being amplified by the lingering effects of the laughing gas.

“Oh, well, I usually like to tell people the origin of my name. You don’t find that many people around called Footsie, after all. She snapped her fingers, and at once many of her fellow clown girls kneeled at the girls’ helpless feet, and began to slowly untie their shoelaces. They all felt it, but instead of a sense of dread and impending doom, they felt the rush of being playing the funnest game of their lives!
“Oh no! They’re gohohohohohoing to tickle our feet!” Said Chris, tittering with giggles at the idea.
“What? Tickling? What would make you think of that?” Said Footsie, in a nonchalant tone. “Nope, tickling won’t be involved in this at all.”

All of the girls felt their respective sneakers getting loose on their feet. The feeling of playfulness excitement in their chests only grew. In their giddy state, it was like if it was impossible to feel anything other that playful silliness.
Slowly but surely, the clown girls began to take off the girl’s shoes. They made it at a deliberately slow pace, generating nervous giggles and chuckles in their captives.
The clown girls were greeted by four pairs of adorable looking girly feet, encased in different kind of socks. Summer had a simple pair of white cotton ankle-high socks; Mouse next to her was sporting a pair of colorful, mismatched socks, with a purple left sock with yellow polka dots, and a right pink one with color stripes across it. Jamie had dark grey socks with cartoony skulls all over them, while Chris had baby blue socks with smiling fat kawaii cats.

“Teeheeheeheehee I’m sure pretty sure we’re gohohohing to get tickled anywahahahayheeheeheheheheehee” Summer said, still trying to make sense of the situation, even under the effects of the gas.

“Pssssssh, where would you get that idea? Nonsense.” Said Footsie. “By the way… you all have some cute socks!”
Over their own giggles, the girls were able to hear the clown girls comenting on their socks, appreciating their details and such.

“Like I was saying, I don’t always get the chance to tell people why I’m called Footsie. And no tickling involved, honest, I swear. It’s not much of a mystery, you see…” With devilish sluggishness, Footsie began to pull from the tip of the toes of Summer’s right sock, making it slide ever soooooo slooooooowly from her dainty little foot, until with a last “pop!” it came off completely.
Summer wiggled her toes out of reflex. A few nervous giggles escaped her lips as she did so.
Footsie sat at the feet of the restrained teen detective and showed her own bare feet to her.
“... it’s because it’s favorite game to play, that’s all. And I’ve heard I’m quite good at it, too. Here, let me show you.” The clown girl finished her sentence, and began to press gently her own bare feet against Summer’s.

The teen sleuth flinched, shaked her head from side to side, but it didn’t took her more than two seconds to start ricocheting giggles out of her lips.

“Pfffffffehehehehehehehehehehehehe don’t ahahehehehehehehehehehe my feet hahahahahahaha are so tickleeheeheeheesheeheeheeheeheehee!”
While she laughed herself silly, Footsie merely looked at her with an innocent smile, pretending not to notice the effect she was having on the girl detective.

“Oh, you are that ticklish? Oh, I’m so sorry… I really didn’t mean to tickle you. I just wanted to show you how I like to play footsie. Like I said, I’m quite confident in my own skills. I’d say it feels quite pleasant, wouldn’t you say?” Footsie’s voice was simply delightful to hear. Her tone was calm, sweet, and loving, almost motherly. But at the same time it was bubbling with provocation.
And worst of all was, as much as Summer hated to admit it, it did feel nice on her feet. Hell, it felt great. Footsie’s feet were warm to the touch, something much welcome on her own tired feet. Not to mention, her touch was merely a few movements away from being a soothing massage. But, being as ticklish as she was, Summer couldn’t resist laughing when the silky surface of Footsie’s bare soles came in contact with her own two feet, the bare one and the socked one.

11112112212211211222131221.content:

“Hahahahahahahaha no! Hahahahahahaha please hahahahahahaha tickle my feet hahahahahahaha!”

“By the way, girls, I think perhaps you should follow suit. Who knows, perhaps we’ll also find out Summer’s friends also like to get tickled after all!”

“Hahahahahahahaha okay hahahahahaha I confess HAhahaHaahhaha! I like getting tickled toohoohoohoohooahahahahahahahahaha!”
“And you like to play footsie too, huh? So then I guess you must be looooooooving this so much!”
“Hahahahahaha I ahahahaham hahahahahahahahaha!”

“Ooooh girls, this one is blushing a lot! I think some girl here really likes to play footsie…”

“HahahAhaHAHAHAHA shuhuhuhuhut uhuhuhuhuhuhp hahahahahahahahahahahaha!”

“Ohohohohohohoho! Woohoohoohoohohohohahahahahahahahahahaha! Hahahahahahahahahahahahaha!” Long, sustained bouts of laughter erupted constantly from Jamie’s mouth. It was a funny spectacle to witness. The tallest, more mature girl of the group, the one with the more adult sounding voice and the one with the bigger feet, cackling hysterically in a way that was almost comical. “I love when the biggest ones are the most ticklish! And also you have such a fun laughter to hear, baby girl!” The clown girl playing with Jamie’s feet teased her.
“Hahahahahahahahaha thahahahahahanks ahahahahaha! HAhahahahaha! Ohohohohohohohohoho!” Jamie simply responded naturally and by continuing to laugh out loud, unable to do anything else, or even to oppose resistance to those sensations coming from her long soles.

“Hahahahahahahahaha I am a ticklish little babeheeheeheeheeheehaahahahahahahahohoohoohoohoohohohohahahahahaha!”

The teen sleuth and her friends continued to laugh wantonly as the minutes passed by. More confessions about their hidden love for being tickled were taken from them, as well as personal and other people’s ticklish and weak spots. The clown girls learned about how Summer’s neck was insanely ticklish too, how Jamie was really feather ticklish, or how Mouse couldn’t resist having a raspberry blown against her soles.
The girls lost their remaining socks as the massive game of footsie went on. Footsie, the clown girl, also took her time to play with each and every girl, although she realized Summer was her favorite. The game of footsie evolved into other forms of tickling, like playing Hangman on the girls’ soles, or silly games of “Spy Interrogation”, countless rounds of “this little piggy”, and more.
The girls laughed during hours, leaving the effects of the laughing gas way behind them, and laughing only due to the loving tickles on the soles of their bare and helpless feet. During all that time, they realized something: they were truly enjoying being tickled in such a way.
“How come I’m liking this? What’s wrong with me?” Summer though to herself. “I hate to admit it, but… it feels great! And is so much fun… have I alway been like this, or did this place did something to me?”

With her mind still pondering possibilities, Footsie approached Summer’s face, to get a good look of her laughing while her fellow clown girls continued to tickle her feet.
“This was an interesting discovery, wouldn’t you say? Summer Salt, girl detective… and secret tickling lover! It’s so great to know you’re like the rest of us…” Footsie’s voice oozed with genuine joy.
In return, Summer could only keep on laughing.
“Since you like this, I guess we could show you where’s the rest of the people that we brought here… We are playing fun games like this with them too and such. I’ll bet you’ll love it!”
Summer couldn’t speak, but her thoughts bounced against each other inside her head, confusing her. “I think… damn it, I think I’d like that! How can I be thinking this is actually fun? I came here to rescue that people, and now… I’m going to join them!”
“In fact…” Footsie continued. “... I’ll bet you’ll not only love that, but you’ll love it here, as well. We could play like this forever!”
Footsie’s words sinked in into Summer’s mind. She looked at her sides and saw her little sister and her friends, delighted in being so helpless, laughing to their heart's content. She imagined herself and her gang, in a room full of people subjected to the most creative and mischievous forms of tickling. Her own voice and laughter mingled with the rest as the clown girls would render them helpless with tickles, while she felt happily submissive.
“Hahahahahahahahahaha yehehehehehhehes ahahahahahahahahahahaha!” She surprised herself saying.
“Oooooh, that’s so great!” Footsie cheered. “I know you will love it here…” The clown girl said. ‘Loving it here’ meant being captive and tickled along with her sister and friends for Summer… but she knew inside her the clown girl was right. She was going to love that. What was happening to her?

“Welcome home, Summer!” Footsie said to her laughing face. Somehow, the teen sleuth felt that was right. She felt strangely at home.

Its most stunning feature, though, were its eyes, which simultaneously had a faraway look while containing a very obvious madness. Summer gawked and thought, this can't be real; this must be... a hologram or something!
But then the thing spoke, its voice echoing through the room and waking up the clown girl who stared at it in wonder and fear. "Children fighting... fighting is naughty... bad children must be punished... I will punish them daddy..." it said, as though it was in a trance.
Then the being knelt down next to Summer's and the clown girl's feet. It's just a hologram and a recording. It's just light and sound waves. It can't actually tickle me! ...Can it? Summer got her answer when the apparition daintily lowered its fingers onto her and the clown girl's feet. Next to her, the clown girl was already in hysterics- struggling and screaming and begging for all she was worth. Apparently her feet were even more ticklish than Summer's!
But Summer didn't think about that for very long because then this thing did the eeriest thing Summer had ever experienced; it slid its fingers through her feet and them on both the inside and the outside at the same time. The sensation was unlike anything she'd ever felt, and Summer's body didn't seem to know how to cope with it. In between her laughing, she screamed, snorted, sneezed and even had the hiccups! Furthermore, her feet didn't seem to have a clue how to dodge this attack, and the cold was making it harder to move them, so before long Summer's feet didn't even struggle anymore.
But the worst part was when the ghastly fingers slid up to the toes; even if Summer scrunched up her toes, the feathery fingers were still able to phase through them, tickling under and between them at the same time. Both Summer and the clown girl drifted into silent laughter, but the clown was lucky; she fainted soon after the toe tickling started.
Summer, however, stayed conscious throughout this ordeal, and the whole time, what remained of her logical mind was thinking, This can't be real! Finally, something occurred to her. Sherlock Holmes used to say that once you've eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, no matter how improbable, must be the truth. In this case, no mortal being could defy the laws of physics like this creature could. Therefore...
This must be the real ghost of Ms. Hildegard Featherton!

Summer gasped with terror at what she saw in the coffin. A large, shadowed figure of a man stood erect within, and a pair of baleful red eyes gazed down at the two Salt sisters. Before she could do anything to protect herself or her sister, Summer everything went black as Summer passed out.

When she came to, Summer couldn't tell how long she had been out. Groggy and disoriented, the image of those red eyes was etched into her mind, and she shivered, wondering what had happened. She tried to move, but found that she couldn't. The grogginess faded away rapidly as she began struggling against whatever was holding her. She couldn't see anything, even though her eyes were open. She was about to scream in fear and frustration when a voice came from her left.

"Summer?" Mouse sounded scared. "Is that you?"

Summer calmed down at hearing her sister's voice. "Yeah, it's me. Are you alright?"

"No...I can't see, and I can't move, and I'm scared." Mouse sounded like she was about to cry.

"I know...I'm in the same position." Now that she was calm, Summer more closely examined her predicament. She seemed to be sitting in a rather large chair, with soft cushions on the seat and back. She could feel a soft fabric wrapped around her head. A blindfold, which prevented her from seeing anything. Her wrists were tied together in front of her, and a rope was holding her elbows against the back of the chair. The same rope seemed to be wrapped across her elbows and just below her ribs, tightly securing them to the back of the chair. Another rope held her waist secured to the chair's back as well. Her knees and ankles had been tied together, and she could feel her legs stretched out before her. Her calves rested on what felt like a large padded footrest, and were secured to it with more rope, leaving her feet hanging slightly over the far edge. She could only assume Mouse was in a similar situation.

"Mouse, do you remember what happened after we opened the coffin?"

"No...I just remember seeing these mean-looking red eyes, and then I woke up here just a few minutes before you did." Mouse whimpered. "I'm glad you are here, Summer. I thought I was going to be alone, and I was really scared."

Summer was about to say that she would do her best to protect her little sister, when they heard the eerie creaking of a door opening up nearby. Heavy footsteps entered the room, and then the door creaked closed with a soft click.

"Well, I'm glad to see you young ladies are awake." The voice was masculine but soft, and held a tone of self-confidence and charm. "Did you sleep well?"

The girls answered with questions of their own, shouting at their captor in unison, but asking different questions. Summer shouted "Who are you?" while Mouse yelled "Where are we?"

"Silence, children. There is no need for yelling. As for your questions, you are on the top floor of the Manor, in one of the master bedrooms. I am Count Featherton, owner of this Mansion."

"Count Featherton?" Summer asked, perplexed. "But this Mansion has been abandoned for years."

"Yes, well, I have been out of commission for some time, but being a vampire does have its advantages...such as immortality."

"Vampire?!" Mouse squeaked. Summer could suddenly hear her younger sister struggling to free herself.

"You can't seriously expect us to believe that." Summer said, trying to sound brave. "Everyone knows vampires don't exist."

"Believe what you will." Featherton said. "I assure you, I am quite real. Which brings us to a question of my own: there was a pendent locked in the lid of my coffin. The coffin you girls opened up. It acted as a lock, preventing the coffin from opening unless the pendent was removed. Seeing as the coffin was opened and I was released, you must have removed the pendent. I want to know where it is."

A moment of silence fell. Neither of the girls had any idea what pendent the man was talking about. There hadn't been anything of the sort on the outside of the coffin that they had seen.

"I don't know anything about any pendent." Summer stated. "Now can you let us go?"

"I'm afraid not." The man replied, his voice thick with mock-disappointment. "Don't take it too personally if I don't believe you, but I will have to take steps to get the truth out of you."

"Are you going to eat us?" Mouse squeaked in fear.

"Heavens no, child!" The man laughed. "At least, not in the way you probably fear I will. You see, I am a special breed of vampire. While others of my kind delight in the taste of blood, I feed on something far less substantial."

"And what is that?" Summer asked, growing more nervous as the situation played out. She could almost hear the smile on the man's lips when he responded.

"Now that would be telling...and I've always found it more fun for my victims to find out on their own." The sisters swallowed in fear. "Now, I must ask again, and if you refuse, then I shall begin my methods of extracting the information from you. Where did you hide the pendent?"

"We don't know what pendent you're talking about!" Mouse shouted.

"She's right," Summer nodded. "There wasn't any pendent in the coffin when we opened it."

"Then I see I shall have to do this the hard way." The man faked a sigh of frustration.

Summer heard the man walk over to her left, near Mouse. There was silence for a moment, except for some faint shuffling noises.

"What are you doing?" Mouse asked, half confused half scared. "Don't take off my shoes...leave those on...why--wait, no, leave my socks on! Why are you doing this?"

Summer's mind was racing. What could this man possibly do to them that required they lose their shoes and socks? It didn't make any sense. Then her heart sank into her stomach as she listened to Mouse's reaction.

"EEP! Oh no! Nononono! Not that! I can't stand that! AAH! No, please, don't ti--hihihhihihihihihihahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!" Mouse's plea dissolved into frantic giggles, which turned into frenzied laughter. But she didn't need to finish the word for Summer to figure out what was happening. The man intended to tickle torture them. Her feet twitched nervously at the thought. Both girls were insanely ticklish, especially on their feet, which both girls regarded as their worst tickle-spot. They avoided any situation that had the potential for tickling like it was the plague. Summer wanted to scream; she knew that her own feet were at least twice as ticklish as Mouse's were.

"Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha! Ohohohohohohoh plehehehehehehease! Hahahahahahahahahaha--stop! Stohahahahahahahap tiheheheheheheheheckling mehehehehehehehe!"

"Only if you tell me where you hid the pendent." The man told her firmly, talking over Mouse's laughter.

"Hahahahahahahaha--I--hahahahahahahahahahaha--I don't--hahahahahahahahahahaha--I dohohohohohon't know whehehehehehere it is! Hahahahahahahaha--GYAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!" Summer shuddered as she heard her little sister scream in hysterical laughter. "NOHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAT THERE! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA--NO! PLEASE! STAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAP!"

Summer could only listen as her sister was tickled mercilessly for the next several minutes. Sometimes she only giggled without end, other times she screamed in hysteria. But always she begged the man to stop tickling her. Summer was reaching a breaking point. She couldn't stand to hear her sister tickled much longer, and wanted to say something to end her torture. But she knew in doing so, she'd be putting her own super-ticklish feet up on the tickling block.

11112121111.content:
Mouse's tiny feet hurried over the cool floor tiles of the mausoleum. Not having her shoes did not bother her yet, she'd have time to worry about catching a cold later since right now she was so focused on getting away. In fact the cold sensation on her bare soles and toes felt kind of good, taking away some of the nervous tingling caused by the foot tickling she had received earlier. She stopped halfway through the exit and spun around on her tiptoes to see what was happening behind her, and let out a sigh of relief when she saw that there wasn't a vampire behind her. Just then though, as she was backing out, somebody whispered into her ear:
"Where are you going little girl? I'm gonna getchuu~"

She screamed, dropped on her knees, turned her head around, saw Count Featherton, then she half ran half crawled away from him and sprinted into the forest. Out of breath as soon as she felt she was out of sight she crawled under a bush as fast as she could manage. Peeking out from her hiding place, she could see the figure of the old vampire sweep past murmuring things like:
"Where are you hiding, little one? You know you can't hide yourself from me, I'm gonna find you and get you...~"

As she lied there with her hands on her mouth trying to keep quiet, it suddenly occured to her what this situation reminded her of.

It resembled a game she used to play it with their mom.
Whenever Mouse was bored and had nothing to do, she'd find her mother who'd usually be working on something around the house, and bother her to get her attention or intentionally do something that'd tick her off. It was Mouse's way of signalling she wanted to play their chase & punishment game.

One time she walked around the house with a pair of cymbals, another time she stole her pencil while she was out for a minute, another time she would crawl under her chair and poke her foot with her finger until she lost focus. (Mouse and Summer's mother had just as frightfully ticklish feet as her daughters). She'd usually try to ignore her first, then, when she had had enough, she sprung up and chased her all over the house with Mouse running away from her screaming and laughing. Mouse'd then often hide under a bed or a pile of clothes or sheets and waited in excitement for her mother to find her. When she did, she'd usually tickle her all over until they were both exhilarated and exhausted. It was a really fun mother-daughter pastime for rainy days and weekends.

Sometimes while she was hiding (especially if her mother was slow to find her), she'd let her foot stick out from her hiding place on purpose and waited excitedly for those unseen fingers to start teasing them. Her mother would always sneak up on her without making a noise if she spotted her, and the anticipation and thrill that came with waiting for her and not seeing her was some of the best feelings she ever knew.

It was rare for Summer to participate in her games (she'd usually sigh and shake her head in disapproval if she saw her causing trouble), but there was one memorable occasion: their mother was called away halfway without Mouse knowing while she was hiding in Summer's room and she did not hear Summer arrive home. All she noticed was that as she was lying under her sister's bed, she suddenly felt two hands around her ankles trying to pull her out. All that achieved though that she became lodged under the mattress - she could've told Summer that she did not get in that way. When she realized this, Summer sighed, then she tickled her feet for the rest of the afternoon until she promised not to go into her room again a dozen times.

Since Summer considered tickling to be torturous unlike her younger sis, Mouse always treasured the memory of that time.

As she was waiting there all crouched up, her two feet tucked under her, she realized (with some disgust) that although the situation was more serious it gave her a similar kind of thrill too. While Summer was no doubt annoyed whenever she wasn't in control and would have preferred for things to go smoothly for her apart from the occassional puzzle-solving challenge, for Mouse it was different: being chased around by dark figures, her imagination running wild with what was going to happen to her if she was found, this was closer to Mouse's idea for adventure.

She realized that she must've been lying there for ten full minutes and remembered that she was a helpful younger sister too whose duty was to rescue her older sister. But how'd she know that Count Featherton wasn't only hiding himself, waiting for her nearby to reveal herself?

1111212112.content:
The vampire turned to look in surprise at the newcomers. It was just starting to believe that the Salt sisters really didn't know where the pendant was, and if that was true, then maybe these two girls had stolen it. Even if they hadn't, the count was eager to get more victims into his stocks.
But what the vampire didn't expect was for Jamie to pull out silver spoon and start waving it at him. "Back, you monster! Get away from our friends!" Despite how silly it looked, it was working. Although Count Featherton was virtually immortal, the mere sight of silver caused him to scream in pain and cover his eyes. For a couple moments, the vampire's will was strong enough to try and attack Jamie and Chris, but when Jamie wacked the spoon on Count Featherton's face, he let out an unearthly squeal and ran from the room as fast as he could.
Jamie breathed a sigh of relief and turned to Chris. "See, I told you this thing would be useful."
"You were right," Chris conceded, starting to undo Mouse's bonds. "Now stop gloating and get Summer out of that thing."
After Mouse and Summer were released, Mouse, Jamie and Chris waited for Summer to regain consciousness and then explained what happened. Summer was confused by one thing, though, "Wait, how did you know about the vampire, Jamie? I mean, he's not mentioned in the town legends; they say the ghost of Hildegard Featherton haunts the mansion."
"True, but how many of them have actually been in the mansion?" Jamie pointed out. "When we were wandering around that place, I saw a painting of Count Featherton and there was an inscription under it that said, 'When night falls, he who feeds on the living will rise from his tomb,' and that didn't match up with the local myths. So when we stopped by the kitchen and saw the rare silverware, I thought I'd be prepared for other kinds of undead."
"I told her she was acting more like one of the Ghost Busters than a Junior Sleuth," Chris added, "but it looks like I eat my words on this one."
Summer laughed and reassured him saying, "Don't worry about it; I would've said the same thing before meeting that creep. Still, this mystery isn't solved yet. We... kinda accidently released Count Featherton ourselves, and that means he couldn't have been the one kidnapping people. Did you find any clues suggesting who else might be here?"
Chris and Jamie shook their heads. Summer puzzled over this for a few moments; someone's been kidnapping children and that someone was probably the same person who stole the pendant that locked Count Featherton in his coffin. But who was it and what was their goal?
Eventually Summer said, "We're not going to learn anything by sitting around here, and as long as you have that spoon, we should be safe from Count Featherton. I think we should go back to the mansion and keep looking for clues."
None of the others wanted to stay while there was a vampire lurking about, but Summer's logic was sound. And so, the group traversed up the stairs from Count Featherton's secret dungeon into the mansion and started searching through the various rooms.
After about thirty minutes had passed, Summer thought she heard someone talking. She motioned for her friends to stop and listen, and sure enough they heard a muffled female. Cautiously, Summer followed the sound into a bedroom. Upon opening the door, she could hear the unseen girl moaning and mumbling, "Daddy won't find me here... not this time... I won't go back... Why did he have to wake up?... Not now... I'm not ready... It's okay... I'll be safe here... he won't take me back this time... he can't..."
Something about these words seemed very eerie, but Summer's curiosity urged her to keep following the sound. She walked into the room and when she passed by the bed, the voice said, "Shh... he's here... be very quiet... maybe he'll won't look under here..."
"Look under here?" Summer thought, glancing at the bed. Then, she slowly bent down and peaked underneath. Curled up in a fetal position and clutching a teddy bear was a glowing white, semi-transparent girl staring right at Summer. The fear in the ghost girl's eyes was quickly replaced with confusion when she saw Summer. "That's not Daddy," she mumbled to herself. "Who is that?... Daddy always tells me when we have guests... but I'm hiding from him, so maybe he couldn't tell me... but before Daddy woke up, only naughty people came here... Daddy will be mad if I let thieves go... but he'll also be mad if I punish his guests... I'd better find out who she is..."
Suddenly, the ghost transformed, rising up through the bed and turning into beautiful lady. "Who are you?" she asked, her voice becoming commanding and stern. "My father didn't tell me we would be having guests. If you aren't my father's friends he will be most displeased."
This situation had become very delicate. This ghost seemed to have multiple personalities, so telling it that they weren't guests could be dangerous. On the other hand, the ghost seemed to be extremely afraid of its father, and Summer had good reason to believe this was Ms. Hildegard Featherton and her father was the vampire Count Featherton. Maybe the ghost would help them if they told it the truth-- that she and her friends were detectives and they wanted to stop Count Featherton. But she didn't have much time to think, so on a split-second decision, Summer decided...

Summer rolled her eyes at the count's lame excuse for why he should tickle her. But her annoyance quickly turned to fear as she felt several cold, boney fingers removing her shirt. There was something about those fingers, even before they'd started tickling her, that felt powerful as though they could reach into her soul if they wanted to.
For a moment, this gave Summer a bizarre curiosity to know if souls were ticklish.
But Summer was quickly reminded of the fact that she had other things to worry about when she felt a long fingernail sliding over her belly. Summer shrieked and squirmed as the cold nail drew circles around her belly button, slowly spiraling nearer to it. "W-wait, wait!" she yelled, and to her surprise the tickling stopped. "Oh, thank you," she said, believing Count Featherton was having mercy on her, but then she felt another sensation; a feather twirling around in her navel. Summer screamed for a moment and then started laughing as wiggled from side to side trying to get the fluffy menace out of her second-most-ticklish spot.
"Now apologize for your lack of respect and tell me where the pendant is," Count Featherton demanded, a slight growl seeping into his otherwise eerily melodious voice.
"W-wehehedohohohn'tknohohohohwhahahaha!" Summer insisted, though she was beginning to think she should just try to bluff her way out of this.
Summer heard the vampire groan before replying, "Have it your way; I was hoping I wouldn't have to resort to this, but I need my pendant." The vampire placed five fingers over Summer's heart, and for a split second, she felt like her skin was burning. The sensation passed before she could scream in pain, though, and suddenly, Summer felt like she was falling into a void.

Summer didn't know how long she felt like she was falling-- maybe a few seconds, maybe a year --but when she opened her eyes, she knew she was not in Virginia anymore. There was no ground beneath her feet, and no sky above her head. All around her was nothing but chaos and memories.
Then it came, slowly at first but getting faster: the sensation that she was being tickled. It started in her underarms and rippled down her sides causing her to yank her arms down and giggle like a little girl. It seeped over her breasts and belly and dipped into her belly button making her blush and swat at the invisible hands and feathers tormenting her. And then it spread down her legs... and onto her feet.
Summer laughed helplessly, clutching her body and futilely trying to scratch away the sensations or spin away from her attackers. But nothing worked, and the tickling got worse and worse. She was…

Upon closer inspection, Summer noticed something else about this woman: her body, her whole image… it bordered being translucent. She could almost see through it, even under this dim bluish light.

Many feeling began to clash and conflict inside the girl detective. The possibility of being in front of an actual ghost… it challenged all that she knew, her whole world vision. Not to mention, it sent chills down her spine.
But on the other hand… she was so gorgeous! She had this strangely calm aura surrounding her, almost inviting her to get even closer.
“Her eyes… so captivating…” thought Summer.

“Thanks for getting closer. You seem like a nice, kind person.” The woman said with a genuine smile of gratitude. “I'd like to see more people like you more often. I feel lonely down here sometimes… what's your name, young lady?”

“S-S-Summer. Summer Salt.” The teen sleuth found herself stuttering. “Are… are you Mrs. Hildegard Featherton?”

“Indeed, I am.” Said the spectral woman after a heartfelt sigh. “I think… my current nature, quite understandably, scares some people away from me…”

Summer began to notice how powerfully attracted she felt by Mrs. Featherton's eyes. They were simply… mesmerizing! Like two deep wells of calm and well-being. There was something so alluring about them…

The more she looked at them, the more she heard Mrs. Featherton's voice, the more she wanted to walk up to her and never leave, and to do everything she wanted. There was something that creating inside Summer a powerful need to keep that mysterious woman content.

That's when the deductive region or her mind kicked off the alarm. That can't be right, it must be a trap of some kind! Turn around and run now, Summer, before you're not able to do it anymore!

Summer's feet stopped on its tracks. This huge feeling of doubt and hesitation took over her. Do I keep going forward, closer to the embrace of this woman that I crave? Or do I listen to my detective gut, and turn around and leave while I still can? If I can....

“I…” Mrs.Featherton spoke, with a mixture of shyness and sadness. “I just… I’d like to be with someone. I feel… alone.” She looked up to Summer’s eyes, with big, round, sad eyes.

Summer felt her eyes lock with Mrs. Featherton’s.

“Would you stay with me? Just to pass a little bit of time?”
The teen detective hesitated.

11112122221232121221222.content:
“Of course, I’ll stay with you.” Summer said with a warm and friendly smile that even surprised herself. A part of her mind was wondering why she was finding so rewarding to make this sad, wandering ghost feel better. But that part of her mind was getting quieter and quieter by the second.
Still, with a new found of joy inside her chest, the girl sleuth walked forward towards the ghost of Mrs. Hildegard Featherton.

“Oh, that’s splendid!” She replied, also with a big, genuine smile on her fair complexion. “I knew you wouldn’t mind spare a few moments to keep me company… It’s not easy for me, you know… Not many people take my, let’s say “condition” lightly.”

“I don’t mind, really.” Summer said. Another warm wave of joy washed over her with another display of kindness that she had with Mrs. Featherton.

“Thank you, Summer. I really appreciate that. I’m happy to see that my preceding reputation hasn’t scared you off, either…” Mrs. Featherton chuckled friendly at her own comment.

“Reputation? What reputation?” Summer asked.

“Oh, well, you know… that I like to tickle people.” Mrs. Featherton placed her hand at the side of her mouth, like if she was telling the girl a secret. “Some people can feel a little bit scared about that too.” She even shrugged while talking with such a sincere tone.
‘What other proof can one ask about this being’s good nature?’ The girl detective thought to herself.

“That? Oh, I don’t mind it… I’ve already gotten tickled quite a few times since I stepped into this house so far.” Summer said and wiggled her toes, looking down as she did so. Mrs. Featherton giggled.

“Really? And how did that happen?” The ghost lady asked, seemingly amused.

“Well, I… I don’t know, exactly… There does seem to be a lot of people in this manor that’s really interested in tickling everybody else. I don’t know why, but it does seem to be a mystery, and I really like to solve mysteries. I guess that helped a little bit to get me tickled so often.” Summer said and giggled at her own conclusion. Lady Featherton giggled along with her.

“It does sound like it.” Mrs. Featherton said in her warm and motherly voice. Her eyes went from Summer’s bright and youthful smile, to her dainty and small bare feet.

“You do look like you’d be a delight to tickle, Summer.” The ghost said. Summer blushed and smiled at the compliment. “Did you enjoy getting tickled?”

Lady Featherton’s words made the girl blush so much that she even let out an spontaneous girlish giggle.

“I… I… don’t know…” Summer said smiling like a dork, looking down to her own curling toes, as this strangely pleasurable wave of embarrassment washed over her.

“It’s okay to admit it. I used to like it a lot when I was alive. It’s just a good, harmless, innocent, fun game. The funnest of all, in my opinion.” Lady Featherton said with a sincere and yet teasy tone.
“In fact, I also used to enjoy dishing out quite a bit. Even more to girls who liked to be tickled… that way we both really enjoyed it more…”

Summer felt herself being practically pierced by Mrs. Featherton’s blue eyes, looking right into her own, while sporting that provocative smirk. She had to hold in a gasp.
Her knees twitched a little bit.
“Why… why do I feel this need to be tickled?” She began to wonder. The feeling worried her a little bit, but… the need to be tickled was beginning to grow, overshadowing the feeling of concern, slowly but surely.
“This can’t be right… I must be influenced by some kind of… spell?”

“Something tells me that you want to play with me and have some fun with some tickles, but you’re just a little bit shy to admit it, aren’t you, Summer?” Lady Featherton’s words interrupted Summer’s train of thought.

“It’s fine. You can tell me if that’s what you want.” The friendly and inviting smile returned to the ghost of Mrs. Featherton’s face returned.

“I…”

Summer hesitated. Inside her, her will was being disputed in a tug-o-war between her keen detective sense that was almost yelling her to get out of there, and this powerful and new found desire to do as Lady Featherton said and stay with her.

“I… I do. I’d like to get tickled by you, if don’t mind, Mrs. Featherton.” Summer said.
She felt surprised at her own words. It almost felt like if she was seeing someone else taking control of her and making her say things she’d never speak out loud.
Still, that concern seemed so minor right now. All that mattered to her was the joyful tingling that she felt inside her chest, knowing she was so close to surrendering to Lady Featherton and make her content, therefore being herself content as well.

“Oh, Summer. You are so adorable!” Lady Featherton giggled. “I’ve never seen someone display such good manners when asking to get tickled. Your parents really did a good job raising you, I bet they must be very proud of their smart and polite little girl.”

Summer tried to say thank you, but all she managed to do was to look down to her own wiggling bare feet again. She felt she was blushing so hard her cheeks might catch on fire.
Lady Featherton was making her feel like a silly little girl, but… she was enjoying it! She almost couldn’t believe herself, if she’d at least care about it.
But that didn’t matter right now. Only the possibility of staying down there to play with Mrs. Featherton mattered.

“I would very much like to tickle you, Summer. I bet both of us are going to have a lot of fun.” The ghost’s voice felt warm, motherly and welcoming, even more than before.
Summer lifted up her eyes, filled with almost childlike glee.

“But, when a ticklee gives herself willingly, that opens up an interesting possibility…” Mrs. Featherton said with a teasy tone, while tapping her ghostly finger on her chin.
“I can figure out where are your most ticklish spots and how to play them, so I can make you laugh....”
Summer almost gasped merely at hearing the phrase.
“Or, since you want to play with me and let me tickle you, you can tell me your weak spots yourself. That doesn’t mean that I won’t find any new ones… but you can rest assured that I will have you rolling around in helpless laughter in no time.”

Summer stood there, speechless. Lady Featherton was offering ways to get tickled into submission… and she felt herself smiling.
The doubts and concerns from earlier had been washed away by thoughts of her, in the arms of Mrs. Featherton, happily laughing her head off while being relentlessly and playfully tickled all over her body. The very idea of it filled her with happiness. There was no place in those merry thoughts for the possibility of finding the kidnapped people in the manor, or her friends, or even Mouse. All of that could wait. First she was going to have fun. She needed to have fun, she felt… and that meant to giving herself to Lady Featherton as a willing ticklee.

“So… what is it going to be, my cute little Summer?” The ghost woman asked her, smirking.
