11112122221232211.content:
Pao-Ting carried both sisters like if they were a couple of babies to the twin doors that she had used before to get inside the room. In a slightly unceremonious way, she placed them on the floor so she’d be able to open the door… after all, it’s not like they were able to escape and go anywhere.

But…

“Hmmm… Closed. Odd.” Whispered Pao-Ting when she tried to turn the knob. It seemed locked, but how could that be, being herself the last person to go through that door?

“I’m guessing you don’t have any useful suggestions, huh?” She said talking to the Salt sisters. Their hysterical laughter had turned into quieter giggles and occasional guffaws, but they were still laughing non-stop.
Still, Pao-Ting thought that she could really have used whatever information the sisters had to share. They were already gassed and in this giddy and helpless state when Pao-Ting got into the room, and they were all by themselves. The asian genius girl quite easily arrived to the pretty much only logical conclusion for that: the whole room was a trap, and if she wasn’t careful, she would activate it as well.

While the idea of being rendered helpless with laughing gas like Summer and Mouse were sent chills down her spine, she pondered her options.
She saw the peculiar key with the smiley face that Summer had used before, still in the keyhole.
“Turning this key is probably what activated the gas”, she thought.

With no other windows on the room, Pao-Ting’s only other option was to try the door that Summer and Mouse had used to enter the room… but they were closed too. And no matter what she tried, the smiley key simply didn’t fit in there.

“Only one way out, it seems”. Pao-Ting thought, cursing her own luck. She found her arch rivals complete helplessness, but by doing so she was now risking ending up in the same state herself.

Standing in front of the twin doors, and wishing that it didn’t activate any kind of trap, Pao-Ting chose to put the smiley key in the second keyhole, and hope for the best.

She took the key out from the right door.
Inserted it inside the left keyhole.

Gulped.

And turned the key.

A distinctive *click* could be heard.

And…
11112122221232211.title: Tries to carry the helplessly laughing girls to...

choices: Trapdoor!
The room is starting to smell funny again…
111121222212322112.content:
A slight rumble was heard in the room, making the floor and walls hum briefly. The asian girl’s eyes quickly began to look all over the room, looking for any possible trap getting activated.
Her heart began to pound. Summer’s giggles were slightly calming down.

“Summer. Summer! Listen to me! Is this what happened to you earlier? Is this how you activated the trap?” Pao-Ting asked her rival.
The effort Summer made to speak was quite visible, but still, all that she managed to get out of her mouth were merely girly giggles intertwined with gibberish.
Mouse was even more helpless with giggles than her big sister.

Pao-Ting realized that the temptation of catching Summer Salt off guard had come to a quite likely hight cost: ending up helpless all the same herself!

“... ah, shit.” The asian genius whispered.

And then…:
111121222212322112.title: Uh-oh…

choices: Catacombs and hidden rooms of the manor.
A cavernous underground.
1111212222123221121.content:
In the blink of an eye, the floor disappeared beneath the three girls, swallowing them into darkness!
The remaining effects of the laughing gas curiously protected the Salt sisters from feeling only sheer fright as they fell down an unknown destination of the mansion, making it a bit more of an adrenalinic experience, as the final wisps of silliness and giggles left their bodies.

Pao-Ting didn't have that advantage, though. Usually defiant, here the Asian girl genius could do nothing but to accept that she wasn't in control of the situation.
She was the first to realize that they were not falling into an empty void, but that they were sliding down what would be an enormous pipe, with more than enough room for the three of them, and even a lot more people if it was necessary.
The surface of the pipe was cold as ice, but also smooth as silk, with nothing helping the girls to stop their descent.

The angle of the pipe became less and less steep, until the three girls reached their destination, after getting expelled from the pipe like three sacks of potatoes.

The girls landed in…
1111212222123221121.title: Trapdoor!

choices: They begin to check the cavernous room for more clues.
They walk towards the dim blue light.
11112122221232211212.content:
"Unnfff… is… Is everyone okay? Mouse?" Summer said, getting up. The landing wasn't that hard on her, but she couldn't help but being concerned for her baby sister.

"Here, Summer. Yeah, I'm fine, it's just… I landed flat on my bare feet... ouchie…" Mouse whispered. She sat on the ground rubbing gently the soles of her feet, their skin slightly pink due to the impact.

The reason Summer had to ask how everyone wasn't only due to the fall.
There was no way to see where the walls or ceiling were. The floor beneath her bare feet felt cold as it was clearly made out of big slabs of flat stone, just barely irregular. They were cool as the air around her was too.
The place they were now was very dimly lit, and their eyes were still trying to adjust to the surrounding darkness. Coming from the ceiling above, wherever that was, there was a faint, pale blue light that poured down into a few feet of the giant empty room (if a room is what that place was).
Being the only source of light, the girls found quite difficult to get a clear view of their immediate surroundings.

"I'm fine too, thanks for asking." The groaning voice of Pao-Ting replied, as she got up after landing on her rear end.

"Good to know." Summer replied honestly. "Well… since there doesn't seem to be any impending traps to fall into, I'd say we could focus our efforts in trying to figure out where we are, wouldn't you say?" Summer said as she looked around, trying to find anything that could help them.

"Yeah, that's if Mrs. Girl Genius here doesn't activate another trap for us…" said Mouse looking directly at Pao-Ting.

"Oh, excuse me, little one. I seem to remember you were quite able to activate one of those on your own. Or did you turn on the laughing gas just to kick back and have a few giggles?" Pao-Ting said in a condescending manner.

"Something that you were going to take advantage of!" Mouse replied, her tone clearly showing more anger.

"Girls, girls!" Summer interrupted. "We all know we are not the best of friends here. But still, we are trapped even deeper into this insane mansion, and I think we all need to put those things aside and work together to get out here. Deal?" She said, looking a Mouse.

"... deal." The youngest of the three said almost pouting.

"Deal." Pao-Ting nodded. She quickly began to look around, analyzing the place as much as was possible with so little light.
"So... What do you think this place is?" She asked Summer.

"You could quite easily ask that about the whole manor. As for this room we're standing in… it'd seem to be… and underground of sorts. Doesn't seem to have an obvious purpose… although there's a source of light over there" Summer said, pointing in the right direction. "Could be a good starting point."

The girls exchanged looks with each other, trying to figure out what their next move should be.
11112122221232211212.title: A cavernous underground.

choices: A woman.
Something else.
111121222212322112122.content:
"I agree. We should start there. If there's light entering the room there, it could mean that there's activity right above us, o perhaps even an opening. At the very least it'll allows to see better." Pao-Ting said. The Salt sisters nodded.

Being the only source of light, the three girls walked towards it.

In the middle of the light they saw…
111121222212322112122.title: They walk towards the dim blue light.

choices: Another captive.
A... ghost?
1111212222123221121221.content:
The girls walked carefully towards the light. Summer could swear she saw a figure in it, but… how could that be? Who could be down there? Was someone trapped there as well, like they were? Was this another trap of this conniving place? Or… perhaps something else? Summer didn't exactly believed in the supernatural, but as a detective she felt that she couldn't completely rule out any possibility…

She looked at her sides to both Mouse and Pao-Ting. The three girls exchanged the same puzzled looks of bewilderment, wary of the nature of the vision before them.
Pao-Ting looked at Summer and nodded, signaling the teen detective to take action if she saw it fit.

“... Hello?” The young sleuth said in a calm and friendly voice.

The figure in the light looked up, right at Summer.

The three girls walked closer and closer to the mysterious figure.
They were close enough that they could see her clearly. It was, in fact, a woman, and she was…
1111212222123221121221.title: A woman.

choices: A fake!
Indeed, a ghost.
11112122221232211212212.content:
The three girls walked until they were barely a few feet away from the figure. It was, unmistakably, a woman. A beautiful, ridiculously gorgeous woman.
Summer looked at her intently. The woman's face and features were simply stunning. She seemed young, around 33 years old. She had long hair that cascaded down her shoulders in graceful locks. Here eyes were big, round, and full of innocence. There was a pink hue on her youthful cheeks that matched her luscious lips perfectly. Her skin seemed pale and fair, without a single blemish of any kind.
Summer felt confused as she blushed. She never witnessed such a beauty before, was it normal to react like this in its presence? A quick look at her sides assured her that notion, as both Mouse and Pao-Ting seemed to be experiencing some blushing and a quicker breathing of their own.

That wasn't all that called Summer's attention, though.
The woman's clothing seemed… oddly anachronistic.
“She looks like an aristocrat from mid 19th century… could she be…?”

Summer's inner ponderings got interrupted by the mysterious woman, answering back to her.

“Oh, hello there. It's nice to see new people down here. Come on closer, girls, don't be afraid.” She said. Her voice was warm, friendly, and inviting.

Even while being stunned by the woman's beauty, and still confused about her current possible location, Summer's logical wheels and cogs were turning inside her mind. Could this really be the ghost of Mrs. Featherton? Could that even be possible? Her deductive mind needed to explore further that mystery, it needed to know.
Summer walked closer until she was a mere three feet away from the woman.

Inside her mind, Pao-Ting was wrestling with the exact same questions that Summer was. But seeing her rival stepping closer to the mysterious figure was enough to push the Asian girl forward as well, not wanting to be a few steps behind of what could be entangling a mystery and proving her superior intellect.

Mouse, on the other hand, was feeling slightly more intimidated by the situation. She wrestled with two opposing feelings inside her. A part of her was suspicious of this whole affair… why would be a woman simply waiting for people down here, while dressed up like that? But another part of her wanted to push those worries away and come closer to this woman and to the inviting, warm, and slightly melancholic aura that surrounded her.
Her bare feet shuffled and her toes wiggled against each other and against the cool stone floor while she tried to make up her mind.

When Summer and Pao-Ting were close to the figure, they could see she was…
11112122221232211212212.title: A... ghost?

choices: A sudden feeling of doubt invaded the girls.
The girls did as Mrs. Featheron asked them to.
111121222212322112122122.content:
Upon closer inspection, Summer noticed something else about this woman: her body, her whole image… it bordered on being translucent. She could almost see through it, even under this dim bluish light.

Many feelings began to clash and conflict inside the girl detective’s mind. The possibility of being in front of an actual ghost… it challenged all that she knew, her whole world vision. Not to mention, it sent chills down her spine.
But on the other hand… The woman was so gorgeous! She had this strangely calm aura surrounding her, almost inviting her to get even closer.
“Her eyes… so captivating…” thought Summer.

Pao-Ting next to her was feeling a more intense version of those same emotions. The idea of finding herself against something actually and truly supernatural sent chills down her spine as well, the sudden desire of turning on her heels and running away as fast as possible was growing inside of her.
But also… this woman was so alluring! She simply seemed so… warm, and kind. Pao-Ting felt a calm and comfortable feeling wash over her, making her realize that in her constant day-by-day struggle to overcome her intellectual rival, it had been quite sometime since she had experienced any form of true warmth and affection. Not to mention, the possibility of coming into contact with the supernatural and figuring out its nature before Summer could do it was quite an attractive notion as well.
She sighed.

Mouse also took a few steps forward. Seeing that her older companions weren’t running away for their lives and/or sanity eased her concerns and allowed her to get closer to the figure, even if she still was slightly covering herself behind her big sister.
There was something about the figure that reminded her of her own mom, even when intellectually Mouse knew that didn’t make any sense. She felt this inexplicable need to run up to her, and hug her.

“Thanks for getting closer, girls, it is really kind of you.” The woman said with a genuine smile of gratitude. “I'd like to see more people like you more often. I feel lonely down here sometimes… what's your name, young lady?” The mysterious woman asked Summer, since she was the one closest to her.

“S-S-Summer. Summer Salt.” The teen sleuth found herself stuttering. “Are… are you--”
“I… my name is Pao-Ting.” The asian girl genius interrupted. She had felt a very instinctive urge to not be left behind and to be noticed by this woman as well, and she merely didn’t bother to repress it.
“... uh... my name is… Susan. But… everyone… calls me Mouse.” The youngest of the three added. She felt like if she was introducing herself in the first day of kindergarten. Why was she feeling like that?, she couldn’t help but wonder.

“Such pretty names for such pretty girls.” The woman said with a warm smile as she bowed her head slightly, as a gesture of salutation to the girls. They all smiled back.
But, after a few seconds, Summer’s inquisitive nature got the better of her and she resumed her previously interrupted question.

“Are you… Mrs. Hildegard Featherton?”

“Indeed, I am.” Said the spectral woman after a heartfelt sigh. “I think… my current nature, quite understandably, scares some people away from me…”

Summer began to notice how powerfully attracted she felt by Mrs. Featherton's eyes. They were simply… mesmerizing! Like two deep wells of calm and well-being. There was something so alluring about them…
The more she looked at them, the more she heard Mrs. Featherton's voice, the more she wanted to walk up to her and never leave, and to do everything this woman needed to feel better. There was something that was creating inside Summer a powerful need to keep that mysterious woman content.

Perhaps the sadness in the woman’s voice got to Mouse most of all. While listening the confirmation of being in the presence of an actual ghost send icy chills down her spine, seeing such a kind woman feeling so blue… Mouse felt it was irresistible to try to make her feel better. The two older girls listened the sound of Mouse’s tiny bare feet walking towards the figure.

Pao-Ting felt her own mind was on fire with questions. How could this be a real ghost, standing there and talking to them? How could Summer Salt, her intellectual rival, not be posing the same question? Was that the proof that this woman was not a ghost? Or was this intense feeling that Pao-Ting was experiencing, this powerful tug inside of her that made her want to run and hug this sad woman until she felt better, the actual evidence that she was a ghost and that she was tainting their minds with her supernatural abilities?
Against her better reasoning, Pao-Ting began to walk towards the woman.

Summer saw her stubborn rival walking towards this being who claimed to be the long gone Mrs. Hildegard Featherton. Judging by her expression, Pao-Ting seemed almost in a trance of sorts… why wasn’t she questioning any of this?
That's when the deductive region or Summer’s mind kicked off the alarm. That can't be right, it must be a trap of some kind! Turn around and run now, Summer, before you're not able to do it anymore!

Summer's feet stopped right where they were standing. This huge feeling of doubt and hesitation took over her. Do I keep going forward, closer to the embrace of this woman that I crave? Or do I listen to my detective gut, and turn around and leave while I still can? If I can…
She looked at her sides. Nor Mouse or Pao-Ting seemed to be experiencing the same doubt, or if they were, there surely weren’t expressing it.

“I…” Mrs.Featherton spoke, with a mixture of shyness and sadness. “I just… I’d like to be with someone. Just some company, for a little while. I just feel… alone.” She looked up to Summer’s eyes, with big, round, sad eyes.

Summer felt her eyes lock with Mrs. Featherton’s.

“Would you stay with me? Just to pass a little bit of time?”

The teen detective hesitated.
111121222212322112122122.title: Indeed, a ghost.

choices: “We’ll tell you!”
“Nope. You’re going to have to find out yourself.”
1111212222123221121221222.content:
Even with Mouse being the youngest and least prone to being a deductive genius, no one could say that the three girls were anything less than intelligent and quite capable.
Still, that couldn’t help them from following this sudden need they all felt of comforting this sad lonely soul that stood before them, even in the face of an encountering with an actual supernatural being that defied everything they thought they knew about the world thus far.
The intense pull they felt inside them was more than enough to muffle the concerns that became more and more like a faint, tiny, far voice inside their minds.

That only meant one thing: In almost no time, they had all fallen under the influence of Mrs. Featherton's magic. They were now infatuated beyond the point of no return, and were at the mercy of spectral being. They would happily fulfill her every whim, no matter how strange, in order to satisfy her.
Little did the girls know that, according to the history of this house and particularly of Hildegard Featherton, said whims were probably only going to revolve around one activity that always was of the highest interest for her back when she was alive.

All three girls walked up to were Mrs. Featherton was. She greeted them with a warm smile and round happy eyes that made them feel wonderful.
“Ooooh, it’s so kind of you girls to keep me some company! It’s been so long since anyone has been this considerate with me…” She sighed, feeling content.

The girls smiled happily in return. The influx of Mrs. Featherton on them was strong enough at this point that they were far past beyond the point of questioning their own actions.
A part of them, in the back of their minds, knew this, and even tried to warn them… but that didn’t matter anymore, to any of them. Making Mrs. Featherton feel better was all that mattered.

“Please girls, sit.” Lady Featherton said. The girls did as they were asked to. Summer and Pao-Ting sat on the floor with their legs crossed, while Mouse sat with her feet facing forward.

“I’m glad you feel better now.” Summer said with complete honesty. “You shouldn’t have to be alone like this.”

“Yes. We’ll keep you company if you want.” Pao-Ting added.

“Oh, I’m so lucky to have found such sweet girls…” Mrs. Featherton said as she sat on the floor as well. “And not only one, but also three of you as well! That way we can have lots of fun, and you’d enjoy spending your time with me as well!” She said in an almost chirpy voice.

“Yay!” Said Mouse spontaneously. “What kind of fun do you have in mind? I love to play games! I’m gonna win at everything!” The older girls giggled with good nature at the youngest girl’s comment.

“Well… there’s some sort of game I used to love to play around, but… I don’t know if you girls will like it…” She said with a teasy shrug.

“What is it, Lady Featherton?” Asked Pao-Ting with genuine curiosity. Her current (and magic-induced) child-like excitement had completely overrun her analytical capabilities.

“Well…” she sighed. “... I’m not going to bore you with sad memories from my life before. But, there was a time, long, long ago, when I wasn’t a ghost, as you surely can imagine. And back then, I had my girls to play with. My beautiful daughters that would also bring their friends and their cousins to play to our huge house upstairs.” She said pointing to the ceiling. “We always had the time of our lives, and we were always running around, chasing each other, and playing and laughing. Our house was so full of life back then…” She looked up, with a nostalgic smile, reminiscing.
“I think what I miss the most about those days is how eager my beautiful girls were to have fun with me... but also how eager they were to come up with game after game around a certain...activity… that they loved. But, I must confess, that it is an activity that perhaps I always loved even a little bit more than them.”
Mrs. Featherton made a dramatic pause in her tale, as she looked right at the girls and lifted an eyebrow while she smirked. Her voice took a tone of childish mysteriousness “ ...Can you guess what that is?”

The girls were deeply enthralled in Mrs. Featherton’s words, so much so that they didn’t guess the most obvious answer when presented with that question. They simply barely shook their heads no.

“Oh, so you can’t guess? Fine, let me tell you then… it’s… tickling!” She said in a playfully and almost silly sinister whisper. She spidered her fingers quickly over Mouse’s exposed soles, and both Summer and Pao-Ting could swear they felt wispy and light fingers caressing their sides from behind. All three of them shivered and giggled at the sensations.

“Now…” Lady Featherton’s voice regained a bit of her previous sadness. “... it’s been so long since I’ve been with my girls… and since I’ve had the chance to play with them… I just… miss them so much…” She sighed as she looked down.
“I guess… that all I really want is to spend a little bit of time in the company of someone who’d play with me, and let me experience again how those good moments were like…”

The trance that the girls were in was complete now. There was no chance that they weren’t going to feel truly and deeply moved by Mrs. Featherton’s story. And of course, there was no chance for them to try anything else but to attempt to make her feel better.

“Of course we’ll play with you!” Mouse said without a second thought.
“Yes, of course, Mrs. Featherton! Anything to make you feel better.” Added Pao-Ting.
The woman looked up with a warm and grateful smile. Her eyes met Summer’s and the teen detective simply grabbed her hand with affection as she smiled back.

“So what you are saying… is that you would like to play with me, and get tickled, and have a few laughs?” The woman asked with almost genuine innocence in her voice.

“Only if you promise not tickle just me for being the smallest one, and make this two laugh their asses off as well!” Mouse said in her usual perky demeanor.
“Hey!” Summer said as she chuckled.
“I’m with Mouse in this one.” Added Pao-Ting. “I’m in only if I also see the famous Salt sisters here end up like two laughing heaps.” Her voice was laced with a bit of her usual arrogance, in a clear attempt to provoke her rival.
“Oh, you two are so gonna get it…” Summer said while a feeling of fun and friendly competency filled her chest. “Of course I’m in, Mrs. Featherton.” She stretched her legs and crossed one foot above the other. Her bare soles now her facing directly to Mrs. Featherton, as in a way to show the other two girls that she wasn’t backing down from the challenge.

The girls simply flowed along with the scenario presented in front of them. Under the magic influence of the ghost of Mrs. Hildegard Featherton, the chances they had of questioning this development of events at this point was virtually non existent. All they knew now was that Lady Featherton wanted to tickle them, and that was going to make her feel better, so that’s what they happily were going to do.

Mrs. Featherton, on the other hand, had almost to suppress the bursting joy she felt at the moment.
As a suffering soul since her tragic passing, all that had tied her to this earthly plane of existence was this feeling of void, this intense yearning of re-encountering anyone and anything that would allow her to experience, to feel, something that was like the happiness she had felt when she and her family were alive. She didn’t exactly know if alleviating that feeling would grant some rest to her immortal soul, but all she knew was that she felt that was the path she needed to go through.
It had proven to be a quite difficult task over the years, even with the mansion above the underground filled with people and tickling activities.
But now, here she was. All alone with three beautiful young ladies that had already fell prey to her suggestive powers. And they all could be happy playing, having fun, and laughing.
Finally she would be able to fulfill her heart’s desire. She felt grateful.
And also, eager to start.

“Oh girls, you are so kind with an lonely old lady like me…” Mrs. Featherton said.
“Well… you don’t look old, really.” Summer pointed out. It was true. Despite being a ghost, Lady Featherton’s features still looked as those of someone in her early thirties.
“Except for that dress.” Pao-Ting added. All four of them laughed at the joke, even Lady Featherton.

“I’m glad you found that funny, Pao-Ting. I’m sure I can find some other ways to make you laugh too…” Mrs. Feahterton said in a teasy and mischievous voice as she raised an eyebrow. Pao-Ting flinched playfully.

“Now, girls…” Lady Feahterton said. “... in my experience tickling girls, it’s always better for the tickler, which would be me in this case, to know with precision which are the ticklees’ worst spots. It really helps to make this kind of games substantially more fun. Now, you can provide me that information willingly, and then the games can begin… Or… you can refuse to tell me, and of course, I’ll lovingly convince you to tell me.” Her voice sounded in a tone that was at the same time warm and provocative. It made the three girls snicker and giggle with childish excitement.

“So… how is it going to be?”
1111212222123221121221222.title: The girls did as Mrs. Featheron asked them to.

choices: One at a time.
All at the same time.
11112122221232211212212222.content:
The three girls had big smiles of gleeful playfulness plastered on their cute faces. Summer bit her lower lip, unsure of what to answer, when Pao-Ting spoke up.

“Nuh-uh. I’m not revealing my ticklish weak spots. Not so easily in front of Summer.” She looked at her side and playfully poke out her tongue at her rival.

“Oh, really?” Summer chuckled. “Like if finding that out was so difficult!” She smiled as she raised an eyebrow, her hands were on her hips in a classic “let’s see who wins” posture.

“If they aren’t telling theirs, I’m not giving out my ticklish spots. I’m not going to be the only one that they take advantage of and tickle like crazy. I’m already the tiniest one here, after all.” Mouse said. Mrs. Featherton laughed at what she thought to be an adorable remark.

“Very well, then. So I have in my hands three cute little girls who like to play mysterious and to conceal some very important information…” Lady Featherton rose from her sitting position and stood up. Her hands rested on her hips as she looked down at the three girls.
“I think there are two ways of resolving this issue, my lovelies. Either we go one girl at the time while I count with the assistance of the other two remaining girls, oooooooor… you all three endure the process of questioning together and at the same time… What do you say?” the ghost woman lifted an eyebrow while she smiled with a hint of mischief.

The girls giggled and looked at each other.
11112122221232211212212222.title: “Nope. You’re going to have to find out you...

choices: “...upperbodies.”
“...feet.”
111121222212322112122122222.content:
“Well…” Summer said after a few seconds of silence. “... I think it’d be fair if we all go through it at the same time, then.”

Pao-Ting looked at her with an expression on her face that clearly said “you’re on.” Summer chuckled.

“Wonderful!” Lady Feahterton clapped with excitement. “Very well, then…”

Suddenly, a swarm of ghostly hands appeared around her, slightly translucent just like her but with a bluish tone.
The hands began to float around the girls and gently grab them. Before they could realize, their legs and arms were almost completely covered in these ghostly hands, so much so that they lifted the girls off the floor with no difficulty whatsoever.

As they flinched and shivered, the three girls saw their own feet leave the ground as they hovered in the air.
And still there were many more hands that had yet not sprung to action and waited patiently around Mrs. Featherton to act.

“Since you refuse to voluntarily tell me your most ticklish spots in order to play properly, I’m going to have to find them all out by myself.” The ghost woman said as she approached the three smiling and giddy girls.

“I think I’m going to start with your…”
111121222212322112122122222.title: All at the same time.

choices: They tried to resist and fight back those giggles!
They didn’t even try to hold it, exploding into girlish laughter!
1111212222123221121221222222.content:
“... feet.” Mrs. Featherton affirmed, after a few instants of pondering her options.

“That’s not fair, my sister and I are already barefoot!” Said Mouse, wiggling her tiny toes to illustrate her point.

“Oh, worry not, little girl.” The ghost woman replied in a calm voice. “You won’t be perceiving any disadvantage due to that fact.”
And before any of the girls could realize, a couple of ghostly hands began to untie Pao-Ting’s black sneakers, like if they had all the time in the world.

“Uhh… can we… talk a little bit about this first?” Pao-Ting said while smiling and biting her lower lip. Contrary to what she’d normally feel in this situation, the usual dread of knowing that she’s in an inescapable situation of impending foot tickling torture had been replaced by a gleeful childish giddiness. Like the excitement she used to find in playing and running and having fun, back when she was little girl with not a single worry in the whole wide world.
And, thanks to the influence of Mrs. Featherton magic, she was well past the point of questioning the nature of that feeling. All she wanted was to make this kind and lonely woman feel better, and to have at least some fun while doing it. Even her rivalry with Summer Salt had melted away from her mind at the moment.
The hands gently pulled off Pao-Ting’s shoes, revealing a couple of thin white ankle socks that were quickly discarded as well. Her dainty and delicate feet were now as as bare and as exposed as those of the Salt sisters next to her.
“Oh, boy....” she whispered to herself as she felt the cool air of the room caress the skin of her bare feet. Her toes wiggled slightly as a reflex.

“Oh, I’m quite confident that you will indeed talk, Pao-Ting. You all will. You all will talk and reveal to me your most ticklish spots…” Lady Featherton said with her usual well-educated manners.
But, as she did so, more and more hands began to gather around the girls as the three of them simply kept floating in the air.
The free hands began to add up to the ones already occupied in holding the girls. So much so , that before they could realize, there were enough ghostly hands around each of them that they felt as if they were sitting in floating recliners, comfortable and ample cushioned chairs that held every inch of their bodies.

But what worried the girls the most were the hands that grabbed their ankles, making their soles face forward.
After that, more hands floated up to the girls’ vulnerable bare feet, grabbing both big toes of each one of them, in a gentle but unavoidably firm grip. The hands calmly pulled the toes slightly back, leaving the soles taut and and looking directly at Mrs. Featherton's face.

Lady Featherton floated up to were the girls’ bare soles were. They were tittering with giggles and anticipation. The ghost woman bit her lower lip as she looked intently at each exquisite bare sole, absorbing each and every detail.

“... because, my sweet little girls, believe me when I tell you…” she said as she continued her previous sentence.

Many of the ghostly hands floating around produced feathers out of thin air.

“... I have ways of making you talk…” Lady Featherton smiled with glee.

The floating hands began to wave the feathers around in the air and slowly approached the exposed soles.

The three girls looked at each other and exchanged smiles of excitement and a playful concern for what was about to happen to their ticklish feet.
Their toes wiggled, their feet twitched, and their soles tried to curl and scrunch without success.

The feathers finally made contact against the three pairs of ticklish bare soles. They began to slide lazily, slowly, and gently, up, and down. Up, and down. Up, and down.

Usually, all three of the girls would have naturally fought against the instant urge to laugh that appeared and grew inside their chests. But with their usual resolve now turned, via the magic abilities fo Mrs, Feahterton, into childish playfulness and excitement, they predisposition towards being tickled like this wasn’t exactly the same.

How did the girls reacted to the feathers finally tickling the soles of their feet?

11112122221232211212212222222.content:
Summer gasped as the feather made contact with her bare soles. Her eyes fixated, at least for a few seconds that surely felt really long, on the movements of those hands wielding those tickly instruments.
It had always been so strange to her to witness such a sensitive body part tickled and toyed like that, and not being able to control her own reactions at all after that fact. It was like suddenly sitting on the passenger seat of her own body, while the driver laughed helplessly.

She then looked at her left. Her baby sister had puffed her cheeks and was clamping shut her mouth and eyes really hard in an attempt to keep her laughs in. It didn’t seem to work, judging by the huge silly smile that was still plastered on her lips.
Summer then looked at her right, and saw her rival, Pao-Ting. The asian girl was looking back at her, with her big black eyes open wide, her mouth agape, and an expression of naive helplessness on her face. Then, a huge goofy smile draw itself on Pao-Ting’s lips as she made eye contact with Summer.
And it was like if both knew that resistance was futile, like if both had decided via telepathy to just give in to those amazingly funny sensations crawling at the soles of their insanely sensitive bare feet.
They simply looked at each other, and exploded into delicious, wanton, raucous girlish laughter.

“OooooohhhhhwaaaaaaaaaahahAHahHAhahahHAHAhahahahahahahahahHAHAhaHAha!” Pao-Ting laughed without control.
“PffffffffffwaaaaaaHAHahAHahahHAhaHAhahAHahahahahAhaahaha!” Summer followed suit, only a fraction of a second later.
“NgggwaaaHAHAHAHAHAHahahahHAha! HAhahahahA! AHAHAHAhA! HAHAHA! AHAhahhahahahahahaha!” Mouse gave up quickly after listening to the older girls surrender to the gentle tickles on their feet, and quickly followed them by laughing herself to pieces.

The previously empty and lonely underground of the manor was now filled to the brim with the sound of youthful, unrestrained laughter.

Mrs Featherton smiled widely and sighed with joy.

“Such a wonderful sight! I can’t remember when was the last time that I was so lucky to find no less than three pairs of gorgeous, adorable, and insanely ticklish bare feet! You are indeed making me so happy, my girls!” She clapped her hands.
The girls could only laugh helplessly in response, but they felt a warm happiness washing over their hearts as they noticed how happy Mrs. Featherton was with this scenario.

“But, *ahem*, onto the task at hand. You see, my girls, that such are the methods I must employ in order to find out what your most ticklish spots are, since you refuse to tell me. I’ll work over your whole bodies, top to bottom, or bottom to top, in this case, since we are starting with the feet.” Lady Feahterton explained in her calm and warm voice.

“Oh GAhAHhaHAhAHAHHAAD why The FEHEHEhehehahahat HAhAHHahHAAhAHAhA!” Mouse let out, scrambled among her loud and clumsy laughter as she shook her head from side to side. She loved to the play the reluctant ticklee whenever she had the chance, and her newfound love for Mrs. Featherton still didn’t change the fact that she still thought that was the funnest way of playing.

“Why the feet, you ask, dear Susan? Well, I must confess… it’s a body part I’m, *ahem*, really fond of. Mostly when they look like yours… so tiny, and delicate, and silky smooth… Not to mention, a more than fine choice when you are looking for ticklish spots, wouldn’t you agree, my little girls?”

“YEehehahahAHHAEHHeaHAhAHAhHAHAS!” Mouse almost screamed wildly.
“WAHAhAHhahHahHhA sohohOHOhoho teeheheheheeckleeheehehesshsshhhhahaHAhahAHHAahAhAHAHAHA!” Summer replied, taken over by the laughter.
Pao-Ting, next to her, couldn’t do more than to nod.

“I must say, my girls. while I can tell you are all very ticklish, judging by your reactions, I have the feeling that I would have not to look to other place than your feet to find your most ticklish spots. Am I correct?” The ghost woman asked.

‘What to do?’ The girls asked themselves while lost in laughter. On one hand, they could confess their most ticklish spots to Lady Featherton and see what kind of amazing games she had planned for them after that. Or, on the other hand, they could keep playing hard to get, and seeing just how far would the ghost woman go in order to find that out, and have the time of their lives while doing so.
In both cases, they felt like they were fulfilling Mrs. Featherton’s wishes, and that was all that the girls’ hearts desired at the moment.

1111212222123221122.content:
Pao-Ting began to pound at the doors in front of her, overcome with desperation a little bit more with each pounding.
“Hey! HEY! Anybody! Please open up! We need help!”
She knew that her best chances on the other side were clown girls, or perhaps even the Clown Prince himself, if she was really unlucky. Still, she preferred that to whatever this room would do to her.
She ran up to the other set of doors to try the same strategy, but only got the same results.

She began to look around, trying to find anything that could help her escape! She didn’t know to pick locks, but she was willing to try if any tools would happen to be around. But seeing nothing useful around her, she simply ran and rammed against the door, in a raw and desperate attempt of forcing the door open.

“... ouch…” she let out, as she rubbed her shoulder.

She looked up. Nothing. The hard wooden door still stood firm and closed.

“Youhoohoohoohahehehehehe…” Summer said, pointing at her rival. “you’re gonnahahahahahahehehee…”
She couldn’t finish her sentence, and landed softly on her back weakened by her constant stream of giggles..

Pao-Ting rushed at her, grabbing the helplessly giggling girl by the shoulders.

“ ‘I’ what? I’m going to what?” She asked her.
“You hahahahahahactivated pffeheheheheheheahahahahaha the gahahahahahahas agahahahahahain” Summer said, as she nodded at her own sentence like a drunk person would do.
“How could you know that? Still… nothing seems to be happening…” Pao-Ting thought out loud, noting that effectively, still nothing changed in the room surrounding them.

“Hahahahahaha just leeheeheeheestehehehehehen…” Said Summer.

Pao-Ting walked away from the giggling sisters to try to focus on what she had to listen to.
At first, nothing. Everything was quiet except for the giggles of the Salt sisters.

But then, she noticed it.

A distinctive, flowing, steady hissing sound.

“... oh, no.” She whispered.

“Summer, Summer!” She ran to her rival, once again grabbing her by the shoulders. “I… what… wh… what can I do?” The despair in Pao-Ting’s face was clear.

“Hahahahahaha I dohohon’t knohohohow… but this gahahahahas is so much fuhuhuhuhuhun ahahahahahaha…” Summer said, as she was still in some kind of inebriated state due to her previous gassing.

“Damn it, Summer! You’re useless!” Pao-Ting said, her words burning with rage.
But she then felt something else along that rage.
She felt a sense of lightness growing inside of her. The sudden notion that perhaps this wasn’t so terrible, was it? After all, nothing bad had happened to the Salt sisters. They were merely laughing to their heart’s content, lying on the floor without a care in the world.
Not only that, she was able to perceive something else. An almost faint, but noticeable sweet fragrance in the air, like the distant memory of cotton candy.
All of that couldn’t be that bad, could it? She felt her sense of urgency beginning to strangely melt away, much to her surprise. And in an even stranger manner, she could notice that a few, shy giggles were starting to bubble up inside her chest.

“Summer! Could you… mpppheeheehelp me?”

‘Oh, some giggles took over!’ Pao-Ting thought. She found that quite amusing. Not to mention the fact of having to ask for help to her lifelong rival!
‘No, that can’t be! I’m Pao-Ting, the smartest teen in the world! I will not be reduced to a laughing child along Summer Salt!’ Her usual tenacity spoke up inside her, as a part of her mind was trying her very best to fight the giggles back, resisting against what she knew very well to be the effects of the gas taking over.

“Hahahahahaha yeah shuhuhuhure hahahahahahaha” Summer replied.
And then, with a extremely clumsy but quick and effective swipe, Summer pulled off Pao-Ting’s bandana covering her face.

“Summer! You’re so dumb! Hahaha I don’t wanna breathe this!” Pao-Ting said with indignation mixed with giddiness. “You cahahahan’t do anything rahahahahaight! Hmppppphheeheeheeheehee!”
The giddiness was gaining ground and reducing the feeling of indignation. What Summer just did wasn’t that terrible, was it? Or was it? Pao-Ting felt confused. Instead of obtaining help from her rival, she exposed her even more to the gas! But… it was just laughing gas… which couldn’t be that bad, could it? In fact, it was beginning to feel funnier with each second! She realized that the need to laugh out loud was now front and center, and she couldn’t avoid it anymore. Instead of her usual burning rage, Pao-Ting felt more like if she was being gently poked in the ribs unceasingly.
The asian girl covered her mouth with her dainty hand in a silly attempt to withhold her giggles in, but they only came out stronger, sputtering out her cute lips which were curling up into an adorably silly smile.
‘How can this be that bad when all it’s doing is just to make want to laugh so much?’ She finally thought to herself.
And with that, the dam cracked, and her adorable musical laughter came out unrestrained.
“Ngggggggmmpppppheeheeheeheeheehee!”

“Hahahahahahahaaha this agahahahahahahain? Why ahahahahahahahahahahahaha!” Next to Summer, Mouse began to laugh louder as the gas closed in on her. She couldn’t quite articulate why or how, but she recognized what was happening now as an experience identical to what she just very recently went through.

“Becahahahahause Pao-TingAHahAHAHa! She ahahahahahactivated the trap agahahahahahahahain! AHAhahahAhahahahahaha thahaahahahat’s so fuhuhuhuhunneeheeheeheeheehe eahAHahHAhahhahahaha!”
Affected by a new dose of the laughing gas, Summer began to find that fact increasingly funnier.
In all truth, it was. Three brillant girl geniuses, all of them turned into helpless laughing fools for falling into the same trap.

“Summer! Shuhuhut up! I… ngggggggghh… I cahahahan’t hhhhholdddd… back… theheehee… laughhhhffffffffterrrrrrrrrngehehehehehahahahHAHAHAhahahaha! Hahahahahahahaha!”
Unable to do anything else, Pao-Ting landed on her rear end and too fell under the effects of the gas, her laughter now flowing freely and mingling with those of her rivals.
“I’ll gehehehet you for this! Bwahaha! Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!”

Her usual rancour against Summer got mixed with her gas-induced silliness, which was slowly but surely taking over her consciousness, and that combination could lead to only one possible result: With a considerable effort, Pao-Ting reached over to where Summer’s left ankle was and seized it.

“NAhahahAHHAHAHAhA not tickling HAhAHhHAhAHAhAHA it’s nAnAHaHAhAT FaHAhAHahAhAHAair waHAHhAhHAAHAhhahaaHa!” Summer begged playfully.

“OhohoHOhoho you’re gonnahahAHHAahAHahaha geehehehehet it nahahahahow!” While still helpless with laughter, Pao-Ting managed to spider her fingernails all over Summer’s adorable bare sole, sending her rival in a state of deep-belly silent laughter.
Summer merely rolled on the floor uselessly, unable to even muster enough strenght to protect her tiny bare foot from Pao-Ting’s tickling hands. Mouse looked at the whole scene and just pointed at it, while she kept on laughing wantonly.

“HahaHAHahHahahAHAHa ok AHAHAhAHAHAHAHA this haahahahactually is VEhehEHEHEry fuhuhuhun! HahaAHahAHAHAhaHAHAHAHAhahahAhahaha!”
Pao-Ting finally admitted as she completely succumbed to the effects of the laughing gas, just like her rivals before her.

The three girls were simply and happily overtaken by the laughter, and so they lied on the floor of that room, laughing their heads off without a care in the world, until…

11112122221232211221.content:
The girls had lost any possibility of control themselves. They were rolling around in the floor, completely lost in laughter.
Summer Salt, usually the smart and collected girl detective, was now turned into a laughing fool, as she banged her fists on the floor, since that was all she could do. That, and let out one deep belly guffaws after the other as she did so. A now constant stream of laughing gas had been entering her lungs freely for quite some time, intoxicating her senses, forcing her to laugh and laugh non stop. To make matters worse, her usual rival, self proclaimed girl genius Pao-Ting, had been tickling the sole of her bare foot while she also laughed herself senseless.
Speaking of Pao-Ting, she wasn’t doing any better than her rival or her little sister. She had lost the ability to coordinate her movements well enough to tickle Summer’s foot, and instead was just holding the girl’s leg like a drunk person would do, which unfortunately for her only resulted on Summer’s other wiggling sole rubbing occasionally on her face. It didn’t matter to her, though. She just kept on laughing like if there was no tomorrow. Laughing herself stupid too almost, since she had fallen prey to the need to let out raucous and loud cackles that from time to time bordered on gut wrenching laughter. She felt her face warm, as tears of laughter fell profusely down her reddened cheeks.
Mouse was able to look at the whole spectacle from not too far away. She was finding the whole thing irresistibly hilarious, but of course, the laughing gas did help a bit with that. Mouse’s laughter was a steady and loud stream of neverending joyful youthful cackles. From time to time she pointed in her sister’s direction and kicked and stomped her feet on the ground, overtaken by the whole silliness of the situation, as she saw Summer continuing to make a fool of herself.

The three girls laughed themselves crazy as the gas continued to flow into the room. They had lost track of time, but it wasn’t too many minutes that they had to endure in that situation.
It was more than enough time for a certain group of people to attend at the alarm that had went off on other side of the manor when they sprang the laughing gas trap.

Through teary and fuzzy eyes, the girls saw a group of people enter the very room they were in, as they rolled on the floor in laughter. They didn’t see exactly who, and in all honesty they didn’t completely care.

“Oooooh, look at that. I love when this trap works. Look at them, they can’t do anything right now.” One of the mysterious people said.
“I love it too. Such smart girls, so helpless… unable to do anything but laugh. To think that the boss is afraid of what they could do to the operation…” Another one replied.
“Yeah, which makes it even more satisfying to see them defeated like this. Want to humiliate them a bit more?”
“Sure!”

Lost in their laughing haze, the girls weren’t able to distinguish the figures that dragged them through the floor, gathering them on a same spot as a literal pile of ticklish girls as they were helpless with laughter.
Without saying anything, a flurry of hands descended on the girls. Armpits, ribs, legs, sides, hips, nothing was spared. The previously hysterical girls now fell on a state of defeated silent laughter. One of these people quickly discarded Pao-Ting’s footwear, leaving both of her tiny and soft feet bare at once, and going to town on them in the blink of an eye. Summer and Mouse didn’t escape this maneuver either, as from time to time their ankles were grabbed to have another hand scribbling and digging on their bare soles.
The girls were far beyond the point of offering any resistance. And at their current state, they didn’t want to, either. As the feelings on their most ticklish spots mingled with the already laughing gas induced silliness they were experiencing, they exploded into a supernova of ridiculous, raucous, stupid, girlish, helpless, youthful laughter.

“Ok, I think that’s enough. Come on, let’s take them over to the other place.” One of the voices said.

After a round of considerable ticklish humiliation, the girls were carried out of the room and deposited into a sort of big shopping cart of sorts.
They weren’t being tickled, by the amount of laughing gas they had inhaled was more than enough to keep them laughing steadily and loudly as they were carried away.

“Hmmm. Who knew? Summer Salt, utterly defeated. I mean, look at her.” One of the people said as the brilliant young detective kept on laughing non stop.
“I think what happened to the asian girl is a bit more ironic. All of that hubris, and here you have her. Laughing herself silly like a little baby.” The captors chuckled as the girls rolled around in laughter inside the cart.

After a while, the world began to make sense for the girls once again.

They don’t quite know if they laughed so much they fainted. They don’t know if they simply went back to normal after a little bit of time, or hours and hours.

Summer rubbed her head. She began to look around.
She was in a room with a mostly sterile look. The walls seemed to be covered in aluminium tiles. The floor was felt warm under her feet, which reminded her she was barefoot still.
There was no much else in the room, other than a big metallic looking chest on one side, and a door on the other end of the room.
Next to her Mouse was breathing at a slow and steady pace, like the one proper of a person who is sleeping soundly. She didn’t chose to bother her yet.

“Owwww... “ Pao-Ting moaned as she slowly sat. The asian genius girl looked at her bare feet as she wiggled her delicate toes. “... I’m quite sure I was wearing shoes before…”
She and Summer made eye contact.
“That was so humiliating.” Pao-Ting said, stating out loud what both girls were thinking.
“Very. I never had felt so utterly defeated.” Summer said with a grumpy face.
“The worst part is to be forced to laugh so much while you’re getting so utterly defeated.” The asian girl added.
It was a strange moment, but both girls seemed to have found a common ground to empathize.

“So… we should find a way to get out of here, I assume.” Pao-Ting said as she got on her feet.
“And find the kidnapped people.” Summer added. Pao-Ting simply agreed with a nod.

"Well... well... well... what do we have here?" A sweet melodic voice asked rhetorically.
A group of similar-shaped shadows closed in on the girls.
While the figures loomed over them, the two brave sisters layed on the floor, laughing hysterically. They went from cackling like hyenas, to deep and hard belly laughs, to dumb and silly guffaws. They just rolled on the floor, still barefoot, still helpless under the effects of the laughing gas, wreaking havoc on them. The pink mist still surrounded them, keeping its effects very much alive.
"Thank god for nasal filters." Said one of the figures, next to the one that spoke before her. They both shared a giggle.

Between their eyes filled with tears of laughter, both Summer and Mouse were able to see a group of about 8 clown girls looking down at them. They were all dressed in similar outfits: brightly colored dresses with relatively short skirts, with somewhat revealing cleavages that exposed their generous bosoms. All of them sported some sort of at least modest clown make up, in most cases crowned with some interesting and extravagant looking hair style. They all seemed remarkably pretty.
They tried to react at the sight, but they couldn't: Summer and her little sister just kept on laughing out of control, finding the image of the looming clown girls as funny as everything else seemed to be around them.

"I think we hit the jackpot here, girls." Said one of the clown girls. She sported her blond hair tied up in two pigtails, adorned with colorful feathers coming out of them.

"You're right, Little Feather." Answered a brunette next to her. Her hair reached her shoulder blades and she sported bangs, crowned with a cute set of cat ears on her head. "Who'd guess that'd we find the famous girl detective, Summer Sault, laughing her ass off on the floor just before we get here? She looks like she's having the time of her life, too."

"Don't forget her little sister. She's a cutie!" Said a redhead, crouching on the floor and pinching Mouse's cheeks. "'Mouse'. Even her name is cute!" The little Sault sister kept on rolling with laughter. Then the clown girl took Mouse by her left ankle, and lifted the girl's sole right up to her face. She placed her nose under the girl's small toes and closed her eyes. "Hmmmmmm... they smell clean and sugary. Still, I could play with them for a while and show her why you gals call me Brushy." The clown girls giggled. Brushy planted a big wet kiss on Mouse's sole. The little girl's foot twitched at the contact with the clown girl's red lips, her laughter remaining as intense as before.

"Well, then I guess I'd have to show them why I'm called Kitty." Said the brunette with the cat ears, wiggling a surprisingly long and sharp-looking set of nails on each hand, all of them colorfully painted in different colors. "And that it's not just because of the ears." With a smug smile of satisfaction, she kneeled next to Summer and grabbed her by right calf. At that particular moment, Summer was lying on her belly, so with Kitty's action the girl's sole ended up facing up to the ceiling. The clown girl swept her nails in short, quick scratches over the girl detective's sole. Summer's already mad laughter went up a notch, but she didn't do any kind of effort to move herself or her vulnerable bare sole from the source of those new found tickles.

"I say we take them with us to play. They seem to be having quite some fun, we could play with them and join in to that fun too!" Said Little Feather in an enthusiastic tone.

"Hmmmmmm yep yep yep, I agree. We found ourselves some new playmates!" Said Brushy with her eyes closed. She was now rubbing her cheek affectionately over Mouse's bare sole.

"It was about time we got to play with the Sault sisters!" Kitty said, her nails grazing Summer's sole now and then. "I've heard so much about them... we could be playing with them for days on end and not get bored." Beneath her fingers, Summer's toes barely wiggled. Most of her energy was concentrated on laughing as hard as possible.


All of the clown girls nodded and shared a look of complicity. With at least 4 clown girls per girl detective, they easily picked them up and carried them along with them. All the while the Summer sisters never stopped laughing. Of course, the fact that the clown girls poked them here and there, or played with their bare feet along the way, didn't help much on that matter.
But that was the beauty of the effects of the laughing gas, Summer thought, much to her chagrin, if she would have been able to experiment something even resembling chagrin on that moment. Everything around her seemed as funny and as fun as nothing ever before. What a joyful state of helplessness that was.

Leaving behind the cloud of pink gas that engulfed them, the Sault sisters were taken to a different location.

Not to mention, it was currently quite difficult for both young detectives to figure out where they were in the mansion. Indeed, what would people see if they’d encounter the smart and sharp teen sleuth, howling with laughter like a person gone mad? Still… she couldn’t help but find that very same idea incredibly funny, forcing her to laugh loudly once again.

All the girls could see was the ceiling of the many halls they were carried, taking twists and turns over and over again.
That was, until they finally reached a pair of large wooden doors.

“Ah, here we are!” said one of the clown girls.

The doors were made of a sturdy and thick oak wood, and reinforced with heavy iron bolts. It resembled what could have quite easily passed as the entrance to a dungeon taken right from the medieval times.

“Alrighty then! On your feet, girls! We’re entering the Play Room!” Kitty, one of the clown girls, said leaving one of the girls gently on the floor, standing on her bare feet. The other clown girls followed suit, leaving both Salt sisters standing in the hall.
But, with effects of the laughing gas still far from diluting away, both girl detectives landed quickly on their rear ends, laughing themselves silly as they did.
The clown girls couldn’t help but chuckle and giggle at the sight of it.
“Oh, look at you, laughing your cutie pretty head off! You’re just soooooo cute!” said one of the clown girls, with bright short pink hair. In a flash, she kneeled down and began to unleash a blitzkrieg tickle attack on both sisters.
Being unable to coordinate their own movements, they could only limit themselves to roll around uselessly, as the expert fingers of the clown girl tickled them in a most effective manner.

“And there we go.” Said Kitty, after unlocking the door open.

Inside, the room could not differ more of a medieval dungeon… in a certain way.

It was brightly lit and colorful, like the inside of a luxurious circus tent. Only that, in a closer inspection, many of the contraptions inside the room weren’t exactly something you’d find in a circus: X-frames decorated its walls, and shackles (presumably to restrain wrists) dangled from both walls and columns.
Here and there, there were also some definitely medieval looking sets of racks, with the capacity to adjust themselves so they could hold someone as short as Mouse, or someone twice her size.
There were also many sets of stocks scattered around the room, but there were 4 sets of stocks that clearly were the main attraction of the place. Those stocks were the result of some really fine craftsmanship, not only adorned with some artistic carvings of feathers, but also seemed to be made from some really sturdy and firm material. Only by looking at them one could imagine that no one restrained in such a device could leave by their own means. Still, they seemed to have some room for comfort, too: behind the stocks rested what seemed to be a plush couch made for one person, with a firm backrest for its occupant.

Not made from a similarly fine craftsmanship, but equally sturdy looking, there were a few vaults and wooden boxes here and there around the room, surely containing some interesting sets of tools.

The Salt sisters, still giggling uncontrollably, were carried inside the room by the clown girls, were…

And Mouse… well, still under the effects of the gas, she only continued to laugh merrily. The situation seemed hysterical to her. Her sweet girlish laughter simply mingled with the sound of youthful hysterics that filled the whole room.

But the one who felt the biggest rush was Little Feather. The clown girl realized that, with that decision, the great Summer Sault and all of her friends had just given up to her, pretty much agreeing to be taken as prisoners.
She couldn’t contain her gleeful smile. A whole group of spunky girls for her to tickle, to play, and to toy with! Her fingers began to itch, her mind began to race with the possibilities.

“Oh, so much fun we are going to have together, then!” Little Feather bit her lower lip and clapped with excitement.
“Girls!” She snapped her fingers. Her fellow clown girls appeared in a flash, surrounding Jamie and Chris, holding them gently but firmly by their shoulders and arms. “It seems like these two brave little girls want to spend sometime laughing along her friends. Why don’t we give them a hand with that?”
Some of the clown girls giggled mischievously and quickly put Jamie and Chris in two empty set of stocks that were next to ones that held Summer and Mouse, and were identical in structure. The girls tried to offer some resistance, but just like it has happened to the Sault sisters, their bodies felt slightly light and with not enough strength to do anything of significance that could help them escape the grasp of the clown girls.
Quickly their ankles were trapped in cushioned and firm stocks, leaving their feet facing forward. At least the girls were thankful that, unlike the Sault sisters, they were still wearing their shoes and socks.
Their wrists were quickly tied above their heads, exposing their sides and their armpits.

Little Feather stood triumphant in front of the group of captured girls. Chris, Summer, Mouse, and Jaime, in that order from left to right, looked at her with eyes that showed defiance at the same time that they showed dread, knowing how helpless they were to prevent what was surely to come to them in any second.

“Don’t get too attached to this.” The clown girl said with a wink as she wiggled the top of Chris’ left sneaker.

“Now…” she took a couple of long, stiff feathers once again. Each of them seemed like an extension of her body. “... as I was saying to this cute little pair of sisters earlier, this is kind of an honor! It’s not everyday that you get to triumph over your rival in your own terms, and even get rewarded by being able to play with them.”

“So that was your big plan all along? Trap us so you could tickle us? That’s why you’ve been abducting all of these innocent people?” Summer said with a stern voice.
Next to her, Mouse’s giggles were slowing down to a halt.

“Well, that’s just a part of it. But yeah! When it comes to the four of you, our main goal was to prevent you from ruining our plans, and also, well... “ The clown girl waves her feather at Summer “... who says we can’t have a few laughs in the process?” Summer was unable to hold back a small grimace showing concern, when she thought of the effect feathers had on her exposed and helpless tiny bare feet.

“But to show I’m also a good sport, like I said earlier, I can at least give you a choice before we start, so you don’t complain later that I’m the one having all the fun.” Little Feather giggled.
“So, what is it going to be…”
She took a step forward. Her hands rested on the edge of the stocks. She raised her eyebrows as she looked at the girls right in the eyes.

“... feet, or upperbody?”

11112122221232222221221.content:
The girls remained in a nervous silence amongst the laughter that came from the other unwilling ticklees, filling up the whole room.
Their eyes wondered about, trying to avoid any possibility that could trigger their unavoidable torture.
All of this applied to all of the girls, except for Mouse. In a moment of weakness, her eyes locked with those of Little Feather. The clown girl looked at her directly with a mischievous smirk, the girl detective couldn’t look away and began to feel a nervous smile fight its way to her lips. It was the most intense staring contest she had ever been in. Until…

“... oh please, not the feet!”

… Mouse finally said, looking down, wincing and curling up her toes.

“The feet? Why that’s a fantastic idea, you cute little Mouse!” Little Feather clapped. Her eyes went directly to the adorable bare soles of the Sault sisters, and then to the still protected feet of Chris and Jamie, that hadn’t lost their shoes yet.
She looked back at them with a mischievous grin while she bit her lower lip.
“Damn it. Mouse, why did you have to say anything…?” Summer thought to herself. Her feet were her most ticklish spot, and all of the people in that sitution knew it. She knew it, her sister knew it, her friends knew it… and she had the bad feeling that Little Feathers and the other clown girls knew it too.
“I love foot tickling games. They’re the most fun of all! Everybody ends up laughing their asses off and having a blast. But…” Little Feather frowned and grabbed playfully at one of Chris’ shoes once again.
“... you party poopers still have shoes on! How can you miss the chance of being more comfy, kick your shoes off, let your feet breath and relax a little… don’t tell me you don’t like to walk barefoot! Besides…”
Little Feather reached Mouse’s right bare sole with her finger, and begin to lovingly caress it, slowly, going uuuuup and dooooown.
“... you’re making me miss the chance of seeing your pretty bare feet, not to mention the chance to play with them a little bit, huh?” She winked at Mouse. But the girl detective was unable to blink back at her: her cheeks puffed, almost as quickly as she looked down and as a big silly grin appeared on her face.
“Pffffffffffffffhehehehehehehehehe…” Mouse couldn’t help but begin to giggle as quietly as she was able to.

“Does it matter?” Jamie interrupted. “You’re going to drive us crazy by tickling us anyway, what’s the difference?” Her tone sounded almost nonchalant, but the girls knew as much as their captors that it was a bluff.

“Oh, it does matter, cutie pie. Because I could simply tickle you crazy, until you agree to tickle each other crazy only to avoid it yourselves.” Little Feather giggled. The girls wondered to themselves how possible could that be, and shared a moment of silent concern.
“And that would be fun. But there are other options that could be even more fun! So instead of looking at these choices, or the fact that you still have shoes, as a problem… we can see them as an opportunity!”

“An opportunity for what?” Said Chris, slightly disconcerted.

“For turning it into a fun game for all of us!” Little Feather replied. Chris gulped, and immediately regretted asking, knowing what that meant.

“The difference would be…” Little Feather tapped her finger against her chin, while looking up to the ceiling.
“... if you want to start our games like you are right now. Or…” she tapped her fingernails against the sole of Jamie’s sneaker “... if you want to start in equal footing.”
Little Feather chuckled at her own bad pun.

111121222212322222212212.content:
After a moment of pondering her options, Summer’s moral compass kicked in. Her friends wouldn’t be trapped like this if they weren’t here to help her. She owed them at least the courtesy of trying to help them as well.

“Fine. Let’s play then.” Summer said. “You can start by having some fun with us. After all, we are barefoot already.” She spread her toes as much as she could, with her big toes tied down. Her trick worked though: Little Feather’s eyes went up to her bare soles wiggling like a moth to the flame.

“Oh, goodie! I don’t know what do I enjoy the most! Either Summer Sault, offering me her bare feet to play with willingly, or this lovely act of selflessness and friendship that I’ve just witnessed!” Little Feather said as she cradled her own cheeks with her hands. Still, there was a strange… honesty in her words, as far as the four friends were concerned. How odd.

“You should thank your friend here, girls! Not only it’s clear that she really cares about you, but also she just gave me an awesome idea for a fun game for all of us to play!”

She took a stool nearby and placed herself in front of Summer and Mouse’s bare feet. The older sister remained calm and collected, while the younger sister’s feet were beginning to twitch nervously.
She snapped her fingers, and a couple of clown girls approached.

“Now, we’re going to play a fun little game called ‘Don’t Laugh’. The game’s objective is pretty simple: you must not laugh, no matter what. If you do, there’s a penalty.” She took out two of her long and slender feathers, one in each hand.
“If Summer laughs…” she said, waving the feather on her left hand. “... Chris’ shoes will begin to slowly and gently be removed until she is completely barefoot.”
Summer and Chris looked at each other with a look of concern.
“If Mouse laughs…” Little Feather waved the object on her right hand. “... then Jamie will lose her shoes and socks until she is completely barefoot as well.”
The clown girls that had approached looked at each other and giggled, one taking position next to Jamie and Chris.
Mouse looked at Jamie like someone who had already screwed up, confirming what they both knew: there was no way Jamie was going to keep her shoes on.
“... crap.” Whispered Jamie.

“Of course, the process of removing your friend’s shoes and socks stops at the moment you stop laughing. But if they get barefoot aaaaaaaaall the way… then they join the game too, and we will see if they’re able to win a few rounds of ‘Don’t Laugh’!” Little Feather said in her characteristic up-beat tone.

“Ready?” She asked before any of the girls had any chance to react.
“Set… go!”
With both Summer’s and Mouse’s big toes tied up, the girls feet were practically a canvas, for her to paint and draw on with her two trusted feathers.
She began to slide them gently, taking all of the time in the world. The feathers began their trips on the plump heels, slowly dragging themselves over the middle of the soles, sliding under the toes, and returning to the heel by caressing the tender arches.
Little Feather seemed to be ambidextrous. She found no problem whatsoever in wielding two feathers at the same time like if it was only one. Each hand mirrored the movement of the other seamlessly.

Both Summer and Mouse felt the loving and almost electrical tingling of the feathers toying with their sensitive bare feet, sending shocks up their bodies, that their brains translated as a strong and eager need to laugh.
But, knowing that with each second of resistance, they were buying time for their friends and spearing them from being tickled, they did their best to hold their laughs in.
Their bodies began to shake, twist and writhe in their bindings. Their faces began to contort into goofy and silly expressions. They were doing their best, but everyone around them could see that wasn’t going to be enough for more than a few minutes, at best.

“Veeeeeeeery good, little girls! This is how you’re supposed to play a good and challenging game of ‘Don’t Laugh’!” Little Feather said in a sweet and teasy voice. “At least from your end. From my end… well, I do like to win, and if I want to win, I better step up my game, right?”

Both Sault sisters wince at listening to those words...

The clown girl’s voice acted like an amplifier of the sensations the girls felt roaming over the sensitive skin of their soles. Each word made every stroke of the feather increase its ticklishness tenfold.
