11112122221232222222.content:
“Coochie coochie coochie!” Little Feather tickled the bare soles of both girls, making them laugh at her whim. There was nothing they could do except laugh and laugh.

“Wahahahahahahahahahaha! Please mercy! Merceeheehehehehehahahahaha ohohohohahahahahahahahahaha!” Summer laughed, out of control, broken by the tickling.
“Aaaaaaaaaaaahahahahahahahahahahahahaha! I’ll do anything hAhahahaHAhahahahahahahahaha!” Mouse begged, even a bit more desperate than her big sis.

But the mercy didn’t came. Instead, other clown girls joined Little Feather in tickling the helpless girls. Armpits, sides, ribs, bellies, and thighs, joined the feet in the collective experience of having each possible ticklish spot on them exploited.
The clown girls had a soft, tender, almost loving touch, that made the girls laugh the loudest and hardest they ever had. The women were really experts in the art of extracting as much laughter from anyone as possible.
But the taunting… my god, the taunting! The sweetest, most embarrassing, most patronizing phrases were constantly used against the girls. Sweet sugary voices that spoke right next to their ears cooed with an estrategic expertise, making the Sault sisters feel that their ticklishness increased tenfold.
“Coochie coo!”
“Ah-kitchy-kitchy-kitchy!”
“Tika-tika-tika, baby girl!”
“Oooooh, such a nice laughter! Let’s hear more of it!”
“What happens if I slide this quill over your cute little footsie, I wonder?”
“Don’t let it bottle up inside you! Just laugh! You’ll feel great!”

Not only that. Even under such an onslaught of tickling, Summer and Mouse couldn’t avoid noticing the fact that they were not alone.
The hysterical laughter of many other victims, just like they were right now, filled the whole room. Looking around, the girls could see lots of people enduring many variations of the ticklish torment they were enduring.
One girl was on her fourth game of Tic-Tac-Toe, with her own soles used as the board. Another one was having her supple armpits used as a canvas, with soft paintbrushes creating colorful images on her skin, next to a girl that was quite probably her own sister, that had her own tummy being painted on as well.
Near one of the walls, one of the clown girls managed to trap at least 5 pairs of helpless bare feet in stocks, with the owners of those feet wrapped in blankets like human burritos. The feet varied in shapes and sizes, and the clown girl seemed to be submerged in a state of deep artistic inspiration, as she played those feet, producing all kinds of musical laughter, like if she was indeed playing an instrument.

Then, much to Summer’s surprise, she saw two familiar figures approaching her and Mouse: her friends, Jamie and Chris!
Both girls’ feet approached in a clumsy manner up to the stocks that held Summer and Mouse. They were already barefoot, with their cheeks showing a bright pink blush, and the overall demeanor of someone who is simply exhausted.
Not only that, they were not offering any kind of resistance. They simply walked up to where the Sault sisters were, merely carried by their hand of the clown girl that Summer identified earlier as Kitty.

“Here they are.” Said Kitty. Letting go of Jamie’s and Chris’ hands, the girls simply sat on the floor, almost collapsing on it, breathing deeply. They had a direct view of their Summer and Mouse’s soles being tickled, but they didn’t seem to have the energy or the spunk in them to do anything to stop them. Both Sault sisters realized that their friends surely came right from enduring some very intense tickles.

“They were playing for quite some time with the Clown Prince.” Said Kitty to Little Feather, smiling. Both of them chuckled.
“Aw, you poor things... “ Little Feather caressed Jamie’s cheek. “But don’t you worry… the fun part is about to begin!” She said in chirpy and upbeat manner.
Then, she handled one of her feathers to Jamie and one to Chris.
The tickling of the Sault sisters stopped. The girls looked at each other with concern as they tried to get their breath back.

“You see…” Little Feather stood up, talking to all four friends. “... this is part of an initiation of sorts. Your friends, Jamie and Chris, simply started it a little bit earlier than you, but still you all get to play together!”

After looking down in doubt, Jamie and Chris stood up.

“The idea is that you can also join or Merry Group of Clown Girls, making our party bigger and helping us recruit more people!”
“We’ll never join you! You better let us go before the police come looking for us!” Said Summer, with stern and determination.
“Oh, you silly cutie patootie you! Who do you think pays the police enough so they don’t come looking for people in such a huge manor? Or do you think that they were merely letting some cases open for some daring teen girl detective and her friends to solve it?” Little Feather said with a natural and carefree tone, that still didn’t stop Summer’s heart from sinking inside her chest. She was beginning to realize that how much sense the clown girl’s words had, putting the pieces together inside her head.

“Anyway, thing is, Chris and Jamie already agreed to join us! They will be our next, newest members!”
“What?! No! That can’t be true! Come on, guys, we’re your friends!” Said Mouse, almost bursting with helplessness.
“I-I-I’m sorry... “ stuttered Jamie “... but, we didn’t know what else to do. There wasn’t any other way out, and we thought we were going to be tickled out of our minds…” She looked down again.
“Yeah. But… I mean… perhaps if you don’t act so stubborn and give up quickly… we can go… easy… on you…” Chris added with a very noticeable shame.

“Nah-ah-ah! No going easy here, you cute little softies. Or did the Clown Prince went easy on you?” Little Feather nudged Chris on her side with her elbow.
Both friends looked at each other realizing what they had to do.

“I will get out of this, and save all of my friends too.” Summer said. Her voice was as strong as iron… but deep inside her, she knew how defenseless and helpless she really felt. She hoped no one else could see through her heroic facade.

“Oh, so much determination! You will be the most fun!” Little Feather said. “Ah, I almost forgot! In case I didn’t mention it, the initiation consists into tickling you until you accept to join us, and be ready and willing to do the same to someone else.” The clown girl winked at the Sault sisters.

Mouse whimpered and tried uselessly to curl her tied up toes.
After a few seconds of silence, Summer finally said. “Go ahead. Do your worst.” As she braced herself for what’s to come.
“Oh, don’t you worry, little girl…” Little Feather walked up to Summer, putting her face right in front of her, looking her directly into her eyes.

“... I will.”

“So, Chris, Jamie… why don’t you begin?” the clown girl suggested.
With a sigh, both girls began to apply the feathers to their friends tied up feet.
Their reactions were instantaneous. Both Summer and Mouse exploded with laughter while Chris and Jamie caressed gently their bare soles, making them laugh in complete hysterics.

In a flash, all of the clown girls that were tickling the Sault sisters resumed their task, taking all of the free spots in their legs and upper bodies.

“Don’t you worry…” Little Feather whispered in Summer’s ear. “... after you accept to join us, you will have your chance to tickle your friends back. I’ve heard that their feet are just as ticklish as yours!”

She planted a big, wet, warm kiss, on Summer’s cheek, as the poor girl continued to laugh wantonly and non-stop.

“How long that will take… is up to you!”

Pao-Ting came up from the chest holding a simple makeup brush and kit. She couldn’t help but smile as she closed the lid to the chest and walked around to Mouse’s prone form.

“When you’re as gifted as I am, having advanced knowledge in several fields is child’s play. Some of my more useful skills include engineering, electronics and…” Pao-Ting opened up her makeup kit, grinning wickedly. “Chemistry.”

She took the makeup brush and started swirling it about in the special substance. Once completed, she brought the brush up to the light, revealing it to be covered in a fine red powder.

“This particular substance has proven to be quiet useful, especially on unmotivated underlings.”

Pao kneeled down in front of Mouse’s right foot. Putting down the makeup kit, she held her foot steady while softly brushing the powder on her sole.

Mouse started giggling and pulling at her bonds. She tried closing her eyes, burying her face in her arm, and thinking of something else, anything, but the tickling sensation dominated her mind.

Pao started in on Mouse’s toes. As the soft brush flurried up and down and in-between, full blown laughter began to intersperse with Mouse’s giggles. Although the tickling was considerable, it actually wasn’t as bad as Mouse had expected. Mouse’s laugher slowly died down after Pao had stopped tickling her and put down her makeup brush. Mouse’s right foot was a bright shade of red.

Once Mouse had caught her breath, she looked at Pao-Ting. She had expected her to start questioning her again. Instead, with a sly grin on her face, she bent down and slowly blew on her newly powdered foot.

The effect was devastating.

Mouse threw her head back and laughed at the top of her lungs. It felt like a million microscopic feathers were washing over her foot. She could not have conceived of anyone being this ticklish, even herself. As she was fighting to pull in another breath, Pao had finished her demonstration. Pao straitened up and waited for Mouse’s laughter to die down.

“Now that you have felt the effect of my substance, is there anything you have to tell me?”

Mouse burst out with desperate pleading. “Please! I swear I don’t know anything! I have no idea where Summer is! You have to believe me!”

Pao-Ting developed a look of detached indifference and made her way back to the chest.

“Very well. If you continue to show me resistance and non-cooperation, you shall suffer the consequences.” Pao bent down into the chest and retrieved a special item.

The item in question was a small fan. It was about four inches in diameter and was battery operated. The base could be extended to raise the fan up to five feet off the ground. And it was just one of a dozen similar fans nestled within the confines of the chest. She walked back over to Mouse’s newly sensitized right foot.

“This is how it’s going to work” Pao explained. “For the next indeterminate period of time, I am going to increase the amount of ticklish torture your sweet little body will experience. Now, at any time, you can end it all and tell me where your sister is. Let’s begin”.

Mouse’s pleas fell on deaf ears as Pao set up the fan six inches away from her right foot. Once Pao turned the fan to the low setting, Mouse’s pleas turned to girlish screams of laughter. As Mouse pulled futilely on her restraints, Pao-Ting picked up her makeup kit and brush. She let the torturously forced laughter drown out into the background as she thought of where to apply her special makeup next.

In between taunting comments Butter was putting a special attention on making sure that there were bristles going into the tender flesh between the toes of Jamie's supposedly dirty foot causing the boy to laugh past the stage of begging and into hysterical gibberish.
''NAHAHAHAHHAHAHAGGHAHGA''
''Those toes are just so cute. Think there's a few drops still left in there though. Everyone always says make sure to wash between your pinky toe!''
''AHAGH AAGHAaahaaaaa
Jamie was past the point of speaking and now was just lying back with his eyes screwed shut and the tears streaming down what could very well be a permanent smile painted on his face. When Butter slipped the around his pinky toe and started pulling it back and forth he arched his back and quivered abit before finally slumping on the couch and going silent with a whimpering giggle..''

''Butter hurry up!''
''Cheese it's rude to rush a lady. Boy's can get so dirty.''
''He's barely awake at this point.''
Cheese wasn't one to be upstaged and started applying a series of light tickles to Chris's neck to keep the scared boy nice and pliant. Not that he could move anyway at this point. Trapped between two clown girls one of whom was playing the small boy rather close to the chest to mix metaphors.

''Creeeam'' said Butter with a pleading whine ''Let me heeelpp''
''Oh no Butter you drew it out and now you deal with it. Now put the oil on and stop wasting time. We'll show our little man here a good time.''
With a pout from Butter and a whimper from Chris, Cream took the brush from Butter who went into the bag of tricks for a new torment. As she emerged with a plastic bottle Chris feared for his friends feets but his attention was snapped back to his own as his senses were assaulted by a soapy brush getting familiar with his foot.

Cheese pulled the boy onto her lap and held him in a straitjacket of her own flabby arms with her chin on his head and looking down as Cream cleaned his foot.
''Cleaning my cuuutie. Waaatchinng hiiim squuuiirrmm.''
''He's just so cute when he's like this Cream. Look he's trying to hold it in and he's just getting so pink I wanna die. Oooh these little cheeks are gonna match his nails once we paint them!''

Chris had so many problems with that sentence but at this point he'd hold that back along with his laughs. See he knew at this point after all his ticklish trials and giggly games he knew what they wanted. Despite what they said now it was his laughing they wanted. Cream had no bigger on her smile then when she had been watching the boy's laugh themselves hoarse before her and her sister's. He'd been tricked and tickled, Then tricked again followed by more tickling. Then....He'd been tricked once more...which led to more tickling. Honestly being too trusting was probably something the boy really needed to work on as his innate ticklishness was something that all the people around Summer shared...
DENYING THE CLOWNS HIS LAUGHS WAS REALLY IMPORTANT!
He was gonna do that as long as he could tho. Cheese was fine with petting her little prisoner but Cream was starting to get bothered by the silence as she wanted her victim to be simpering and sniveling through the tears of joy she would coax out of him.

The battle of will was raging on one side of the couch but on the other side Big Butter was finishing up the latest stage of what she'd been doing to the poor conquered soles of Jamie. She'd finished rubbing the baby oil into his formerly fish fooded foot and she was finishing up the other virgin foot making sure that arches, ball instep were slathered up. The final touches were being applied to the undersides of her boys toes as even the crevices between them were already slippery with oil. She was quite upset that her lovely lad was away in lala land depriving hr of his laughs but as she washed her hands in their impromptu fish pond( Cleanliness is important!) she knew there was only one more step for her sleepy little suitor. After she finished her painting of these young nails her sisters would need her help.
They'd also hopefully be more hands-on with keeping her going abit too far as she had been looking forward to seeing the handsome ones pedicure face. She'd settle for the cute one's reaction though. She laid back and withdrew the brush out of the bottle of pink nail polish and hoped she'd still catch some fun when she was done with the hair-dryer that was part of the next step for her boy.

''Ohh cutie you're such a little tough guy. Those laughs are gonna come out though! You can try but we're gonna get 'em out!''
Cheese cupped her little boy by the chin and forced him to look up and meet her eyes. The tears once more welling in the corners of the boys eyes made her smile even wider than the one creeping over the cuties face.
On the flip side Cream was getting mad that her goal of brushing down the boys foot had still yet to illicit her a nice little gut laugh from little Mr. Clove. She was done and on the clock here so as she moved on to toweling the foot she had in her clutches she thought she'd see if she could up the game.
Cheese was enjoying holding her precious's gaze but the wavering little eyes of Chris screwed shut he felt a nail polish brush go up his captive sole. He tried so hard to keep his mouth shut but quickly found his little tonsils bared by the open faced laughs that ripped through him.
''HAHAHA WHAHAHATTTAH''

''Just leaving a little message for my little mister here. The oil is next up of course Christopher but we'll have some fun when you wake up at the next step. It's nothing special just instructions for whoever get's you next. The oil's gonna make these little feet pretty slick, soft and sultry but adding in the blow-dryer THAT I HOPE BUTTER'S DONE WITH BY NOW! They'll be hot, sensitive and ready for whatever questing grabs we have in the cards.

The slow strokes of the tiny brush were insane to Chris. That he'd resisted the larger brush seemed so small as the much smaller brush seemed like a focused streak of ultimate giggly agony for the boy. As the corners of his vision once more darkened he was trying sooo hard to figure out what Cream was writing.
T-I-C-K-L-E-M-E-!

The boy slipped into hysterical sleep once more.
13211123112113.title: THAT'S THE TIME! The boys make it and win! ...

The wall is shaken by the Clown dumping more bugs on the boys!
The Clown gets poor Chris and Jamie has to leave him. Sorry buddy!
132111231121132.content:
''Don't worry boy's just sit tight until we come back to pick you up.''
These were the last words Chris Clove heard before he slipped into unconsciousness for the second time tonight at the hands of the Clown Girls.

As he groggily opened his eyes he mumbled
''Mmmrrghh...gehehe...Wha-wha-wher...''
''Errrgggh Chr-Chris are you-are you okay Chris?''
''J-Ja-Jahamiiee wh-wha-what happened?''
'Y-you tell me...I passed out. What happened?! Where are our pants?!''
''Huh!?'
Chris finally noticed the chill he felt wasn't just do to the fear. His pants were gone! The Clowns must've taken them in transit. Jamie's were gone too he realized.
''They kept tickling me! They wouldn't stop then they started using some kind of brush to wri-''
''Tickle me?''
''NO MORE TICKLING! I DON'T WANT ANY MORE!''
''Chris calm down! I was just...''
''What? ''
''I was just reading Chris. It's on your feet.''
''What?!''

The small boy pulled his legs up onto the couch on which they'd both awakened and examined his soles for the first time since Cream's art show. He saw the little message that'd been left in hot pink on his alarmingly red sole.
''T-T-TIC-TICKLE ME!?!''
''Chris it's oka-''
Jamie was suddenly cut off by Chris's own curious finger touching the message on his foot. The unexpected sensitiveness of his poor tickle abused sole caused the boy to immediately throw his back in and laughter, kicking his legs feebly at his imagined attacker. To his credit Jamie only spent about half a minute staring at the boy incredulously before trying to calm the boy down.

''Ch-Chris calm down!''
''IHIHITIT TIIHIHIHICKKLELEHES SOHOHOHO BAHAHAHADD''
''Wha-''
Jamie tried to set his feet down in the oddly thick carpet but quickly regretted it as it felt like a million tiny feathers assaulted his now incredibly sensitive oil soaked soles causing him to fall back clutching at his ankles and laughing his head off.
''AHAHAHGHHAHAHA!! MMMMPPGGHGH!!'
He finally silenced himself by clamping his hands over his mouth and screaming into them. This action led to a piece of paper fluttering down from the back of the couch to land between both hysterical hostages. After a solid few miutes of laughing and just generally embarrassing themselves they finally got enough air back in them to regain control of their senses and take account of their situation.

Chris started with reading the note aloud.
''Hey boys! Love from your future sisters Cream,Butter and Cheese. Don't worry we'll be back to get you in about an hour until then don't worry. To keep you nice and relaxed while you wait we rubbed oil good and deep into your feet and so it wouldn't get icky when you walked we used blowdrier's to dry them fast. The fact that it made your soles so sensitive and red is just a bonus!
Anyway while your waiting feel free to absorb some history my little students. This was a room favored by the late Mrs Featherton frequently used when she ''entertained'' guests or merely for her own use. It's got a twist on the idea of shag carpeting but instead modeled on a bed of grass. The lady of the house the tickle fiend she was. She wanted a carpet of tickly feathers for her personal enjoyment of others enjoyment. The Count of course provided her with whatever she wanted once more. He did that alot and some say when she didn't want death even that ended up handled!

Spooky huh? Aren't you glad your feet are so warm now? I'd be cold in there even if we hadn't taken your pants! To get off track for a second I never would've figured you were a undies boy. They looked so cute on you! Like a baby in diapers!''
Chris blushed furiously as he saw Jamie try to hide a giggle. He'd just pretend it was left over from the carpet for the sake of his pride and their friendship.
''However those little dollar signs on Jamie's boxers?! Those were even cuter hence why Cheese HAD to take them. She gave him a nice little pair of replacements though. She wants me to add that they're the same color as her favorite shade of lipstick so that it'll be easier for Jamie when we come back.''
The smile vanished from Jamie's face as he seemingly finally noticed the difference in his boxers. He also started fingering the fabric and searching for stains.
''Don't worry boys we looked and didn't touch. Why bother to pick unripe fruit? Anyway sit tight and we'll be right back for you soon. Or try to make a break for it. We'd love to pick our giggly little grooms out of the feathers so that you'll still be giggling when we bring you to the Clown Prince. You will either way boys. Just saving some time would be nice. Signed Butter.''

''How long have we been in here asleep do you think Chris?''
''WHY WOULD THAT MATTER?!''
''BECAUSE Chris! How much time do we have left? No chance I'm waiting for them to come back. How long do we have to get out of here?!''
''HOW would we get out of here?! We can't walk in that!''
''What do you want?! To wait for them to come back!? WE NEED TO GET OUT OF HERE!''
What're we gonna do? Crawl?''
''Why not? Will that be any worse than what they're gonna do?! We have no idea how long we have! Look Chris!''
Jamie pointed at the wall where over what seemed to sea of feathers was a few loose board. In stark contrast to the rest of the room which looked immaculately maintained and even recently cleaned. One board seemed to be hanging on by one side and even swinging slightly. The others around it also looked odd. Maybe they could be moved? A good a chance as any for the ticklish boys.

Chris bit his lip. Jamie was right. It was either take some extra tickles now and try to escape or wait here for the guaranteed ticklish times the Clowns had in store.
''You-Your right.b-but what if we can't get through!?''
''Cross that bridge when it comes. It'll tickle but just try to keep feet up as there's no way it can tickle worse than that did.''
''Why'd they have to take our pants?!''
''Probably why they did it. For the best as we should probably keep our legs up as we go. Despite everything tonight I've never felt a worse tickle then when we touched that carpet. We gotta go Chris not leaving you but have got to go.''
''Bu-bu-BAHAHAWHEEWHEEWHY?!''
Chris was cut off by Jamie shoving him down off the couch so that he belly flopped on feathers. True friend he was though he kept the boys feet up and out of the jungle of feathers they were about to crawl through.
''Sorry man but we need to double time it. Just keep your feet up and we should make it.''

Chris started to crawl towards their hopeful escape laughing the whole way though but managing to choke the worst of it back. As Jamie started to climb in right behind him he paused to grab him by the wrist and yank him down in as revenge.
'Yo-YOHOHOHEHE JEHEHEHERK''
''Doehheuble time ihiht buhuhddy.''
''Yohohou cahahan't wihin in a fair fihihght.''
The boys crawled forward awkwardly. Hands and knees going to work hindered as they wee by the need to keep their ravaged but now pink soles to the sky. They moved forward giggling and squeaking as they advanced. Through the feather filled haze Chris noticed unreasonably cool the room was. Despite how hot he felt through their crawl from a combination of the effort and the feathery assault. His legs felt like they were almost freezing. He hadn't noticed any vents in the room. He swore he could feel air beating down on him. It almost felt like there were tendrils of icy air running up his calves at times.

''HEEEEHEEEK''
''Yohohouu okahay mahahan?''
''I cohohuld sweheeheear I fehelt a fihihnger.''
''Whahat?''
''N-Nehehever mihind.''
Chris stopped worrying about the phantom finger at reaching the wall. He easily swung the board away and after Jamie arrived to help they'd moved a few boards and had climbed into their new tunnel. They pulled the boards back behind them and started towards the light they could see at the other end.

''See Chris?! We're fine. just keep going t-towards th-the light.''
''Wh-why's it s-s-so cold in he-here. It's fr-freezing.''
''Ju-just come on Ch-Chris.''
Both boys went quiet as they heard they door open back in the room they'd just escaped from they heard movement and laughter.
''C'mon just keep going . We're almost there.''
''Stay quiet Jamie!''
''Take your own advice!

While the boys argued they paid less attention to where they were going in their high speed awkward crawl trying to keep their oil ravaged soles away from any hazards. So when Chris accidentally elbowed the wall abit too hard he jostled the old foundations he thought nothing of it. Despite the strange level of cleanliness in the last room Featherton manor was am old building that hadn't seen regular use by a living soul in a while. As such a number of pests had inhabited it.

One little millipede was knocked from his home by the careless boy's fumbling. As it fell the pest braced itself but found itself spared the hard landing by an unexpected soft,warm and somewhat squirmy bed catching it. This was a new experience for the millions of legs that strode across the soft surface. As it wound itself around the strange little stems the creature had it been capable of such thoughts would have thanked it's lucky stars for having been saved and to have found such a wonderful new resting spot.

The one who had saved it however was wondering at first why it like a million tickly fingers had suddenly started drawing a line down his most sensitive feet and when they started to wrap themselves around the stems of his poor little toes the boy couldn't hold it any more. He couldn't focus on progress, stealth even the world anymore.
''MMPPGGAAUUUUGHAHAHAHA NAHAHA JAHAHAMMEEHEEHEE''
Chris shut up! They're gonna hear us!

''So that's where you are!''
Jamie looked back he saw the boards start being pulled off and Chris helpless. He didn't have time to think!

''CAHAHAHAAMM ONNAHAHHA''

She smiled as this was a flavor she hadn't enjoyed in many years.

''EEEEEEEEAAHGHAAaaaahah}hahaghaaple eheeeseenohohohoh''

Chris tried to distract himself with some exploring of his own. Their new location was a stark contrast to their previous enclosure. The ridiculous feather carpet was gone replaced with a cold stone floor which on his ravaged feet felt wonderful. ''Nnnna Wh-wha lemme gooo''

''Chr-Chris man I c-can see through her!''

''W-wait please let me go'' the chained boy begged. ''I-I can get w-whatever you wa-want my sister has connections!''
''Sugar just breathe'' Mrs. Featherton said revealing a long southern drawl as she pinched the boy's cheek and held it following him when he tried to pull away. ''Heehehe lemme gooo pleheeeheease I'll leave and never come back, I'll tell Ting to leeeeeHEEEEve, We'll goooooOHOHOO and never come bACKAAHHAAAHA.''
At random intervals in the boy's groveling she would suddenly poke deep into the sensitive hollows before resuming her tracing.
''Delicious little meal o' mine. You think Ah want you to leave my house and never come back? How long have you all been having your ticklish little games here? Have you noticed that door? ''FEHEHAHEHE PLEEASE! I-I never dihihid anything to YEWEW guys! I just gave Ting and her gihihihls RIHIHIHIDES STAHAHAP!

''H-h-HEHE-Hehelllpp MEHEHEHHE I didn't do anything to you GAHAHAAH no no no please don't leave me HEEEREHAHAHA''

''MMMPPHHGHHHMMPPGGHH!!''

''Chris we can't leav-''
''Jamie shut it''
''NOBODY DESERVES THAT!

''MMPGGHHBYAHAHEEEHEEEWHEEE''

It had been 13 long years. 13 Years ago tonight Summer Salt along with her sister Mouse had entered Featherton Manor to confront the Clown Prince and gang of clowns. After a torturously long night of being tickled, tickling and fighting to stop tickling Summer had tricked the Clown Prince into a trap where he stayed until the police arrived to find the villain in tears and begging for jail to save him from the super sleuth who had tickled him furiously for hours.

Summer had made the Prince confess to every single one of his crimes. All of his clowns had been rounded up due to his confessions and the victims he had trapped in the mansion were freed even Pao-Ting, Summer's rival was freed from the tickly grasp of a particularly evil trio of clowns named Butter,Cream and Cheese who she'd tried to confront but instead been captured by.

However not everything turned out great. As tonight also marked 13 years since Summer last saw her childhood friends Chris and Jamie. The two boys had come with the Salt sisters to help them solve the mystery but the last Summer had ever seen of the boys was when she'd made the decision for them to split up in the manor. After the Clown Prince was arrested Summer followed along with the case waiting for the villain to give up the location of the boys. Eventually despite the Clown Prince's insistence that he'd not had the boys the police ruled it as the case taking a more sinister turn and locking the man up for life.

13 years and despite help from Pao-Ting who had bonded with Summer over her own older brother going missing that same night the girl detective had not a single clue in the disappearance of her fellow Mystery Solvers. She'd been back to the manor hundreds of times looking for any kind of clues. Something that would help her find the boys that every night when she closed her eyes she saw asking her if splitting up was the best idea. That she'd left to whatever had happened to them that was most definitely her fault.

She'd been in this room which was the backdrop for that scene hundreds of times as well. She'd searched all over this room looking for anything. She'd found the hidden room behind the painting and the feather carpeted chamber but she still had no idea. Interrogations of Butter had revealed that the last place they'd seen Jamie and Chris to be the feather chamber....Wait.

Had that painting always looked like that? Summer didn't remember such a dark scene as that being in this room. She could of sworn it had been some kind of tickling based Mona Lisa thing...not this. The painting of three young adult males stretched out and in chains and padded stocks was a new feature to her. As she drew closer she saw that the painting may have changed but the theme of it had stayed. These boys were being tickled and terribly so Summer could tell.

Strange hands and feathers assaulted the males from all angles. Feathers dipped into ears, neckbones were pinched and bellybuttons were literally stuffed with feathers and probing fingers. The mens faces were partially hidden by lacy blindfolds but judging by the redness and streaked tears that could be seen the artist was trying to convey that this had been going for a while. As a receiver of tickles that went over the edge Summer could tell that these guys were at the level of laughter where they were just choking out soundless laughs and attempting to breath as that was all they could do.


As Summer looked over the painting she stopped cold as the spark of recognition lit up her mind. The boy in the middle...that brown hair and smaller form...No...that couldn't be him. As she looked over the middle victim she felt the room grow colder as she mentally aged her childhood friend in her head thinking of how the boy would have looked after thirteen years of growth. There was no doubt
that this was her friend Chris Sullivan. This was her childhood friend who she'd been searching for for thirteen years and that was definitely Jamie Cross beside him which meant that eldest looking tickle victim must be Pao-Ting's missing older brother Pao-Yu.

Summer's eye welled up with tears. After searching for them for so long to find something like this mocking her, showing her the fate that had befallen the boys that she had left to their fate. They were extremely pale like they hadn't seen the sun in the entire time that they'd been missing. Their hair was long and dirty looking and their ribs were poking out which the ghostly hands took advantage of as each one of the little ribs poking forwards was either being pinched, stroked or scratched. Their arms were stretched above their heads but summer couldn't even see the hollows due to the feeding frenzy of hands and feathers blocking any sight of the sensitive skin from Summer's view.

This hadn't been here before. Summer had been over this manor a million times in this room in particular. This building was roped off to the general public, nobody should have been here, Who could have put have this here!? Where did they have them all this time and where were they now! How could she help her friends and punish this person! This level of torture for people who only wanted to help!
''WHERE ARE THEY!?!'' Summer screamed.

As if reacting to Summer's screams the painting reacted. To Summer's everlasting horror the boys on the canvas started to squirm and writhe in accordance to the endless ticklish torments that they took. She watched and wanted to scream as the little movement the boys were afforded they tried to use only to be chased down by the ghostly tickle tools and hands so that they'd resume their soundless and sightless screams. Now brushes, forks and pens joined the feathers and hands in tormenting the young adults. Summer watched as forks stuck themselves between the ribs of Jamie, Brushes circled and scrubbed the neck of Pao-Yu while pens wrote a missive upon Chris's heaving chest.

''WHY DID YOU LEAVE US SUMMER?''

''I-I DIDN'T! THE-THERE WAS NO WAY FOR ME TO KNOW!!''

The chains binding Pao-Yu's hands above his head raised o there own stretching him out and exposing more canvas for the pens to express themselves on. They responded to Summer's denial as the poor former henchman seemed to wheeze and gasp for air through his hysteria.

''WE'VE BEEN HERE SO LONG BECAUSE OF YOU SUMMER. SO LONG SINCE YOU LEFT US.''

''I-I-I LOOKED EVER-EVERYWHERE FOR YOU! I THOUGHT THE CL-CLOWN PRINCE HAD YOU!''
Despite how loudly she screamed and the hot tears now streaming down her cheeks the room seemed freezing to Summer her own breath becoming visible as the forks started raking Jamie's captive soles and the pens wrote another ghostly letter to the ''Hero of Featherton''.

''PLEASE. WE'RE SO TIRED OF LAUGHING SUMMER. MAKE HER STOP!'' read the now still lightly muscled chest of Pao-Ting's missing older brother. He was slumped in his bonds despite the stretched out poition he had been forced into. His lips still blubbered occasionally giving the detective a clue that he was still alive but his limit was coming up fast.

Summer reached towards the painting only to recoil when the canvas bulged towards her hand like a wild animal snapping at food. She looked up and saw the adorning her friends had changed. Now Chris read ''TOUCH THE PAINTING SUMMER. COME IN HERE AND HELP US PLEASE! WE CAN'T LAST MUCH LONGER.''

Summer reached out once more but this time the painting lashed out even further causing the girl to take steps back as warning bells in her head sounded. None of this seemed right to her and as much as she wanted to help her childhood friends she'd learned about traps very early in her life and the disappearence of Pao-Ting had her even more on edge...but they were right there! Sweet Chris and Strong Jamie who she hadn't seen for thirteen years They were right there and they were begging for help. BEGGING FOR HER TO HELP! As her eyes roamed across the painting she saw a letter written on Jamie's soles addressing her reluctance. Made clearer for her to read by a spectral glove holding each and every one of his toes bent back so that his skin was both taut and legible. The occasional poke by a fork scratching at the helpless toe stems punctuated each word almost supernaturally for Summer's reading.

''SHE SAYS SHE'LL STOP IF YOU JOIN US IN HERE SUMMER! SHE'S BEEN DOING IT FOR SO LONG BUT SHE SAYS SHE'LL STOP IF YOU COME IN!

Who was she? There were too many questions and literally no answers. Summer's mind screamed at her but once more she reached out to the canvas which drew back clearly preparing to strike at her. The girl had always been logical, clearheaded and calculating but whoever was doing these things to her friends was preying on the biggest mistake of her sleuthing record and so far it was working. Her instincts still kept her as she pulled her hand back as the painting snapped out and distended itself almost a foot now trying to snag her hand. She recoiled her eyes stinging from the tears trying to figure out if she should leave and come back. Get the police, a priest anybody to help her here.

When she looked at Chris's face an icy spike of clarity silenced her doubts as she saw the boy's mouthing only word. Over and over and through the smile that had consumed his face and being his mouth simply kept saying.
please. Please. PLEASE. PLEASE!

Summer threw caution to the wind and ran face first into the canvas. Jamming her hand through and reaching towards Chris trying to grab at the boy. She felt nothing but empty air on the other side though,
When she tried to pull her hand back she found it instead being pulled in deeper. The painting acting as quicksand pulling the girl through into some place that she only had one word to describe according to what she could feel on the other side.



Cold...

Her eyes looked and saw a new message. Now each of the boys soles had a letter drawn upon.

T.H.E. E.N.D

''Sugar did you have a fun run? This foot of yours looks sore. Let's loosen it up a bit.''

Mrs. Featherton?! but he was running away from her! As she worked her thumbs in deep and began massaging away at his foot Jamie realized why this room seemed so empty. If he looked off in the distance he could make out the shape of the damn tub and could see some kind of shapes squirming past it and realized that there was no escape. He couldn't get away and as Chris begged for mama to get back to counting piggies with him Jamie realized....
1321112311211321212211.title: She just keeps talking! Chris loses his mind an...

choices: Engine room
Kitchen
Stairway down
13212.content:
She had waited in the bushes close to the broken window until the night fell. The huge mansion now resembled a dark wall against the sky. Lights were only on in a few windows. Only tiny bright spots appeared between the blinds. It was almost quiet in the garden. Birds kept their distance any time of day. Only harvest flies and muffled sounds from the house could be heard.

When the boys had not returned from their Pokemon Go hunt Summer knew where to go. They had agreed to share the Family Tracker app on their mobile devices. And before the tracking results faded they were located just outside the high wall of the backyard of the Mansion. How could the boys be so foolish to go here on their own, ie without Summer. Their greed for points, levels and eggs must have made them blind to the danger. She shook her head to affirm herself of the boys' ignorance. Of course she had left her own device at home after she had removed the battery a few streets away.

It was time to move. Her sneakers were inaudible on the soft grass. Years of gymnastics made her flexible. The broken window as an easy task. Without touching the glass she entered into the dark room she meanwhile knew well from previous entries. Was it still unguarded? How should she proceed? The engine room for the lifts? The kitchen? The stairway further down she had never dared to explore?
13212.title: Summer searching for the kidnapped Chris and Jamie

choices: Arrive punctually, in force and after dark, at the back way to Featherton Manor
Straggle to their objective as opportunity permits (Strict curfew, duh!)
Decide they first need to tickle one another senseless to build morale
1322.content:
Chris is a girl -- and tough, despite resembling a reserved intellectual with wire-rim glasses . She's a little older than Summer and Jamie, though not enough to make their mutual friendship awkward.

Chris prefers to be called "Chris," as opposed to "Christina Dorothea Teresa Boliski" (by Jamie, when she insists on calling him "Jamie") or "Doozy" (by the sisters Salt, when they're teasing). And she despises the catcall of "Miss Prissy-Chrissy 'Liski," a reminder of her swot phase; now that she's in middle school, academic success just seems passé.

Though bookish and technically oriented, she doesn't have the intuition and perspicacity of Summer, nor the initiative and persistence of Jamie. Which is why they make up a junior-sleuthing team, she'd be quick to point out. Duh!

Finally, though Chris is loathe to admit it, being the "least ticklish" member of a small group is not the same thing as being "completely unticklish." She's just better at gritting her teeth.

After a bunch of kids go missing from their school, and following several days of speculation, research and planning, Chris and the group...
1322.title: Chris is a girl

choices: Chris takes her chances and goes for the full frontal approach
Chris sticks to the plan and jinks through the junkyard
13222.content:
Chris burned with shame as she shimmied down the drainspout outside her bedroom window, unable to believe she'd been driven to such corniness. But mom and dad knew all about her sleuthing around with Summer and Jamie, and when the kidnappings started she couldn't get away with her usual "going to the library" excuse anymore; she'd had to Bueller her bedclothes and resort to the Itsy Bitsy Express! Childish!

Things got more interesting as she skulked through the neighborhood, dodging cop cars and foot patrols. The whole town was hysterical about the recent abductions, but no one connected the flap with the spooky old mansion at the edge of the swamp.

"Duh!" Chris muttered under her breath, breaking across Elm Street where the lights were out. In her 'tactical purple' hoodie and cargo pants, she was pretty stealthy, and her favorite ratty hightops were too frazzled by a summer of sleuthing to raise even a squeak. Given the state of things, Chris was glad she'd taken Summer's advice and foam-loaded all the tools in her pack and pockets. One ill-timed tinkle from the hardware could land her in the clink.

The final approach to Featherton Manor was a cakewalk. No kids lived way out here, so the fuzz didn't have to keep up appearances. Chris debated heading further down Totenhafer Drive to the junkyard and entering through the manor's back gate as they'd planned, but stopped to catch her breath and saw how inviting the front gate looked. She was already late...

Chris paused, grabbing the tapered wings of her jawline bob, tugging her hair in thought...
13222.title: Long after dark

choices: Head for the backyard and the cemetery -- maybe Summer and Jamie are there?
Sprint directly for the house and hope there aren't any 'surprises' on this side
132221.content:
After hesitating with her hand on the bars of the front gate, Chris decided it was a stupid risk. The walkway and front porch looked suspiciously innocent, and the gate didn't even have a lock.

As she turned away, something ran across the lawn and headed toward her. Chris drew back as several security lights snapped on, tripped by the motion of a... cat. Yep. Chris could see its shadow cast on the sidewalk through the gate's bars.

There was a low hissing sound from the house, then a sharper hiss from the cat. The lights went back out, and the cat wormed through the ironwork onto the sidewalk. It was glowing, green as a lume stick, diffidently shaking its paws and stinking of whatever it had been sprayed with.

"What the...?" Chris whispered to herself, managing not to crack up.

The cat turned out to be more than chance entertainment; as it proceeded away from Chris along the sidewalk, it ducked into the thorny bushes growing outside the manor's block wall and paused to lick at its luminous fur. The wall-trained pyracantha had been enough to discourage any up-and-over plans when she'd reconned the area with Summer and Jamie two days ago, but the glowing cat revealed there was a break in the hedge and a tunnel through the thorns. She'd never have seen it, otherwise.

Chris looked around, made a larger entrance for herself (very carefully, the going still brambled enough to make her wince a few times), and squatted down in the low passage. Someone had done a great job sculpting through the spiky foliage, even if she had to duck-walk the length of the tunnel and work her pack and right sleeve loose from the occasional sticker.

The cat was keeping its distance from her, torn between running away and cleaning itself. It provided more than enough light, and eventually pointed the way out at the far end of the excavation: there was a complete hole in the wall, six blocks pulled out and neatly piled to one side. Chris went through on her knees without even needing to take her backpack off.

The shrubbery on the inside of the wall consisted of much friendlier honeysuckle, which Chris squirmed through easily enough. She had a great view of Featherton Manor's side yard, the grounds cutting away at angles toward both the front and back of the mansion. Chris watched the cat disappear into the rising fog, heading for the back gate and the cemetery beyond.

This side of the house looked safe, a nearly blank wall rising to the manor's distinctive garrets and cupolas. There was a gazebo between her and the mansion which would make for good cover as she proceeded out.

Chris decided to...
132221.title: A prickly pairing

choices: Creeps down the ramp on stealthy, hightopped tiptoe to see what's going on
Runs back to the 'Secret Enterance,' shouting and kicking to be let in!
1322212.content:
While the fog thickened, Chris broke out her Brunton Epochs from a cargo pocket and had a closer look at the house. She didn't even see any light fixtures on this side, so there probably wasn't anything to squirt her with that glow-in-the-dark stuff.

She did notice an electrical junction box that seemed out of place -- mostly because there was no conduit running into it. Duh. Packing the optics away, she spent several minutes listening for any sound of Summer or Jamie. Nothing...

Once the fog from the swamp had thickened to an almost edible density, Chris made for the gazebo as quietly as possible, and then angled off in the general direction of the box she'd spotted.

Chris nearly tripped over a cellar door that was buried in shadows and flush with the ground. Someone had used stencils to spray paint "Secret Enterance" on the iron-banded slats, which meant they were bad spellers in addition to underestimating the local sleuthers.

Checking the ironic impulse to knock on the door and scream "DUH!" at anyone who'd answer, Chris kept looking for the junction box and spotted it: unpainted, very new, and nearly as obvious as the 'secret' door.

Dipping into a pocket, her beloved Skeletool jumped into her hand (she even smooched its tungsten coat). Chris flipped the combo blade out and started to work on the faceplate, keeping back just in case the thing was boobytrapped. The plate flipped open on a hinge, revealing an electronic keypad so new that it still smelled of its packaging. Ha!

The grommet holding the pad in place had been hastily installed, and Chris thought she might pry it off and get at the wiring. Or else pluck out her 'Berry and reference the appropriate de Bruijn sequence, though that'd take some time to input and assumed a really stupid keypad. Or...

Chris's train of thought was interrupted by a crackle of paper underfoot. Dipping down, she came up with a Post-It, on which was scrawled a five-digit code with fat, girlish cursive scolding, "dont fergit!!!!"

Four exclamation points, each one dotted with a heart.

"I'll bet if I kicked this place hard enough, it'd fall right over," she groaned, starting to slap her forehead... before considering the note's code might be a trap.

Chris thought it over, looked at the hearts again, and keyed the numbers.

A piece of wall vanished just to the left with a 'Whhfft!' of compressed air. A ramp led down a short corridor and veered into a larger, open area; Chris could see distant light, and heard voices mixed with an occasional squeal of giggles.

Chris promptly...
1322212.title: B&E

choices: Chris tries to create a diversion that'll get the clown girls out of the room
Chris checks the shelves for something that might subdue the clown girls
13222121.content:
Chris stepped in just as the panel sighed shut, sealing her in the dim hallway. She could make sense of the voices, now. Even the giggling sounded familiar.

"Yeah, there are three, but they're the wrong three!" someone complained. It sounded like an older girl. "OK, two of them are the right ones, but the littler kid is Salt's brat sister. There's supposed to be another girl, same age as Salt and her boyfriend."

Chris hung back before peeking around the corner, trying to determine where everyone was by sound alone. The complainer was talking to somebody on a radio -- someone who'd apparently been ordered to catch Chris herself! A good thing she hadn't tried going through the junkyard.

"Little Boss sent M&M out, so I hope you got her that updated gluepot map... because we don't want them coming back to kung-fu us! And Crispy wants first crack at these snot-nosed wannabes, but only the complete set. So you maybe understand why I don't care how cold it gets or how you can't see a thing -- you're on that back gate until the third kid shows up. No, she will, don't sweat it. These goody-goodies always stick together. There hasn't been anything up front tonight but a cat -- which, yeah, I already know you saw, because how could you miss it?! So keep your eyes open. She'll probably try sliding past you in the fog. And if she does somehow get around you, then... nice knowin' ya. Not."

Chris heard more giggling, realizing who it was. She took a quick peek around the corner, and then settled for proper spying when she found herself completely out of sight.

Summer, Jamie, and Mouse were all tied up and packed in some sort of tricked out Tilt-A-Whirl car. Their wrists were bound together, and they'd had their shoes removed, their bare feet fastened to the grab bar with pink foam rubber (or something that at least looked pretty comfortable). Summer and Jamie had been gagged with their own socks, but Mouse had avoided that indignity. She did have kind of a cute laugh for a pain in the neck, so maybe that had saved her.

Their captors were three girls dressed as clowns. Naughty clowns, Chris figured, since they were wearing candy-striped spandex catsuits with equally colorful heels. Though they looked a little 'light' to be truly wicked, and their florid Pippi wigs undermined any sense of lewdness. High schoolers? The Clown Prince must have been desperate for help.

The henchgirls were made up as grotesques, their greasepainted faces exaggerated into a simper, a sneer, and a genuine (if overdone) smile. Sneer was the one with the radio, and Smiley was the one occasionally tickling Mouse's feet -- to the visible enjoyment of both, strangely enough. Simper was working her way through a stack of Amusement Business Weeklies, ignoring everyone. Summer and Jamie just scowled, occasionally testing their bonds and making angry noises behind their respective mouthfuls of sock.

The big room they were all occupying was cylindrical, looking like a deluxe version of that carnival ride where you spin around and stick to the wall. An intricate collection of shelves bordered half the room in a semicircle, and there was plenty of space between this and the wall for Chris to hide behind. The shelves were so loaded with junk, from plush midway toys to wrapped gag shop merchandise, that no one could see her unless they came looking.

Now all she had to do was figure out how to rescue the gang from the clown girls...
13222121.title: Clownhousewarming

choices: Chris quickly frees the rest of the gang, and they decide how to proceed
Chris can't resist, and spends a few moments tickling her friends' feet
132221212.content:
"Don't get her too worked up, Lee," Chris heard Sneer say, chiding the clown who was tickling Mouse. "We handle defrosting... and Crispy fries 'em."

"But she likes it, Lin!" Lee protested, squeezing another peal of laughter from Mouse. "Try it!"

"Well, if you wear her out, you're taking her place. I got enough of that during our initiation."

Chris hunkered down and slid along at a creep to avoid making any noise or sudden movements, continuing her search for an item that might save the day. Unfortunately, the offerings were a little slim for her needs, plastic vomit and wind-up teeth not likely to faze the Clown Prince's underlings. She was actually grateful for those moments when Smiley gave some attention to Mouse's feet, the kid's squealing enough to cover the sound of Chris hastily shuffling forward.

As she drew even with her colleagues on the far side of the racked merchandise, something substantial presented itself. Concealed behind a platoon of rubber chickens was a gigantic set of doll legs. That's what Chris assumed they were, anyway. Palletized and half-heartedly shrink-wrapped, the things were clearly meant to be the gams of some cute and cuddly thing that would top out at two-and-a-half meters. The glossy black Mary Janes were the length of Chris's forearm, and the white stockings with navy stripes looked like they could swallow a Ford Fiesta. From dimpled knees to mid-thigh, the rubbery doll-skin escaped the socks... but the mechanism from that point was all business. Segmented alloy shafts projected upward, bent ninety degrees, and met in a mirrored globe the size of a basketball. The orb bore a sinister resemblance to the flying, brain-sucking spheres in those movies Jamie loved.

Taking a closer look, Chris saw just what she'd hoped for: a break in the seamlessly reflective finish that revealed a simple O/| power toggle. It looked as though a large knob had been in place before, and then removed. But Chris could see a 6-star indentation that looked just right for a Torx bit, so she grinned and came up with her Skeletool (smooch).

"What's that humming noise?" Lee asked, fingers poised over Mouse's helpless soles as she looked around.

The room was suddenly involved with rubber chickens, kicked into flight by the autonomous dolly legs. The right foot balanced primly on tiptoe, almost as though apologizing for the dramatic entrance, before stepping fully out of storage and deciding on its targets.

Chris knew she'd hit paydirt as soon as the clown triplets began screaming and scampering. She ducked through the space the legs had cleared and saw the sphere shooting a laser designator in the shape of a Mary Jane sole on Sneering Lin's spandexed butt. Prancing forward, the right foot delivered a kick that flipped Lin out of her heels, the THWAP! of contact making Chris flinch in sympathy. Lin howled with outrage and sprinted away, making better time without her shoes. With her partners left behind as speed bumps, it became a prospect of 'devil take the hindmost,' further shouts of dismay and stung pride attendant on each THWAP! The henchgirls managed to get another hidden panel open and charged up the stairway it concealed, Legs sashaying after them and gamely assisting their ascent.

"CHRIS!" shouted Mouse, straining to peek over her toes and see her rescuer.

"I got stuck in traffic," Chris said, trying to hold back her self-satisfied grin. "I guess you guys carpooled it?"
132221212.title: Kick out the jams

choices: The rickety old stairs, leading up
The claustrophobically cozy elevator, going down
1322212121.content:
"So how did you manage to get in, Chris?" Jamie asked, after she'd gotten his socks out of his mouth. Both he and Summer looked a little stung at the turn of events.

Chris explained how the villains occupying Featherton Manor had unwittingly shown her the alternate approach. She also detailed her precise path, in case any of the gang were later separated and forced to find their own way off the property.

"And how exactly did all of you manage to get..." Chris began, trying not to look as prim as she felt. She made quick work of the stuff binding her friends in place, and the three immediately got their socks and shoes back on.

"Never mind about that now," Summer quickly said, disregarding Chris's query with a furious blush. "Were you able to find any clues during your stroll?"

"Just this." said Chris, offering the slip of paper with the door code, which instantly took the edge off Summer's annoyance.

"The handwriting's obviously the work of one of the empty-headed Thorn triplets," said Summer. "And the code could have some other meaning, so keep your eyes peeled for a pattern. The Post-It seems to have a watermark, but I can't make it out..." Summer drifted off into one of her sleuthing fugues, gripping her chin savagely between thumb and forefinger.

"Those were the Thorn sisters?" Chris asked, dumbfounded. It made perfect sense, now that she had time to consider it: Leela, Linsey, and Lissa had vanished some weeks before the current round of kidnappings had started, but the romantic rumor was that they'd run off to the city! Ha! And they'd instead been recruited by the Clown Prince?!

"Duh!" said Jamie, pleased into a really irritating smirk at the chance to turn Chris's catch phrase against her.

"Sure, I'm a little slow tonight," said Chris, arching her brow. "Seeing as I was stupidly blundering my way to your rescue, I didn't get to know the floozies well enough for a round of 'This Little Piggy.'"

Jamie went crimson and looked away, which was more than Chris had expected.

"Omigod, did they, Jamie?!" Chris demanded, both delighted and appalled. "That's my job! Is that why you were gagged? You loudly informed them they didn't have the right?! My hero!"

"Umm, guys?" said Mouse, eyes on every curve of the room. "Shouldn't we get out of here before that thing stops kicking their butts, or someone else shows up?" The junior Salt had already made a preliminary circuit of their surroundings, employing her uncanny knack for detecting things hidden. In addition to the secret stairway the Thorn sisters had used for a bugout, the cylindrical chamber accommodated two other disguised passages: one with a set of rickety stairs befitting an abandoned mansion, and the other containing a recently added personnel lift.

"Mouse is right," Summer said, surfacing from deep thought. "Chris, take Mouse and track down any scrap of information that could tie the Clown Prince to whatever dastardly scheme is being carried out in the manor. If we go running for the authorities now, he might slip away before we have any solid evidence against him. I think I have an idea why CP's grabbed all those kids, and what he's planning to do with them."

"All of that from a Post-It note some dopey girl scribbled on?!" said Chris, flabbergasted. She was too amazed to be bothered at getting saddled with the kid.

Summer, as always, completely ignored Chris's open-mouthed disbelief.

"We'll meet back here in one half-hour, behind the shelving, to compare any pertinent discoveries," Summer declared. "If one group finds the other absent, they'll immediately leave by Chris's path and summon the police. If no one makes it back, we'll wing it."

"As usual," said Jamie, managing not to sound glum. Probably because he got to tag along with his crush.

"Synchronize watches!" said Chris, taking some pride in being the only one present whose timepiece received regular, accurate squirts from NIST -- which meant everyone else did the synchronizing, while she suppressed a gloating half-smile and felt justified in her technophilia.

The junior sleuths having ironed out their immediate strategy, Chris and Mouse headed for...
1322212121.title: Another improbable passageway

choices: Crawl through the door
Continue up the stairs
13222121211.content:
The junior detectives creeped their way up the rickety stairs.

"Are you sure we should be going up here? These stairs look like they're rotting. And what if we run into the Clown Prince!? We'll be done for!" pronounced Mouse.

"We have to! And we're not gonna run into him," said Chris, sounding a little reluctant to what she had said. What would happen if they ran into the Clown Prince?

"Well, if we do, It's your fault! Don't plan on me stickin' around..." replied Mouse

They continued up the steps, carefully and quiety. Soon they had made it to a platform, which had a small little door on it. The door stood only a few feet tall, one in which the girls would have to crawl through. Next to the doors was a winding stair case that looked like it stopped about 40 feet up.

"Where should we go?" asked Mouse
13222121211.title: The rickety old stairs, leading up

choices: Chris and Mouse go off to find Summer and Jamie
Someone's already waiting for a ride down! Double trouble!
13222121212.content:
"How come there's an elevator, do you think?" Mouse asked Chris.

"Quick way to the Featherton wine cellar?" Chris considered aloud, shrugging. "Duh?"

Both were in the lift, and not liking the look of it. The control panel was a long strip of too-modern touchscreen, at odds with the 'abandoned mansion' décor, and the car itself was about the size of a fat man's coffin. A short fat man.

Chris brushed a finger over the controls, which underwhelmed by presenting a really long (bright, colorful excessive) 'down' arrow.

Once the doors shut, a corporate logo was revealed on the brushed metal: two circles separated by an "ibe" abbreviation in that cutesy, lowercase script that resembled a kindergartner's scrawl.

"That looks really familiar, but..." Chris mused, breaking off as the doors opened.

Chris and Mouse were at one end of a short, circular corridor floored with some light-gray spongy stuff. A blond girl was on a step ladder right in front of them, boots off as she kept precarious balance on her perch and futzed with something in the ceiling. There were plenty of lights and more colorful controls at various points along the hallway, but these were flickering on and off as the girl continued making adjustments.

"Need any help?" Chris asked, half a second before the girl turned to see who was exiting the lift.

"Would y'all mind holdin' this light steady?" the blond asked, stepping down and handing Chris an LED beam. She looked maybe nineteen, had a pronounced southern accent, and didn't look at all surprised to find Chris and Mouse wandering around.

Chris nodded and obliged, Mouse holding the ladder still as the girl went back up. Several seconds later, the lights in the passage steadied, and an HVAC system whooshed into operation.

"She just had ta have everythin' installed in the wrong order," said the older girl, tucking tools away in her IBE corporate coveralls. "The security foam cannons, the laughin' gas canisters, that rotten foil junk she came up with... I said, 'Maybe we oughta worry about, y'know, lights and ventilation and surveillance stuff first, so ya can actually see what you're shootin' at,' but that didn't make much of an impression, so we're still playin' catch-up. Lucky break for you guys, though, 'cause else y'all'd be squirmin' around on the floor right now, beggin' for mercy."

"Who do you work for?" Chris asked, eyes narrowing. That dumb corporate logo was eating at her.

"Who the heck are we even talking to?!" Mouse asked, exasperated.

"Well, now, I'm Lottie Linhart-Corona... nanny, governess, general dogsbody," said the blond, leaning forward to shake hands. Her grin was so congenial and self-effacing that it was difficult not to like her. "And I already know you're Susie Salt, Summer's kid sister... and you're Chris Boliski, Summer's best friend. She's got dossiers on both of y'all, 'seize-on-sight' directives, et cetera. But with everythin' else I do, I specifically had a **no snitchin', no scufflin'** clause added to my contract, so y'all got no troubles with me."

"Oh, no!" Chris shouted, figuring it out. "IBE... Iron Ball Enterprises! You're working for that headache girl, Pao-Ting!" Chris pounded her forehead and stomped in place, miming a migraine. Mouse threw her hands in the air to signal her ongoing bewilderment.

"Well, duh," Lottie said, managing to make it sound friendly as she maintained her grin. "I'm surprised Michiko and Maruko didn't catch ya yet. Now, they're the muscle, and y'all might wanna skedaddle before they come back down to report in."

"Oh, Chuck..." came a voice from the overhead intercom. Mouse and Chris jumped, startled. Lottie just rolled her eyes.

"CHUCK!" the voice barked.

"Why, I'm right here, MA'AM!" Lottie responded, tapping a panel overhead. The overmodulated hum from the pager died down, and Lottie stood with her hands behind her, rocking on her heels.

"Are you talking to yourself out there? How's it going? When do I get to train these targeting reticules on my arch nemesis and her hapless flunkies?"

Chris bit a thumb to stifle the urge to shout back an insult. That was definitely Pao. And... did she say flunkies?!

"Why, I've only just now got the lights on proper and the a/c goin' so all your toys don't overheat, first time ya use 'em!" said Lottie. "The cameras and this sensor paddin' is next on the list."

"Chuck, you sound really comfortable and relaxed, for someone who's been hurling herself at my, well... 'light' work. Are you barefoot again?"

Lottie winced, slipping her boots back on. The embarrassed pause tipped Pao off.

"I knew it! If you're going to be that informal in our brand-new secret base, Chuck, I need you to come see me, right away. I've got a few really awful things that need calibrating, and an obedient country girl with no use for footwear would make for an ideal test subject!"

Lottie collected her step ladder, urging Chris and Mouse to silently scram back up the elevator.

"Oh, and... bring some of those mints with you," Pao asked, politely. "The good ones, Chuck, not the ones you've been trying to placate me with. I won't eat all of your private stock, this time. I promise."

Chris and Mouse got back in the lift and headed up.

"Can you even imagine working for her?" Chris asked Mouse, the younger girl pleased to be treated like a peer.

"Not if she'd eat all my candy, no way! It's just... who is she? Why's she down there? What's going on?"

"Oh, let's just find your sister," said Chris, sighing. "Things just got twice as bad, believe me."

The elevator doors open, and...
13222121212.title: Southern comfort

choices: Managed to get to the secret panel leading outside and make it across the yard
Got grabbed by Maruko and was promptly, expertly tickled into submission
132221212122.content:
When the elevator doors opened, two girls were already waiting for a ride down. Chris managed not to flinch, and Mouse didn't gasp loudly enough for either to hear.

They were both Asian, and appeared to be the same age as Lottie. Both had black hair that fell past their shoulders, both were wearing black jumpsuits... and the comparisons could proceed indefinitely, because they were identical twins. The only noticeable difference between the two was their footwear, the girl on the left missing a shoe, and the girl on the right down to a single sock.

To her credit, Chris thought very quickly. The clown girls had said something about "Little Boss sending M&M out," and something else about... gluepots?

"Pao didn't think that map was accurate," said Chris, nodding with what she hoped looked like rueful commiseration.

"Yes, we experienced some difficulty," said the twin with one sock. Her quiet, neutral tone was a little unsettling.

"Are we mistaken in assuming your names are Chris and Susan... pardon me, 'Mouse'?" the other half of the act queried. "We have spent some time searching the grounds for you, Chris."

"We are equally pleased to have Summer Salt's younger sister as a guest, also."

Chris groaned inwardly; was there anything worse than twins that took turns talking? If they started finishing each other's sentences, she'd scream.

"The funny thing is, we just visited with Pao and have to go back out on an errand," Chris said, watching to see if they'd buy it. "We sort of hoped you could tell us where not to walk? Lottie needs your help getting the cameras working, too."

"It is not likely that you would be sent without our accompaniment, even assuming some unforeseen circumstance occurred which makes you now the comrades of our mistress and not her... honored guests," said Sock.

"Let us return together, properly clothe ourselves, and speak to the mistress about your errand," said Shoe. Whatever brief confusion Chris had managed to cause between them was fading.

"You oughta go like you are right now, so we can tell you guys apart," Mouse suggested, realizing that her paralyzed uncertainty wasn't helping matters.

"I am Maruko," said Sock, bowing her head in introduction.

"And I am Michiko," said Shoe, bowing similarly as she moved to close the distance between herself and Mouse. "Tell us, if you have just recently left the quarters of our mistress... how has she outfitted herself for the day?"

"Huh?" said Chris, knowing she could buy a few seconds at best with her temporizing. She could angle past Maruko, maybe, and get back behind the shelves, try and duck outside... but Mouse was toast. Michiko all but had a hand on her, and Maruko was going to make a friendly grab any second now.

"What was she wearing?" Maruko clarified.

"Not a stitch, unless you count the bows in her hair," said Chris, praying that might raise a chuckle. "She's got oodles of self-confidence, but that's about it."

Chris could see Maruko holding back the ghostliest ghost of a smile, which must have meant she was wildly amused. Chris snaked a foot out and tried to stomp Maruko's toes. The older girl drew her vulnerable foot away, smooth as silk, but it left her off balance for a crucial second. Chris cut to the right and sprinted, feeling like a total loser for leaving Mouse... but if they both got bagged, Summer and Jamie wouldn't know what had happened. They'd probably try the elevator and walk right into Pao's lair, having no clue she was in on this caper.

As Chris sprinted around the Tilt-A-Whirl car and somehow maneuvered around the junk scattered on the floor, she...
132221212122.title: Double or Quits

choices: Walk over and see if she can help Maruko out of her predicament, somehow...
Head back inside for the rest of the gang; she'll send help, if she can...
1322212121221.content:
Blind luck got Chris to the door she'd entered through, Maruko forced to slow just before making a grab and slipping on one of the rubber chickens scattered earlier.

From the inside, the panel's trigger had been kept simple: a big green button, backlit, with no keypad. Chris hit it and slammed her right shoulder against the opening panel in her haste to get out.

Back in the side yard, Chris thought she'd been plopped down in a world of cotton. The fog was so thick that she could barely see her hand flapping in front of her nose -- but she did see the advantage, and took several quiet steps away from the secret door along the side of the house. As she stopped, getting her breath under control, the panel hissed open again. She heard Maruko pad out onto the lawn, but saw nothing other than swirling fog.

A minute's wait started to work on her nerves, Chris having no idea where her pursuer had gotten to. For all she knew, Maruko had been clever enough to stop and listen for some sound from her... but the acoustics in the fog were weirded out, too. Chris thought she was hearing whispers, and then seeing a faint glow nearby. She tucked her glasses into a pocket, tired of wiping them clear.

Chris heard a gooey, slapping sound a few yards off, followed by muttered curses in another language. The phantom light she'd noticed earlier was back, brighter, resolving into a will-o'-the-wisp. Chris followed it and stopped short, spotting Maruko just ahead.

Though Chris could see Maruko clearly, the reverse didn't hold. Maruko looked right at her several times with no sign of recognition. The older girl had finally run out of luck, and Chris got her first look at a 'gluepot.' The trap consisted of a hole in the ground roughly a foot in diameter, filled with... white stuff. Well, it looked like Elmer's glue, so the name fit.

Maruko's misfortune was in finding one with her bare foot. Tugging with considerable strength, both hands behind her knee, she was able to raise her trapped foot a few inches. But only a few inches; the glue, stretching like taffy, yanked her foot back into place each time with a tacky sucking sound. Maruko groaned with exasperation, music to Chris's ears. She found herself grinning.

The whispers in the mist were undeniable, now. Even Maruko looked around, clearly puzzled. As the mutters of an unseen multitude rose in volume, things started happening to Maruko.

A loop of brume furled around Maruko's right wrist and tugged. She pulled back, gasping with surprise, but the fog was stronger. Inch by struggling inch, her arm was pulled over her head. And then the other, and she was pinioned. The only thing anchoring her to terra firma was the trap she'd stepped in, her socked foot sweeping the air above the grass.

Chris should have recoiled, as freaked out by the unseen force as Maruko, but she had a feeling she knew what came next.

Maruko hissed, pushing her head against her right shoulder at an awkward angle. She clearly wanted to move her arm, but was prevented by the mist she'd been ringleted by. She gasped a few times, squirmed heroically, and then began giggling.

Chris watched as tendrils of fog poked at Maruko, settling and stroking. Maruko squinted so hard Chris thought she heard a blood vessel pop. The giggling got louder, and the trapped girl writhed helplessly in midair like a marionette with its strings tangled.

Maruko's remaining sock was peeled away and thrown at Chris (who caught it, absentmindedly tucking it away in a pocket), and the floodgates opened. The laughter Maruko had begrudged was being wrung out of her a lungful at a time. She shouted for help, looked ashamed to have been driven to that, and then vented an ear-splitting shriek that seemed to fall dead in the fog.

Maruko's scream represented her last slice of intractability, the next minute of the fog's attentiveness leaving her only enough respirational ambition for squeals and peals. Watching the girl she'd run in fear from being so casually dismantled was... very appealing, really. Chris considered getting her camera out, but decided the memory would be sweeter without distraction.

When the tears began to run down Maruko's face... they didn't. The droplets were sucked up and wicked away into the fog, and that seemed to be exactly what it was after. Maruko's ticklish tears floated, incandesced, and vanished. The haze apparently had a particular thirst.

There came a point where Maruko's frantic, streaming eyes and hopeless posture wore Chris down. There was also Mouse to consider, likely being entertained by Pao after this interlude. Summer and Jamie were going to be coming back to meet up in a few minutes as well.

Chris decides to...
1322212121221.title: Fogbound

choices: Chris Suffers hours of tickling with the other girl
Summer and Jamie have there own problems
13222121212211.content: she no more than get to her and she feels her self lifted in the air...Chris gasps as her arms are pulled over her head. then the mist grabs her ankles and pulls her tight...her body now completely ridged...she wimpers as her hoody rides up and she feels her shoes leave her foot.
13222121212211.title: Walk over and see if she can help Maruko out of...

choices: The fog continues to torture her bellybutton
The fogs move on somewhere else
132221212122111.content:
The tendrils of fog began to tease at her ears.

Strange place to start, thinks Chris. But she nonetheless tries to escape the light tickling by bending her head over to her raised arm. The fog seems quite smart; it starts tickling the other ear as she tries to protect her ear. This results in Chris trying to protect one ear as the fog tickled the other. Chris starts giggling as she starts to feel the adrenaline flow through her body.

"stop it!" she giggles. The light tickling that was just brushing her skin felt as though the fog was taunting her. She knew this wasn't it.

The fog begins to wrap around her abdomen. It looks like there are tiny little tendrils beginning to wrap around her torso from behind. There is tiny tendrils between each of her ribs. She can tell that this was going to go downhill in a while. She closes her eyes and prepares herself for the terrible tickling that is going to start directly at her ribs.

Suddenly, she felt a thickish tendril in her belly button wriggling like a frantic worm. Caught unawares, she screams as loud as she could and starts laughing. She tries to arch her back and to suck in her belly; anything to get the tendril out.

The tendril seemed to follow her every movement, making it impossible for her to escape from her predicament.
132221212122111.title: Chris suffers hours of tickling with the other ...

choices: Maruko finally lets Chris up.
Summer finds the pair of them.
1322212121221112.content:
As Chris continued to giggle, the fog tendrils began to explore.

Thick tendrils covered her sides, thin tendrils sneaked in through her short-sleeved T-shirt and slowly began to tease her underarms. More fog formed into a hand-shape and started to scratch her neck.


By this time, Chris was losing it. The ticklish tendrils had invaded her clothing and was tickling her bare skin. It was more than she could take. She was squealing and squirming in mid-air, trying desperately to escape the tendrils that followed her everywhere.

More tendrils sneaked up her jeans, scratching at the backs of her knees and squeezing her thighs. As she stomped the ground, even her sneakers were being loosened. Chris became panicked as the tendril's light teasing because heavy tickling. Not a single inch of her body was forgotten.

"Having fun?"

Chris, eyes streaming with ticklish tears, looked over at Maruko. The fog had left her, and she was standing up. Chris watched her as she tried to brush away the tickling tendrils.
