Maruko walked over to Chris and goosed her sides. Chris squealed and dropped to the ground. Quickly, Maruko flipped Chris onto her back, sat on top of her stomach and allowed Chris to squirm in place. With the relentless tickling of the fog, Chris was still laughing uncontrollably, trying to push Maruko off of her.

"It's cute. I thought you weren't ticklish." said Maruko.

The tendrils had been working. Chris' sneakers were coming off, and her socks were following. Her shirt had been raised over her head, revealing the tank top she wore underneath the shirt.

"Should I help you?" asked Maruko. She pulled the shirt off of Chris and slipped her fingers of expertise into Chris' bare underarms and wriggled them. Her intense tickling added to Chris' predicament, and Chris was continuously squealing and squirming.

"Let me tell you a secret, Chris." Maruko lowered her face to Chris' ear and whispered, "I like a good fight in my victims."

Chris' eyes bugged out. She was so confused. She had never been so ticklish in her life, but here she was, pinned by Maruko and having the life tickled out of her.

Maruko laughed. "Confused, aren't you? The fog has a special power. It doesn't just tickle... it heightens sensitivity. Especially around those it doesn't know. From now until forever, you will be much more ticklish than you've ever been in your entire life."

Maruko lowered herself and slid lower down on Chris' body, still tickling her underarms as she lowered her chin to tickle Chris' belly. Desperately, Chris tried to push Maruko's head away, but all the tickling had weakened her.

Meanwhile, the tendrils of fog had gotten her socks off. Tendrils sneaked between her toes and began to tickle her feet. The balls of her feet were teased, and her toes were scratched. Chris convulsed into silent laughter and could barely move for laughing.
1322212121221112.title: The fogs move on somewhere else

choices: Chris, Summer and Jamie collectively manage to get the best of Maruko
Maruko can handle three as easily as one, and the ticklish squealing goes treble
1322212121222.content:
Chancing a glance behind her, Chris saw Maruko easily -- almost mockingly -- closing the distance. The headlong dash she thought would get her free now seemed no more effective than a toddler's scampering. When Maruko caught her around the waist and lifted, the contact was so gently ineluctable that Chris at first thought she was levitating.

"Chris, please calm yourself," Maruko urged. Her poise suggested she could hold Chris up at arm's length for a few hours, if necessary.

Chris was frantic, kicking and flailing as she tried to do some damage, or at least unnerve Maruko enough to get herself dropped. But her captor didn't even look annoyed, much less shaken. Maruko's composure was supernatural.

When Chris had worn herself out with her thrashing, Maruko set her back down. Chris immediately thought to run, and was caught before she finished considering it.

"Are you willing to accompany me without further silliness?" Maruko asked, still quiet, unruffled, and completely sure of herself. Chris felt her eyes swim with tears of frustration, trying to swallow the lump in her throat.

Maruko, seeing the condition Chris was in, released her hold and gestured toward the elevator. Under other circumstance, Chris might have collected herself and followed along, relenting... but Maruko's impassivity made her feel like a bug under glass, and it was unbearable.

Chris made a move for one of her cargo pockets, deciding she'd get some reaction from the emotionless teen... and immediately succeeded on that count. Things happened so quickly that she was numbed with disbelief.

Maruko swept the area around them clear with her bare foot, simultaneously grabbing Chris, spinning her, and getting her backpack and hoodie off. Chris was then painlessly escorted to the floor, straddled, pinned, and allowed to squirm in place.

"Very well," said Maruko, looking down at Chris and smiling. "We will proceed with concession to the absurd."

Chris was astonished by the smile, but even more shocked when the fingers of Maruko's free hand darted under her shirt and traced along her ribs.

Having long ago established her credentials as a tooth-gritting, head-pounding knot of obstinacy when being tickled, Chris demolished that meager piece of refinement in the first few seconds under Maruko's skillful touch, braying laughter so unselfconsciously that she felt like a spectator.

That weird, out-of-body sensation lasted for perhaps another full second, at which point she stopped being a spectral observer and became a regular girl with ribs that were being tickled.

Chris had always thought the worst thing about being tickled was, underneath the annoyance and relative discomfort, it's still sort of fun. Maruko knew just where to tickle, for how long, and with the precise amount of intensity to boost the 'fun' ratio, which made Chris's earlier, baffled fury melt away, no matter how hard she tried to hang onto it.

Maruko stopped, released Chris, and stood over the gasping junior detective until she'd caught her breath.

"OK, OK!" Chris said, not feeling so bad about surrendering, now. She'd been bent, but not broken. "I'll go with you! Just give me a break!"

"Yes, you will go with me. And I am giving you a break, Chris. But I am not done tickling you."

Chris shrieked at the moderate assurance, though not entirely with horror. Rather than attempting to run away, she pounced at Maruko and tried turning the tables. Maruko laughed encouragingly as Chris struggled to tickle her, before again infiltrating her untucked shirt and going after her tummy.

Down on her knees, Chris tried wrapping her arms around herself and squeezing... anything to stop Maruko's wriggling fingers. Her determination led to a bad case of the snorts, and Chris watched helplessly as her glasses slid off her face. Maruko caught the spectacles before they hit the floor, setting them a safe distance away on Chris's backpack. Another respite was given.

"Are you finished?!" Chris demanded, bleary-eyed and trying to diguise the strange sense of amicability she was feeling.

"Of course not, Chris. Your feet."

That was enough to send Chris for the door, Maruko chuckling as she reeled her back in.

When Summer and Jamie returned on schedule after a half-hour, they found Chris prone, Maruko sitting on the backs of her knees. Chris's right foot was bared and under the weariless flick of Maruko's fingers; the junior sleuth was pounding the floor with her fists and had resorted to cramming a handy rubber chicken into her mouth to hold back the screams.

"Hey..." Summer started to complain, perplexed by the tableau.
1322212121222.title: Sleuth and nail

choices: Everyone head back upstairs, find a safe spot, and plan their next move
Everyone LEAVE Featherton Manor, get the cops, and to heck with any evidence!
13222121212221.content:
"Yes?" Maruko responded to Summer. She stopped tickling Chris's foot, but made no move to let her go.

"Hey, get off of our friend?!" Summer demanded, angrily gesturing Maruko to rise.

"But it is very enjoyable to tickle your friend," Maruko said, eyes darting between Summer and Jamie as she decided who to take down first. "Shall the Clown Prince have all the fun?"

Maruko resumed her assault on Chris's foot, getting another round of screeches from her. Chris realized it was a lot more embarrassing to be getting tickled in front of Summer and Jamie, and put up some token resistance.

"It's just that tickling Chris is our job," Jamie explained. "Don't look, Summer!"

Chris couldn't see what was going on, but it seemed like someone had put on a strobe light. It winked off before she could look over her shoulder, and Maruko had stopped working her poor, tortured foot. Chris wisely spent the free time gasping for breath.

"Get off of her," Jamie instructed. Maruko complied, and Chris staggered her way upright.

"What did you guys...?" Chris began, trailing off as she stepped around Maruko and looked at her face. The older girl seemed to be in a trance.

"We found one of these crammed in with a bunch of other junk in a closet upstairs," said Jamie, showing Chris some ring with a fat hypno-swirly pattern on it. "It's how the Clown Prince's goons have been grabbing the kids so easily. One shot of this, and anyone will do anything you tell them."

"Let's give her a ride on the Tilt-A-Whirl," said Summer, sounding uncharacteristically vindictive.

"No, you guys, listen," Chris said, getting her sock and shoe back on while rounding up the rest of her stuff. "She's working for Pao-Ting! Pao's got one of her patented secret bases right under us!"

"Pao-Ting?!" shouted Summer and Jamie -- because there was no way they'd forgotten last summer.

"It's worse! Maruko, here... her twin sister, Michiko, grabbed Mouse! She's down there right now!"

"That's too many Ms in a row!" said Jamie, trying to write it all down in his Notepad o'Clues.

"No," Summer whispered, face falling. "Pao will tickle the stuffing out of Mouse!"

"Not with that hypno-ring, she won't," said Chris. She put her glasses back on and walked for the elevator, instructing the mesmerized Maruko to tag along.


* * *


"My leg's starting to cramp," Jamie complained.

Chris, Summer, Jamie, and Maruko had all managed to jam into the tiny lift, which had been sort of like those old-timey pics of college students packing into a phone booth. Chris didn't mention he was standing on her recently tickled foot, because a little pain right there felt fine at the moment.

"OK, Maruko, have you got it?" Chris repeated. "You don't listen to anything anyone else tells you but me, all right? You take the ring, walk in and zap everyone you can. Send Mouse out, and then you and your sister catch Pao and tickle the sin out of her. I mean that literally -- tickle Pao until she turns into a good girl."

The junior sleuths shared a snort of laughter over the thought of that.

"Yes," said Maruko, quiet as usual. She took the ring and stepped out of the elevator, heading down the short walkway to Pao's sanctum.

"What took you so long?" Pao asked over the intercom as soon as Maruko stepped out of the lift. Lottie must have gotten the cameras working. "You didn't catch Summer's friend?! Mitch said you'd be right back with her! Get in here and tell me what happened, Marco! No mints for you, that's for sure!"

There was the sound of a hatch cycling, a surprised squawk from the intercom, and then silence. A really long silence.

"What the heck's going on in there?" Chris wondered aloud. The doorway cycled again, and the sleuths risked a peek out.

Mouse was walking down the hall, barefoot and disheveled -- and looking very blank.

"Geez, how hard did they tickle her?" Jamie asked, horrified.

"She's just hypnotized, Jamie," said Summer, relieved to see her sister. "She got hit with the ring, too. Mouse, come on! Run!"

Mouse ran to the elevator, looking hilariously unenthused about it. Chris sent them back up as Summer tried hugging her little sister in the cramped confines.

"How long does the effect last, anyway?" Chris asked Summer and Jamie, looking at Mouse's peacefully expressionless mug.

"Well... probably not too long, I guess," Jamie said, shrugging. "The ring didn't exactly come with an instruction manual. An hour? I don't know."

Once the group was back up in the circular room, Chris pried the touchscreen out of the elevator and found some promising contacts. The elevator doors partially shut, then opened. Half-shut, opened. The cycle would keep the car jammed in place, with any luck.

"I hope they don't have another way out of there," Jamie muttered.

"Let's bail, just in case," said Chris.

Chris and Jamie looked to Summer, who suggested...
13222121212221.title: Never had a pocket watch, never counted backwards

choices: Chris goes to investigate
Chris takes Mouse and hides under the bed
132221212122211.content:
Chris deferred to experience, following Summer and Jamie upstairs with Mouse stolidly bringing up the rear. The stairwell looked suitably abandoned, newel posts splintering and the runner coming up in tufts. A single, naked light bulb hung at the end of a long cord above the stairs, swaying and flickering.

The quartet proceeded through the only door at the top, stepping into a dimly lit hallway that angled past boarded windows covered by moldering lace curtains. Summer and Jamie headed for the first room on the right, no one speaking until the door was closed behind them, and then only in whispers.

"So what was your big brainstorm earlier?" Chris asked Summer, referring to the Post-It that had so exercised Summer's sleuthing instincts downstairs. She regarded the room's fusty old bed with distaste before straightening the rumpled duvet and having a seat, Mouse automatically following suit.

"It wasn't what that ditz had written that tipped me off, but the paper itself," Summer replied. "That watermark was part of the Iron Ball logo, and if one of the Clown Prince's minions was using corporate stationery, it stood to reason the big boss had teamed up with Pao and was getting spooned hardware for some nefarious scheme... I just had no idea she'd have set up base here, too."

"OK," Chris said, nodding, "but why would the Clown Prince want to cooperate with Pao?"

"I ignored what the clown girl had written and took a closer look at the note," said Summer. "It's too dark to see here, but trust me -- someone had written hard enough on the pad to leave an impression. I could just make out a hastily jotted inventory that matched something we found in our first encounter with CP."

"Oh, no," Chris groaned, flopping back on the bed and covering her eyes. "Something about schematics for that idiotic Gelotron thing he'd been trying to put together?!"

"That machine that collected laughter?" Jamie asked, looking uneasy. "We were wondering how he planned to get people to laugh. I hope it's not what I'm thinking..."

"It's pseudoscience!" Chris protested, sitting back up and scratching furiously at her nose. "There's no 'psychic residue' or 'emotional essence' that you can scoop out of thin air and decoct into a diabolical mixture that allows you to... what? Power some engine of doom to take over the world, or at least a couple of small inland counties? Duh! Total nonsense!"

"I think you should run and tell him, right away!' Jamie teased.

"It's not whether or not it actually works, Chris, but that he thinks it will," said Summer. "The man is patently insane!"

"So why's Pao doing business with him?" Chris asked. "She's not nuts, just a bratty evil genius."

"Maybe she wanted to team with someone who had it out for us as much as she did?" Jamie suggested. "I'll bet she wanted to help him build this thing and then <gulp> have him stick us in it."

"So instead of this dumb Gelotron just being some big woo-woo pyramid hat, it's... a tickling machine?" Chris considered, looking a little queasy.

"That's my considered deduction, yeah," said Summer, looking pleased with herself. "And based on the blueprints of the manor and the size of the device in the last set of diagrams we seized from CP, there's only one spot he could be putting it together."

"The attic!" said Jamie. "And I figured that out myself, Chris, so stop giving me dirty looks."

"So you want to climb up another two floors past who knows how many of CP's lackeys, sneak into the attic, swipe the specs for the current model, probably get pictures of the thing, then free all the kids and march down to the police station?" asked Chris -- although she didn't need to, because Summer smiled and nodded with each point of Chris's plan. "Oh, c'mon! Can I just... go back home and join the backgammon club or something? You guys are as crazy as CP!"

"Chris, think about it!" said Summer. "They already know we're here, and they're not tearing the place apart looking for us after we slipped out of the clown girls' clutches. These guys are slackers! I bet they're all sacked out right now, and they'll maybe start kicking around tomorrow at the crack of noon. After they've had a few slices of cold pizza."

"You're the boss," Chris muttered. They had prevailed with a similar game plan, last time. If the hirelings were still as stupid, it might work. "How are we going to get up there?"

"Jamie and I are going to scout ahead," said Summer. "We've already found a really convenient dumbwaiter. I want you to stay here with Mouse until she snaps out of it, then have her hide. You can catch up to us like this..." Summer provided a rough map of the mansion on a piece of Jamie's notepad paper, and the dynamic duo went back out quietly and left Chris babysitting.

"Are you going to snap out of it?" Chris asked Mouse, waving a hand in front of the kid's face without getting so much as a blink in response.

A few minutes later, there was a sound from the hallway...
132221212122211.title: Exposition Boudoir

choices: Chris convinces Pin to go after Summer and Jamie
Pin persuades Chris to leave Featherton Manor with her and get help
1322212121222112.content:
Chris, feeling less intrepid than ever after her humbling encounter with Maruko, decided to investigate from under the bed. Collecting Mouse, she arranged her charge and herself in the darkest corner and waited, peeking at the door.

Footsteps stopped just outside, the doorknob turning slowly. Chris held her breath. No option now but to keep hiding.

The bedroom door creaked inward enough to allow entrance for a kid, who slipped in with painstaking care and shut the door just as cautiously. When the newcomer turned, Chris could see it was a girl -- with a mop of ludicrously frizzy red hair and a Fauntleroy suit that looked as though it had been Deadheading since the Felt Forum opened; every motion she made changed the velvet a different color. Trippy.

The kicker was her face, which put Chris in doubtful hesitation. Greasepaint, red nose, painted smile, the works... but if she was part of the clown squad, why was she sneaking around?

Seeing the clown girl was looking to hide and about ready to crawl under the bed, Chris made the first move.

"Don't you knock?!" Chris demanded in a furious whisper. The clown girl gasped, biting down a yelp, bringing her head up fast and cracking it on the underside of the bed frame. Chris winced, catching the girl's oversized mandarin beanie as it tumbled off and dragging her under the bed.

And not a moment too soon! The door opened again, slamming against the wall, as a guy dressed in a ringmaster's outfit took a quick look inside.

"I told you they didn't make it upstairs," someone said from the hallway. "They ran home after they got loose, is my bet."

"A bet that may cost us..." the Barnum knockoff began, shutting the door as he continued chiding his partner in the hallway. Chris heaved a sigh of relief, along with her visitor.

"Who are you?" they both demanded of each other, following a silent minute spent listening to confirm their seekers were walking away. The clown girl lost the staring contest.

"My name's Crespina, and don't laugh," said the clown girl. Chris immediately felt some sympathy, the poor girl stuck with a first name so bad that it overwhelmed the rottenness of her own in full. "Call me Pin, though. Those guys are after both of us, I think."

Chris introduced herself to Pin, along with the still-entranced Mouse, and synopsized her business at Featherton Manor along with the high points of the evening -- leaving out the embarrassing bit where Maruko had gotten the better of her.

"The Clown Prince caught all of us and made us dress up like clowns!" Pin said, gritting her teeth and looking away. "And then he tickled us. A lot! He's got this machine in the attic, like a carnival ride... but you really don't want to ride it, believe me!"

"My friends are trying to get up there right now," Chris said, all three of them still scrunched up under the bed together. Their situation, along with Summer and Jaime's undertaking, seemed completely stupid when told to an escaping clown girl. Having talked to her, Chris could tell they were the same age, which just made it worse.

"Duh!" Pin said, amazed at Chris-and-crew's cluelessness. "If we don't stop 'em, they're just gonna get caught and... well, the Clown Prince asked everyone about you guys when he first caught us, and he's got three special slots in that machine marked 'Reserved.' You figure it out."

"Then we have to catch up to them and convince them that this whole thing is stupid, like I've been saying!"

"There isn't even a chance I'm going back upstairs! Let's get out now, while we can, call the cops... and they'll probably send back a SWAT team before your friends get tickled to death."

"I... can't do that," Chris replied, realizing that no matter how nutty this caper was or how high the odds against them, she couldn't leave Summer and Jamie behind. "And if you try getting out on your own, you're going to get stuck in these gluey things they've got rigged in the ground. Even the henchpeople don't know where they all are! I know a safe way through the yard, but I won't tell you until I at least catch up with my friends and try to sell them on splitting."

The two glared at each other in the fog-filtered moonlight coming through the bedroom window, Mouse lying placidly between them.
1322212121222112.title: Moving with a pinch of grace

choices: Chris resorts to fisticuffs with the Clown Prince's kid sister!
Crispy's got more than a few tricks up her sleeve and outwits Chris!
13222121212221121.content:
Chris put up a determined front and, once again, Pin knuckled under.

"Fine," said the clown kid, gloomy about their prospects. "I'll try to bring you back the way I came, but I'm gone the moment it looks like trouble. When the Clown Prince's goons catch you two, you'll wish you'd run right out the back door."

Chris didn't say anything, because Pin was probably right. Mouse made for the best excuse to cut out, but she couldn't do that to Summer and Jamie; they'd both saved her plenty of times, and under more trying circumstances.

As they were headed upstairs, Pin took the lead, Chris close behind and Mouse trailing woodenly. Chris wished she'd come out of her trance, but didn't have any ideas on how to hasten Mouse's revival.

"They said something about a dumbwaiter," Chris whispered to Pin, the three girls creeping down the hallway.

"I hope they didn't try that!" Pin said, stopping dead with a look of alarm. "The Clown Prince is using it for a lure, and he even said he expected one of you to drop right into his hands that way!"

"Fantastic," said Chris, shaking her head. That had seemed a little obvious.

"Look, it's terrible timing, but I gotta go," Pin said, pressing at her middle and bouncing on her toes. Chris would have laughed, but then realized she was feeling a little pressed as well. "There's a bathroom just a few doors down, and if we do get grabbed, I'd rather not..."

"Don't mention it," Chris said, blushing. It hadn't happened to her yet, but last summer's run-in with Pao-Ting had been close. She'd been saved by Summer, just in time.

Pin led on to another nondescript door, though the hallway was picked up a bit better; there were no cobwebs, and someone had vacuumed the carpet.

Figuring they'd take turns, Chris was surprised when Pin ushered them into a sizable break room, narrow but long. There were a couple of vending machines, two microwaves, a fridge, and a coffee maker. The 'big top' flair had been kept to a minimum, confined to purple and green floor tiles and a few stripes of color winding along the walls. The fluorescent glow was a little harsh after the dim hallways, but Chris was still impressed.

"All right!" said Chris, looking around. "Is this the minions' lounge? Very corporate! I wonder if CP's hooked them up with a health plan, too?"

"Be right back," said Pin, walking quickly and carefully to a door at the far end of the break room. Chris checked the machines, saw that everything was free, and got two bottles of water for herself and Mouse. Her mouth had been a little dry since Maruko's performance.

Pin returned, putting her silk gloves back on -- which was sort of weird, because didn't she want to get out of that dumb costume? She could at least dump some of the stuff.

"Hurry!" Pin urged. "You never know when one of these guys will come in."

"Mouse, go and use the bathroom like normal, OK?" Chris directed, figuring Mouse definitely had to avail herself of the facilities by now. "It's clean, right?" Chris asked Pin, feeling a little creepy about sending Mouse in barefoot.

"What do you think CP had us do when we weren't getting tickled?" Pin asked, getting something to drink for herself. "Housework, in the high traffic areas -- and he inspects, because he loves to find things wrong, so he can... Look, it's spotless, don't worry."

Chris went in after Mouse, who'd apparently had no trouble with the basics despite her condition. As promised, it was spooky-clean. Chris regarded herself in the mirror, after, washing her hands and seeing she didn't look much worse for wear, given the night's activities. She even got her comb out and tidied up.

"Feeling better?" Pin asked, abandoning her fearful whisper, all trepidation gone. She'd sat Mouse down and was brushing the hypnotized kid's hair for her. "Fresh as a daisy?"

"What..." Chris began, confused, and then ducked as Pin's boutonnière squirted water at her.

"Darn it! That was what I needed the bathroom for -- the sink, for a refill! Chris, stand still and lemme squirt ya!"

"Something in the water?" asked Chris, gesturing at the bottle Pin had been drinking from. Maybe the stress had finally gotten to her?

"Well, sure," said Pin, mistaking Chris's point. "It just makes the squirtee a little suggestible, and I thought we'd have more fun if you loosened up!"

"What the heck, Pin?!" Chris demanded, pointing at the door they'd entered through, bars having slid into place on the inside.

"And you call yourself a sleuth?!" said Pin, laughing out loud. "The hat didn't give it away? It was a present from Pao! And my name?"

"Pin?" said Chris, looking around as she tried to figure how to play it. No coffee on, or she could have tried pouring a pot of joe on the clown girl.

"Crespina, though I usually go by 'Crispy,'" said the clown, standing up and taking a bow. "Or didn't you know the Clown Prince was my big brother?"

"NOOOO!!!" Chris howled, stomping in place and yanking her hair in irritation. "Another headache girl! It's like Scanners in here, tonight! My head's gonna explode!"

Crispy just laughed along, which was pretty laid back for a villain.

"Don't feel bad. I didn't expect Summer's little sister would be tagging along with you tonight. I'd planned for three, instead of four. I kinda like her, though!" Crispy went back to brushing Mouse's hair, as if there was nothing to worry about. "I was hoping to catch all three of you at once, but you and Mouse will get Summer and Jamie back down here, quick. I'll just put your squeals and begging over the intercom Pao rigged for us and tell 'em where you're at! I want you guys with me, not up in the attic."

"We'll see who winds up begging," said Chris, shrugging off her backpack and getting ready to scuffle. Maruko had been out of her league, but Chris figured she could pop Crispy in that big red clown nose and change her tune in a hurry.
13222121212221121.title: Spent a penny

choices: Crispy leaves Chris and Mouse to the GT Mk. 1, eager to catch Summer and Jamie
Crispy invites her rotten machine to do its worst - to all three of them! Nuts!
132221212122211212.content:
With the threat, dropped backpack, and rolled sleeves, Chris had pretty well telegraphed her intent. Crispy responded by casually snapping her wrist, producing a remote from somewhere up her clown sleeve, and hitting a button.

Chris voiced a surprised and embarrassing yelp as the floor dropped away beneath her. She landed in a chute formed of something soft and slippery, sliding down in darkness as she frantically grabbed for something to check her descent.

"A trapdoor?!" Chris shouted back up into the break room. "How cliché!"

It was a short ride, at least. Back down to the basement. Chris at first thought Crispy was delivering her to Pao, so it was something of a relief when she popped out of the chute and found herself in a cozy one-ring circus.

The circular hatch she'd slid through snapped shut behind her, part of a clown's mouth that was howling with laughter. There were lots more of those, the curved walls painted with shrieking clowns being tormented by feathers held in cartoony gloved hands. Chris gulped hard, realizing the giggling and guffawing she'd heard on entry wasn't part of some psych-out soundtrack.

The three clown girls who'd captured the rest of the gang earlier were squirming around not far from Chris, under assault by... Ugh! Cartoony gloved hands. Said gloves varied in size from teeny-tiny (for detail work) and too-friendly standard (the kind currently poking and stroking the clown girls) up to some really gargantuan mitts that could have grabbed Chris in one go, neck to ankles. The things were animated by some sort of black tubing, ridiculously flexible, that ran back up to a central box mounted on the ceiling. The most prominent marking on the device read "Gelotron Mk. 1"

"Oh, no," Chris said, groaning with apprehension and hugging her knees. Things were looking grim.

A spotlight snapped on, focusing to one side of the writhing clown girls, and Chris saw that Legs had been caught too! A pair of the larger gloves had grabbed its... her... axial sphere and deprived her of shoes and socks; left to hang in the air, a bunch of the smaller gloves were hard at work on Legs, colorful feathers dancing mercilessly along her rubber toes and soles. She was apparently ticklish, straining with a tortured mechanical whine against the gloves holding her ankles as her doll feet wriggled in every direction, seeking a moment's relief. Chris sat flummoxed... by disbelief at a machine being ticklish, by a strange affection for Legs at having (or at least mimicking) this vulnerability, and by a freakily enjoyable dread as she waited her turn.

None of the gloves seemed interested in her yet, so Chris tried to stand up and explore the general area. The footing was awkward, Crispy's one-room big top floored with the same stuff Chris had slid down on: shiny, purple, satiny stuff covering what felt like foam rubber, mooshy and slippery at the same time. It reminded Chris of her bounce house days, as was probably the point; the entire setup seemed designed to make you feel more childish and (Chris shuddered) susceptible. She lurched for balance and leaned against a wall, which was just as treacherous as the floor. Chris sank in to her wrist before sliding off and flopping down in a painless pratfall. She sat fuming, arms folded, hoping no one had seen her.

Spending a few maliciously gleeful moments watching the clown girls get it, Chris jumped as two panels snapped open behind her, delivering first Mouse and then Crispy.

"Don't be so formal, Chris," Crispy chided, seeming confused that Chris hadn't entered into the spirit of things. "Take your shoes off, at least." Crispy kicked off her own outsized sneakers, which were immediately snatched up and taken away by a pair of gloves.

"Round two!" Chris shouted, after a moment of indecision. Her haymaker not only missed Crispy completely, but threw her off balance and put her face-down on the soft floor.

"Ding ding ding!" Crispy shouted, stepping over gracefully and planting a toe-socked foot in the middle of Chris's back. "The winner, by technical knockout..."

Chris flipped around, almost losing her glasses, and grabbed Crispy in mid-tease.

But in a subdued echo of earlier events, Crispy turned out to be a much more accomplished grappler; she grabbed Chris right back, treating it as a game, and playfully wrestled the sleuth to a gasping standstill. Crispy laughed throughout, even as Chris looked for any opportunity to pop her in the face. Chris resented the heck out of being sat on twice in one night, but couldn't prevail between Crispy's hold and the cushiony flooring.

"Get off of me and let me beat you up properly," Chris suggested through gritted teeth, having enough dignity not to scream with rage. Crispy grinned down at her, taking a moment to consider it.

"Nah, that wouldn't be much fun for either of us," said Crispy. "Chris, why are you being so mean? I don't let just anyone in here, you know."

"Crispy!" gasped the nearest clown girl -- and she really had to work at it, sounding half-dead from being tickled. "C'mon! UNCLE!!"

Chris tilted her head back and got an inverted perspective. It was Lin the Sneer, and it was nice to hear the snotty girl pleading. Despite current circumstances.

"Oh, all right," Crispy responded, sounding vexed. "Release my miserable menials, GT."

Crispy spoke into a smiley face button on her collar, and Chris tilted her head back once again. Sure enough, the gloves laid off and left the three stooges in a sweaty, tearstained pile.

"And Legs, too!" Chris demanded, even if she wasn't exactly in the best position for it. Crispy lit up all the same, her grin slipping a few notches wider.

"Oh, Chris... how sweet! That makes up for me knocking my head on the box spring earlier, and all your hilarious bluster about trouncing me!" Crispy spoke into her smiley button once more. "OK, GT, stop tickling Junior... but don't let her go! Even barefoot, she's a menace!"

Crispy decided Chris was neutralized -- or at least not crazy enough to try anything when a single command would send several dozen eager gloves her way. She rolled off of Chris and stepped over to scold the clown sisters.

"If you guys hadn't blown it, I'd probably have all four of them down here, right now!" said Crispy, sounding genuinely disappointed at not collecting the entire set of junior detectives. "And since I got so justifiably steamed at your running around the house for yucks and then blaming it on poor Junior, you've now been entertained to the point of uselessness. So just... go to bed. Depending on how the rest of the night turns out, you might be back here in the morning."

The Thorn triplets didn't need any more of an invitation, and crawled their exhausted way to a proper door that opened in the mural of laughing clowns. Chris tried to note where it was, in case she had to knock a hole in it later. Assuming she'd still be in any condition for something so physical by then...

Chris had just given up on the idea of pounding Crispy and was considering how to stall her when the chief clown girl spun on a socked heel, regarding her captives with obvious excitement.

"Now," said Crispy, "Where were we?"
132221212122211212.title: A Laughing Place

choices: The Gelotron is so invested in breaking Chris and Crispy, it lets Mouse go
The Gelotron thinks Mouse is the perfect ticklee, giving up on Chris and Crispy
1322212121222112122.content:
"Ummm... you were going to help me find Summer and Jamie, so we could all have a great time in your... whatever you call this room?" Chris suggested. Anything to delay what looked like the inevitable.

"I still call it the Glove Box," said Crispy, looking sheepish. "Even though we wound up having to make it cylindrical like my Rotor Room because of whatever it is Pao's up to downstairs. It doesn't really matter, but I'd had my heart set on it being a perfect cube."

"So that room with the Tilt-A-Whirl car is yours, too?" Chris asked, stepping closer to Crispy, making their distance conversational rather than adversarial. "Are all those joke shop gags yours also? And how long did it take you guys to rebuild parts of the place? How'd you do it without anyone noticing?! I mean, it seems like a lot of work just to..."

"Chris, look," said Crispy, sighing with a forbearing smile as she shook her head. "You're not going to talk your way out of this, and you're not leaving this room without getting tickled. Thoroughly. Two or three times." The clown girl gave Chris a consoling pat on the arm, tossing her mandarin beanie away and preparing to issue dread commands to her smiley button.

"Wait!" Chris said, too loudly, hands up as she managed a nervous smile. "What about Mouse?"

"What about her?" Crispy asked, looking back at the younger girl. Mouse was still sitting as she'd slid down: feet straight out in front of her, staring at nothing. "She'll get tickled as much as you, don't worry."

"But she's still hypnotized, so how can she get tickled? Won't she just sit there?"

Crispy closed her eyes and nodded, clearly irritated with herself at overlooking that very obvious detail. Before Chris could pounce on Crispy as she walked over to Mouse, the pounce-ee outmaneuvered her.

"GT, make Chris comfortable and hang onto her for now. Stand by for introductions."

Chris backed away from the swarm of gloves slithering down at her, not noticing one had snuck up behind until it had grabbed the back of her belt and lifted her off the floor. She folded her arms and tried to look unflappable, fixing the back of Crispy's head with a withering scowl. Her pose evaporated when several gloves moved in, but they just wanted to get her hoodie off. Crispy looked back and grinned at Chris's anticipatory giggling, laughing out loud as Chris tried bicycling her legs to keep a half-dozen of the dinkiest gloves away from her feet... which only made the slow, torturous ceremony of unlacing and removing her shoes that much more agonizing.

"I want those back!!" Chris yelled, looking from gloves to Crispy for some acknowledgment. Crispy muttered something at her collar, and the Gelotron dropped Chris's hightops rather than tucking them away in the inaccessible storage nook per routine.

Chris watched as Crispy pulled something out of a pocket and waved it in front of Mouse's face. The kid recovered at once, though she was clearly at a loss as to what had happened.

"Where's Pao?" Mouse asked. "Did I miss the most merciless part?!"

Mouse made her way unsteadily toward Chris, trying to negotiate the smooshy floor and puzzle over Chris's predicament at the same time. She looked happier than Chris cared for at seeing the Gelotron, and responded with affable cheer as Crispy introduced herself. Chatting and shaking hands with their no-goodnik hostess, even!

"Mouse, I'm starting to wonder whose side you're on!" said Chris, trying to ignore all the gloves ranked around her. A pair dipped down, grabbed one of her shoes, and brought it back up near her face; one held the hightop as the other suggestively ran its tiny gloved fingers along the rubber sole.

"So, Chris... where are you most ticklish?" Crispy inquired, capitalizing on Chris's discomfiture with precise, aggravating enunciation. Chris just yanked on her hair in "Headache!" mode without uttering a word.

"Under her arms!" Mouse blurted, looking surprised. "That's where everybody's most ticklish! Crispy, you've probably watched your machine tickle all sorts of people, so quit kidding that you don't know the First Law of Ticklishness!"

Chris noticed Crispy becoming even more charmed by Mouse, now that the kid was unhypnotized and back to spouting Mouse-isms. Maybe she could use that to her advantage, somehow?

The GT switched its grab on Chris, abandoning the increasingly uncomfortable belt-dangle in exchange for a larger, more comfortable glove around her waist. Chris struggled in the grip, just to see if a decent squirm would get her anywhere... but the hold was La-Z-Boy cushy and straitjacket-stubborn.

Taking a more technical interest in the Gelotron's mitts, Chris grabbed the tiny glove still immodestly stroking her sneaker and had a closer look. The thing's "arm," black as pitch with the approximate diameter of a garden hose, had the feel of latex filled with warm jelly. It made no mechanical sense to her. She'd expected a more solid frame, finely segmented to allow for the arms' weird plasticity.

The hands were just as supple, if not so yielding. The white glove was sort of slippery and fuzzy at the same time, its material gathered into three distinctive black darts at the back and rolled at the arm to imply a join with a non-existent wrist. Three fingers, one thumb. The little glove put up with Chris's prodding and poking before gently twisting in her grasp and tickling her palm. She let go at once, scoffing.

"It doesn't even make any sense!" Chris said, deeply annoyed that she was about to be undone by something whose operation she couldn't explain.

"Remind me to get you the FAQ later," said Crispy, smirking at Chris's uncompromising rationality. "GT, I think Chris has been sitting around long enough to gather dust. Give 'er the glove test!"

One of the many gloves queued around Chris's middle eagerly complied, worming under her purple "Night of the Uncool" T-shirt and tracing across her belly, right to left. Chris grabbed for the intruder, shivering... and had her grabbing hand caught at the wrist and lifted above her head by a second glove; the first continued checking along her ribs and under her arms, one stroke for each. She relaxed a little despite her ill-tempered groan at being so casually handled; objections aside, it felt sort of nice.

The inspection wasn't complete until Chris had her neck, knees, and feet fingered; the single stroke down her right sole dragged her sock halfway off, so the glove doubled back to yank the dangling article loose and repeat on her bare foot. Chris bit back a laugh, but couldn't repress an even more embarrassing snort as her foot tried for orbit.

The inspecting glove dutifully held out its index finger for Crispy to examine, the smaller gloves producing score cards ranking Chris's sensitivity -- which indicators the three girls took immediate interest in.

"I don't believe it!" said Crispy, pleased with the numbers. "Chris, we've got exactly the same rating! It's like being sisters. Cool!"

"It's not an Olympic event!" said Chris, trying to slap her right hand over her eyes in disbelief... except it was still grabbed by a glove, so she had to use her left.

"Maybe you guys should get married!" suggested Mouse, teasing Crispy for her enthusiasm. "We could have the wedding right here, and your tickling machine could mess around at the last minute trying to find the ring, and..."

That was as far as Mouse got, two gloves launching for her ribs and putting her on the floor with a surprised shriek. Chris was intrigued to see Crispy had just angled a thumb at the pesky kid, no voice command needed. So how did the Gelotron sense things? How did it 'think?'

"I know what you're thinking," Crispy said to Chris, talking loudly enough to be heard over Mouse's ticklish squeals. "I'm going to leave you guys alone, not resting until I catch Summer and Jamie, too. And then you'll find some sneaky, technical way to escape while I'm gone -- maybe even catch me and turn the tables, and bring me back down here for a taste of my own medicine."

"Sounds like a plan," Chris said, heaving a sigh. She didn't have the same faith in her abilities that Crispy did. Once the Gelotron started in on her, she'd be out of commission. Not that there was anything to be gained by letting Crispy know that, so let her sweat!

"Only I've decided they're not as important anymore, and I'm not going to burn myself with the expected villainous overreach. I'm happy with you and Mouse! So we'll all stay and have fun together."

"Thrilling," said Chris, making a face. She hoped Summer and Jamie were doing better, wherever they were.

"GT, make it a Grand Tour for me and my guests!"

Another big glove dropped down to grab Crispy, and a number of smaller hands matching Chris's complement formed up and readied themselves for the clown girl's annihilation.

"What's that going to prove?" Chris asked, gulping as she wondered what exactly a 'Grand Tour' consisted of. It sounded awful!

"I want to see if our numbers really match up," Crispy whispered, cutting her eyes at the GT's primary assembly and winking. "And it'll be fun! My current batch of subordinates aren't very amusing, so it's been a bore lately."

"Then I'll do everything I can to be really, really boring!" said Chris, eyes wide as the GT's gloves passed several feathers among themselves, seemingly bickering over the choicer offerings.

"And just saying stuff like that makes you anything but boring, Chris!" said Crispy, grinning. "I want a red one, GT, and... oh, you're way ahead of me! Purple for Chris, that's right. Go ahead and use all the rest on Mouse!"

"So can you... stop it... if it gets... too terrible?" Chris asked, trying to duck away from the purple feather being used on her chin and ears. The GT was going to start gently and work its way up to maddening, it seemed. Fiendish!

"What would be the point?" Crispy replied, wincing as she blew at the feather dancing around her own face -- Chris was relieved to see she wasn't a complete masochist. "If you know you can end things just by saying the word, where's the challenge?"

"Challenge?!" Chris gaped, scrunching her shoulders up as her neck got feathered. "What if you can't stand it? Because I'm already there!"

"You have to, because there's no escape. For either of us! Duh!"
1322212121222112122.title: Tough, to be so cool...

choices: "Let's see who can hold out the longest!"
"I wanna know which one of you has the dumbest laugh!"
13222121212221121221.content:
"Wait, wait!" Chris yelled, trying in vain to pull her bared foot away from the strokes of her own personal purple feather. "Let's make this more interesting!"

The GT stopped tickling without input from Crispy, though it finished peeling the clown girl's socks off and came back to claim the one Chris was still wearing.

"I think this is interesting enough!" said Crispy, grinning. "You're going to fight right up to the end, Chris, aren't you? That's the spirit!"

Chris's heart was pounding, and seeing Mouse under full feathery assault was no help. The GT had taken Crispy literally, employing every feather it had (except two, darn it) against Summer's sister. Mouse was on her back with her feet in the air, tee-heeing to her heart's content as the GT's automated mitts meticulously introduced a rainbow of plumes to the girl's soles. To actually enjoy being tickled... it was too weird for Chris to understand.

What she did understand was that she had to come up with something, fast, or risk losing her mind in Crispy's warped playroom. The obvious course suggested itself.

"You say our rating for ticklishness or whatever matches, right?"

"Well, GT does," said Crispy, whispering as she rolled her eyes. "I'm not convinced. Only we'll both get tickled to death if it tries to justify its figures, so just pretend."

Gulp!

"OK... so since we're both exactly as ticklish as each other everywhere, how about a little bet? Have GT tickle us both -- at the same time, in precisely the same way -- and see who laughs first!"

"And if it's me, I let you and Mouse go - otherwise you'll stay here forever and ever as my loyal tickle slaves, blah blah blah. Something like that?"

"'Loyal tickle slaves' wasn't what I had in mind if I lost, but..."

"Chris, the thing is, I like laughing, and I especially like hearing other people laugh! If you somehow manage to slip out of here without a single hysterical shriek, I'll be devastated! How about a contest to see which one of us can come up with the goofiest laugh while getting tickled? That would be interesting!"

"Oh, that's so subjective!" Chris complained, disappointed that Crispy hadn't jumped on the idea of her wager at once. "Who's going to decide whose laugh is goofier, anyway?"

Mouse, who'd by now given over to an uninhibited round of hiccupping titters, volunteered without realizing it. Crispy looked at the kid and considered, nodding to herself.

"Mouse sounds like she has a pretty ridiculous laugh! And since I know she's not as eager to get out of here as you are, I could consider her unbiased."

"I couldn't, for just that reason!"

"She tagged along with you guys because she wants to prove she's a competent junior detective, right?"

"Yeah... and now look at her!"

Chris privately had to admit that Mouse would be happier saving her big sister and playing mascot on future cases rather than hanging around and getting tickled, though. Crispy noticed Chris silently relenting on the point and made it official.

"GT, quit feathering Mouse and bring her over here to us."

"Hey!" Mouse complained, frowning as she was hustled over between Chris and Crispy at the behest of several dozen gloved hands. "Why don't I get to get tickled more?! I wasn't ready to be let go! I keep getting cheated!"

"It's a bet, Mouse, and you can be the judge," Crispy told her, explaining her idea and Chris's.

"I'll count it as a laugh even if you bite your tongue and snort!" said Mouse, pointing a finger at Chris.

Chris nodded, scowling. If nothing else, she'd bought herself a little bit of time without being tickled.

"What'll it be, Mouse?" Crispy asked, sounding a little nervous. "A test of endurance, or comic sensibility?"

Mouse thought about it for several seconds, finally saying...
13222121212221121221.title: Playin' for time

choices: Crispy convinces Chris to head back to her hideout with the sleeping Mouse
Chris tries to wake Mouse so they can continue their investigation
132221212122211212211.content:
Chris could see Mouse thinking it over. However nice Crispy might be, she was still the Clown Prince's sister. Who knew how she'd react if Chris won? And if Chris didn't win, what then? Crispy hadn't mentioned what she had in mind for them if they lost, but it had to be something dire.

Fortunately, Mouse went with the option Chris had more practice with.

"Ha! Let's see who can hold out the longest!" said Mouse, giving Chris an evil grin. Mouse made it look good (Chris had known the kid long enough to recognize her truly evil grin, and this one was a put-on), so Crispy traded her cheerless sigh for a smirk, thinking Mouse was rooting for her.

"And no clown tricks!" Chris warned, which made Crispy laugh out loud.

"What sort of 'clown tricks' do you figure..." Crispy began.

"She laughed, Mouse! We're out of here! GT, put me down!"

"Chris, it's gotta be a laugh because she was getting tickled," Mouse explained, trying to sound very patient and grown-up.

"The old Salt integrity!" Crispy said. "I knew I could trust you, Mouse!"

"Let's get this over with," Chris grumbled, thinking it should have counted. Now she'd have to get tickled!

The Gelotron was quick to oblige, bringing the purple and red feathers back into play. Both Chris and Crispy scrunched their toes and winced as their feet were gently tickled, gritting their teeth once the strokes became more insistent. The gloves that had been working on Mouse added their own gossamer urgency to the mix, and soon Mouse couldn't see either girl from the ankles down for all the gloves and feathers.

Not feeling the need to protest the treatment for form's sake, Chris had been confused: the feathers felt kind of good... not terrible, but tickly in an almost relaxing way. The bad part was that she couldn't giggle, which was what she most wanted to do right then. She glanced over at Crispy every so often, satisfied that her competitor was having just as hard a time of it.

She started to squirm, but the fluffy nimbus of ordeal tracked her feet through every wiggle and contortion she could manage. Chris squeezed her eyes shut tight enough to see stars, a single tear rolling down her cheek.

Finally, she started to gasp, which was a prelude to a giggle. She tried to get herself under control, but it was no use. With a despairing squeal, Chris gave in and started to laugh.

Except... so did Crispy. The GT stopped feathering the contestants, putting the quills away in apparent defeat.

Mouse was agape.

"Wow! You guys both laughed at exactly the same time, I swear it! GT, what do you think?"

The gloves paired up by size and showed their palms, indicating a collective shrug. GT flashed its score cards again, the rest of the gloves pointing at the numbers.

"I guess it's true!" said Mouse. "You guys are exactly as ticklish as each other! On your feet, anyway. With feathers."

Chris and Crispy didn't care to hear it, both of them sullen at having survived an intolerable amount of foot-feathering with no determination of a winner.

"Who laughed harder, then?" Chris demanded, knowing that was irrelevant. Again, Mouse confirmed a deadlock.

The GT took initiative, a swarm of featherless gloves returning for direct investigation. Chris and Crispy both went ballistic in perfect synch, screaming with laughter as their feet were overwhelmed by silk-fingered irresistibility.

Chris felt like she'd had the wind knocked out of her, waiting to see if her lungs would go sailing past her teeth and land on Mouse. It TICKLED! Attention from Crispy's dreadful device wasn't anything like being tickled by another person, or even a bunch of people. Her intellectual estimate of a worst-case outcome to this gamble had just been swept aside. This could potentially be lethal! That, or her transcripts would be forwarded to the local acorn academy...

Cringing, Chris peeked at Mouse once she'd caught her breath. And again, it was worse than losing! Another tie!

"Try someplace else instead of their feet, GT!" suggested Mouse, the gloves already in motion.

Chris had been required to memorize and recite all 132 lines of a particular poem last year, and 'eternity in an hour' now made direct personal sense to her - in the space of a couple minutes! There was no question of stinting on the laughs, and there were gloves left spare to grab and hold her when she started thrashing too much. Chris had a feeble awareness that Crispy was getting massacred as well, but didn't think much of it. Once upon a time, she remembered making a bet over who could keep from laughing.

Chris found out her tummy was more ticklish than her feet, which retired one of the enduring theories of her first decade. She also rediscovered that trying to crush her arms against her sides was no effective defense against fingers in her armpits, and that GT didn't find desperate elbows any sort of obstacle.

Eventually, GT lowered both Chris and Crispy to the floor, and the girls immediately tried to squirm away to safety on their bellies. They were caught by their ankles at once and slowly dragged under the massed gloves again, given something to squirm about. Chris tried to defend her stomach and got a dozen gloves swarming over her soles in answer. She tried to draw her legs beneath her and felt gloves sliding under her shirt and going for her armpits again. As redness pounded at edge of her vision in time with her frantic pulse, she glanced over and saw Crispy wasn't doing any better. Mouse was still standing by, dodging as needed when the two victims thrashed too near, lecturing the ticklees about how they should be conducting themselves. Thankfully, even GT wearied of Mouse's chiding and added her to the mix.

After not very many minutes following the start of hostilities, Chris and Crispy were beyond demanding the particulars of "Who won?" and trying to ignore just how sweaty, tearstained, and generally ravaged they must look to each other. Mouse was still a thrashing blond indistinctness powered by screeches and squeals nearby, but graduated to complete prostration soon enough.

GT slapped its gloves together, as though dusting its hands off following a piece of work done well, and retreated to its main housing. Chris watched the gloves -- even the huge ones -- somehow deflate themselves before rolling up in a symmetrical mass of arms' lengths for storage. It even let go of Legs, despite Crispy's earlier order, but the automated doll gams were content to walk along the mooshy floor in obvious enjoyment of the soft surface rather than approaching to kick helpless butt.

The Mk. 1, undeployed, trundled off via a powered locomotion link in the ceiling and disappeared through a panel in the far wall. There was a burst of kaleidoscopic light, calliope music, and a whiff of popcorn before the egress snapped shut again.

Chris and Crispy both tried to sit up at the same time and fell back, whupped.

"Draw?" Chris asked, eyes on the ceiling.

"Uh huh," replied Crispy, without any reluctance.

Mouse, impartial judge that she was, responded with the slow, steady respiration of a kid pressed to her limits and zonked as a result.
132221212122211212211.title: Don't pull no punches

choices: Chris surrenders, she and Crispy carrying Mouse to Crispy's chambers

1322212121222112122111.content:
"We should go back to my place," said Crispy, struggling to a kneel with effort and adjusting her clown nose. Her makeup had run a little, and Chris glanced at her with a smirk.

"No way!" Chris said, managing to stand. "No winners, no losers! We don't have to stay around! And your enforcer's gone to bed, I guess, so you don't have any way to keep us here!"

Chris flinched as Legs strode over, apparently attracted by the sleuth's insistence on her freedom. Expecting a kick in the pants, Chris was nonplussed when the doll legs stopped, heels angled outward as the toes took turns hiding under opposite insteps. Now what?! Legs was acting all bashful instead of tromping around like a respectable engine of derrière-booting doom.

"Uh oh, Chris!" Crispy warned her, grinning. "I think Junior's got a crush on you! Watch it!"

"Gimme a break!" said Chris, weirded out. "You told her to mess with me or something. Call her off!"

Crispy just laughed as Legs extended a foot and playfully brushed against one of Chris's own. The rubber was warm and pliable, but a little large and ungainly for this gesture of... affection? Ewww!

"Get this thing off of me!" Chris complained, moving around the currently gloveless Glove Box to get her stuff back. She had her glasses, pack, and footwear gathered in short order, but Legs was following her at a respectful distance and getting some accomplished Footsie Fu moves in the entire time. Chris realized there'd be no way to get her shoes and socks back on with this sort of stalking playfulness, and once again shouted at Crispy to get Legs under control.

"I can't help it!" said Crispy, looking like the last thing in the world she wanted to do right then was laugh. "She gets real sweet before bedtime!"

Chris tried to stomp one of the doll feet when it darted in to nudge her ankle again, but Legs sandwiched Chris's kicking foot between her own and indulged the young investigator with a rubbery kneading. Chris shouted about how awkward this all seemed, and Crispy was back on the floor again.

"No more!" Crispy gasped, holding her sides as if she was on her way to a life-threatening giggle. Chris felt a little bad for her, as she knew the clown girl really couldn't have wanted to laugh after what they'd been through. "Chris, please! Stop!!"

"Well, it's not my fault," said Chris, taking some spiteful cheer in Crispy's giggling agony. "Legs is in LUV with me, and I don't have the heart to put the kibosh on her crush, you know?"

Without any fingers poking her, Crispy was past the point of begging -- again! Chris sneered and met Legs, footsie for footsie, elevating their little dance to a burlesque that kept Crispy incapacitated. Mouse snored through the entire thing, of course.

Chris decided to go for the kill, dropping to grab a big rubber dolly foot. Squeezing the instep, Chris watched as Legs lost control and collapsed on the floor, her central orb bouncing off the plunkety surface as her toes wiggled in rapture.

Soon, Legs was foot massaged into a Mouse-like torpor, and Crispy's face had drooled a little further down her chin with more unwilling tears. Chris thought she could even see some actual skin under the greasepaint.

"I'm nearly dead!" Crispy complained, catching her breath. "I could sleep for twelve hours!"

"Tell me about it," said Chris, letting up on the deactivated Legs to get her socks and hightops on. A glance at her watch showed it was just after midnight. There was no school tomorrow, but there had been today -- or, errr, yesterday -- and Chris had been up for sixteen hours... sixteen hours with a relentless cherry on top, thanks to GT. She wanted nothing more than to go home and crawl into bed, and the idea of getting the best of the Clown Prince before dawn made her want to weep with exhaustion. Even the thought of trying to find Summer and Jamie to convince them to leave now and come back fresh tomorrow afternoon seemed miserable.

"You could sleep over, if you wanted!" Crispy offered.

Chris rolled her eyes.

"And then have my mom find out in the morning that I wasn't home all night, only she'll think I got kidnapped, and then my sleuthing career is sunk and I have to take piano lessons every day after school until I'm 45 and a half. Thanks, Crispy, but I need to get moving."

"What about Mouse, then?"

"She'll be a screaming, cranky mess, but it comes with the territory. Geez. We need to solve mysteries on Saturdays, I think."

"You'd be a lot happier if you'd just trust me," said Crispy, raising her clown eyebrows in an impeccable "I've got a secret!" pantomime.
1322212121222112122111.title: Footsie Blockade

13222121212221121221111.content:
"What?" Chris asked, giving up. Even the idea of walking home seemed agonizing.

"Give me a hand with Mouse, and I'll show you," said Crispy. They each grabbed an arm and hoisted Mouse upright. The kid mumbled in her sleep, but didn't complain as they carried her along.

They were heading for the door Crispy's clown girls had crawled through earlier, and the Thorn triplets appeared just as Crispy was preparing to open it.

"Why'd you let her keep her shoes, boss?" Lin the Sneer complained, seeing Chris still in her hightops. "Didn't even have her tickled until she passed out? Gettin' soft?"

Chris saw the clown girls were carrying their shoes, since trying to negotiate the smooshy Glove Box floor in heels would be impossible. She considered stomping Lin's toes, but wasn't sure how Crispy would take it.

Crispy was already scowled out, debating whether or not to chastise Lin, and decided it would depend on a certain result.

"Did the rest of my package arrive?" Crispy asked, digging in a pocket with her right hand. She must have plenty of other firepower, because Lin looked pale and nervous right away.

"Yeah, they slid down just before we woke up," said Lin. "We kept it pretty light, but they look like they're ready for bed. No endurance."

"Aww, they're just kids," said Lee, leaning forward to smooth Mouse's hair. This close, Chris had to wonder how they'd recovered so quickly. Even though it had seemed like hours in GT's clutches, Chris could see it hadn't been more than about twenty minutes. Ouch! Maybe Lin had a point about endurance.

Except the triplets had been blubbering, tear-stained wrecks when they'd slithered out on their bellies, so how did they look all bright-eyed and flawless in so short of a time? 'Before we woke up,' Lin said? Like they had time for a nap!

Lis was quietly pointing out to her sisters that Legs was slumbering, but Crispy headed off their revenge with a direct order.

"Since I got what I wanted, you guys are off guard duty for now," Crispy told them. "Go down and see if Lottie needs any more help with Pao's stuff. You had plenty of time to sleep and goof off, so get to work. And leave Junior alone! If you wake her up now, she'll really do a number on you."

The triplets sighed and minced over to another hidden panel in the laughing clown mural. They stepped into a lift and storked to get their shoes on as the doors closed. Chris thought that was as good a reason for a refreshed Mouse as any: there were so many secret panels around this place that the kid's weird ability to find hidden passages would be indispensable.

"If I was really corny, I'd say 'Welcome to my universe!' or something," said Crispy, urging Chris through the door her henchgirls had issued from. Chris shied away at once, because several of GT's mitts immediately poked out. But they were just interested in grabbing Mouse.

"Put her to bed, GT, and then stand by," said Crispy, and Mouse was whisked off.

Chris poked her head around the doorframe suspiciously, not pleased with losing Mouse again, and ducked right back out.

"And you thought GT didn't make any sense?" Crispy teased Chris. "You're not going to believe the FAQ on this one!"

Chris had another peek, reasoning it could all be done with mirrors, but the sense of space was too compelling. Plus, the staircase/roller coaster/Habitrail thing was surrounded by a massive black and white scrim, and Chris could hear the curtain rippling all the way up as it stirred in a whiff of breeze from... where? The Twilight Zone? You'd have to stack three Featherton Manors on top of one another to fit this whatchamacallit inside.

"Bet you'll want to stay until you figure this out, right?" Crispy asked, sounding a little excited. Chris didn't answer, stepping into Crispy's flipped out pad and looking around. It didn't help much.

Once again, the... space... was cylindrical. Chris was starting to feel like she was being held hostage in a series of Pringles cans. The floor was made of tinted black and white tiles, and she could see other floors beneath her, which was as creepy as the eleven or so levels above. The central space had a huge set of spiral stairs with -- it was still there, and didn't make any more sense up close -- a roller coaster track tracing around it, and some of that translucent conduit that hamsters run around in stuck between the coaster track and the stairs, though the tubing was big enough for a person. Chris hoped Crispy didn't have giant rodents running around in there, but at this point nothing would surprise her.

The staircase wrapped around a column of dark mahogany with doors set at even intervals at each landing. If you were to stand on the stairs and look straight at one of those doors, you could pretend you were in a New England boarding school because your parents wanted to get back a refined young lady at the end of term. If you pulled a 180°, you were on a Victorian landing dropped from low orbit that had crashed into Space Mountain after smacking into a stray Chuck E. Cheese on the way down.

And even though Crispy had up the world's biggest collection of carnival posters all along the stairwell, the color still seemed to be overwhelmed by all the black and white. The carpet on the stairs was black and white, along with the banister (the shafts alternated), and the hamster chute was translucent black plastic with a barely discernible white interior, and the coaster tracks were black tubular steel with white struts. The whole shebang was swathed with the big black and white striped curtain, a flap of which had been folded back to allow access through the door leading back into Featherton Manor. The decrepit mansion now seemed a lot less weird, and walking home didn't seem like such a terrible idea.

"Uh, Crispy?" Chris said, having to say something. "Look. I'm just a plain old junior sleuth, and poking around abandoned mansions looking for bad guys is pretty much the limit of what I deal with. Sure, sometimes you get caught and tickled, but that's the life. I don't really know how to handle alternate realities, or whatever you've got going on in here. So I'm going to go back out and pretend this never happened. Bring back Mouse, help me find Summer and Jamie, and we'll all split... maybe come back later on today after we sleep and shower and have breakfast and stuff. It'll be our secret!"

"Oh, Chris, don't be such a wet blanket!" Crispy said, grabbing Chris by the arm and dragging her further in. "I thought you'd love it in here! Anyway, Summer and Jamie are already waiting in another room. They tried taking that obvious dumbwaiter after all, and it dumped them down into one of my traps! I knew you guys would fall for that one!"

Chris, having had a really weird night so far...

Especially Chris, who seemed to have a taste for playful kinky fun and was often the ringleader of such games. Jamie seemed to have a fascination with tickling s/he was trying to keep secret also, but s/he clearly had a more submissive streak; s/he loved and feared it, being probably the most ticklish person in the group, and while s/he'd join in with quiet amazement into whatever Chris was plotting, s/he kept being reserved lest s/he found himself the target of Chris' newest team building exercise.

13223111.content:
Even as they were waiting, Chris couldn't stop thinking about how she could get her fingers on her friends' frightfully ticklish bodies. She had come up with a plan.

"Alright guys, I have a proposal." she announced as soon as Mouse emerged from the back room. "I think we all agree that we are still unprepared to fight a real bad guy head-on, so we should try working on our skills first."

"What did you have in mind?"

"Oh you know - team building, learning practical skills, building up resistance...That kind of thing..."
She picked up the hairbrush from the nightstand.
"Basically" she said, turning around , "We should tickle each other."

"What!" Mouse shouted. "I don't see how that would help us, right Summer?"
Summer though unexpectedly looked hesitant.
"We-ell, the Clown Prince DOES seem to like to tie up and tickle us more than usual recently...
Maybe trying a few things out first could be useful.
"Right! It'll be like a practice session, right Summer? I bet you could learn all sorts of things!"
Summer nodded. "Alright, I'm in."

"What!"
"Okay, so here are the rules!" Chris said, ignoring Mouse's cry. "We'll have two rounds of one-on-one tickle fights, to find out who among us are the two weakest. Then we'll try to train them to do better. Um. By tickling them some more."
"Er, why?" Summer asked.
"Well, if someone gets tickled a lot, their body grows used to it. Check it in your sleuthing books if you don't believe me."

"I'm not sure if I agree to this" Mouse yelped.

"But you want to be seen as a grown up detective right? You know there are some things detectives must do, right?"
Mouse didn't say anything.
The all put their names in the box, even Mouse, hesitantly.

Chris reached and pulled out two of the four bits of paper.

"Alright, the first round is...Mouse VS Chris!"
Mouse's heart sank.
"'C'mon, that's not fair!" Mouse complained. "You're like, twice as big as me and only half as ticklish."
"Okay, so you admit that you're not strong enough to come with us on adventures, then?"

Mouse gasped; she could not take step back without admitting that she was too young.
"I...Dammit. Fine. Fine. Just...Try to give me an advantage or something."
"Alright! Hmmm...Oh, I know! You'll get to wear your socks. That should provide you with some protection."

They waited until Mouse picked out some kitty stripe socks and put them on her feet, then reluctantly took her place opposite Chris on the mat.

Chris charged ahead and she laughed as she took Mouse down without any difficulty. Mouse tried to reach out to tickle her sides, but her wrists were grabbed with ease by Chris and forced behind her back, then Chris forced Mouse to lie down on the ground and turned her around onto her stomach.
"I knew it! Chris is a big fat cheater!" Mouse shouted while the laughing Chris secured her legs, and she even had time to reach behind her back and give Mouse's sides a quick tickle, who couldn't move away at all.
She then ran her fingers alongside her two legs.
Mouse banged on the ground as her socks were peeled off effortlessly, being of no use at all.

Mouse had cute plump little feet, with short toes and arches.
Chris loved playing with them, while Mouse did not enjoy her situation at all.
She licked her lips as she started with stroking her arches.
"Does lil' Susie have ticklish little toes?" Chris cooed. Mouse screamed-laughed as Chris spider-tickled along her soles and then started to pinch and stroke around her toes one by one.

A little exhausted from the excitement, Chris turned and flipped Mouse around oton her back, and started squeezing her sides.
"Well do you give up yet? Huh? Do you."she asked the shrieking Mouse into her face.

Mouse squirmed but tried to keep it in and contain her smile, and bring down her two arms to protect herself.
But Chris cruelly grabbed them, and pulled both arms above her head, then started spider-tickling her underarms.
Mouse flailed her head around, and took about 20 seconds before she realized that there was no point, there was no way she could win this.

"I give a-ha-hap! Just let me go! LET ME GO!!"
Chris stood up letting the panting Mouse have a break, and wiped her forehead, satisified.

"Alright, lil' Susie has lost. Tie her up, girls."

"Dammit, that's why I told you I didn't want to do this!" Mouse complained while the other two grabbed her and tied her down to Summer's big bed.

"Wait" Chris said. "We only have two beds. Move her to her own room, instead."

Mouse's and Summer's rooms were on the opposite sides of a long corridor, so if both doors were open, you could see what was happening in the other room. Mouse's stuff was swept aside from the sheets and she was tied on her own bed.
She was stretched out, her tiny feet hanging over the end and flapping about and her two arms hanging above her head.

"Alright, the next round is Summer vs Jamie." Chris announced.

Summer and Jamie circled around on the mat for a while, then suddenly Summer pounced and grabbed Jamie by the waist, and they both fell on the ground...
